showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been going to this gym for a little more than a year now and mostly I like it as it close to my house and it has a pool and sauna which I enjoy sometimes. But there‚Äôs also at least one machine/equipment broken down almost all the time recently so I can‚Äôt really have a workout I plan on the day.
One of the shower taps in the women lockers has been running water non stop for almost a week and these news about a price increase now are making me think of changing for some better gym around.
showerReviews.author: yulia kyrpych

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been attending the gym at Hough End for almost a year now so my review is mostly about the gym. I would start by saying the staff and PTs are lovely, but a lot of fault relates to the cost of a membership vs the facilities. I am lucky I'm on a student membership but wouldn't justify the full price when this ends, but this is still double my previous gym membership elsewhere. As far as I know, you can't have a gym membership by itself without the full facilities so if you're just looking for a gym I don't think the monthly cost justifies this one.

Pros: lovely staff, a lot of racks and a very fair range of equipment, kept clean mostly (sometimes I have black on my hands after using any pull up bars and some weights but find this is normal for busy gyms). Aside from groups of some young kids everyone is super respectful and keeps to themselves in the gym, surprisingly you don't get that everywhere.

Cons: A lot of equipment is old and broken (damaged weights), always weights everywhere at the time I attend

Cable machines also need some TLC, most of them are rusty, worn .etc

Pretty much all of the benches are wonky. If you're looking for the 1.25kg plates they're all under the benches to keep them stable, again the wheels seem to be worn some worse then others

For some reason a lot of the racks are not straight/aligned to the wall which is super awkward

Some of the rack parts are also worn down, so when the bar is re-racked it's uneven and awkward when finishing a heavy set, some of them so bad you go a bit mad thinking you've put one side on the wrong wrung but it's just so worn down that the bar is tilted

The water fountain always seems to be broken and can't fill up water bottle fully

While I appreciate it's a community gym, most days at around 3pm the lady's locker room stinks of weed (not sure how the front desk don't notice this) and sometimes there are groups of kids in the gym (with a teacher maybe?) who are extremely disruptive, which is a bit annoying for paid members, of course they have a right to be there as well but would be nice if they were properly supervised

Not fault of the gym but the app absolutely sucks. I miss fob access to gyms! I thought at least the app would be useful for timetables e.g. swimming but after a year I still don't understand when I can go swimming, this not making full use of the membership.

It feels like although the cost has recently increased there is not enough investment in the gym equipment and gym facilities.
showerReviews.author: Victoria EM

showerReviews.reviewText:
Serious safeguarding and dignity breach affecting a disabled woman at Hough End Leisure Centre (Better/GLL ‚Äì Manchester City Council contract):A disabled woman who uses a wheelchair experienced a serious breach of privacy and dignity at Hough End Leisure Centre, which is operated by Better (GLL) under contract with Manchester City Council.
On 10 July 2025, she was using the locked, RADAR key disabled changing room when a male member of staff, assisting another customer, opened the door and entered the room despite her loudly and repeatedly stating that the room was occupied and that she was a disabled woman getting changed. She was partially undressed at the time. After this intrusion, the door was left unsecured, which she only discovered after dressing and leaving the room, while already in considerable distress.
The incident left her feeling humiliated, unsafe and unable to trust the facility. She cancelled her membership immediately. She then pursued a formal complaint with both Better/GLL and Manchester City Council.
In writing, the Council has accepted that her privacy and dignity were not protected and that both GLL and Manchester City Council share responsibility for the incident. Nevertheless, the practical outcome was extremely limited:
‚Ä¢	Better/GLL have relied heavily on vague references to ‚Äúlearning‚Äù and ‚Äútraining‚Äù without clear, dated, verifiable safeguards.
‚Ä¢	Manchester City Council has described the incident as a ‚Äújudgement call‚Äù by staff and has denied any wider ‚Äúsystemic failure‚Äù, despite the combination of a lock override, lack of an ‚Äúoccupied‚Äù indicator, entry after shouted objections, and failure to secure the door afterwards.
‚Ä¢	The tangible remedy offered to the woman has been a refund and three months‚Äô free membership, which she understandably declined.
The Local Government & Social Care Ombudsman later decided not to investigate further on the basis that the Council had apologised and offered what it viewed as a ‚Äúproportionate‚Äù remedy. That does not mean the incident was minor or acceptable; it simply means that, procedurally, the Ombudsman was satisfied that the Council had done the minimum required within its own framework.
From an objective, safeguarding perspective this case is deeply troubling:
‚Ä¢	A locked accessible changing room, used by a disabled woman in a state of undress, was accessed from outside despite clear warnings.
‚Ä¢	The door was then left unsecured, compounding the violation.
‚Ä¢	The systems and culture in place allowed this to happen, and subsequent responses have minimised any suggestion of systemic failure.
This incident is particularly alarming for women with disabilities, who are at heightened risk of harm and rely on accessible facilities being genuinely private and secure. The combination of:
‚Ä¢	male staff override access,
‚Ä¢	absence of reliable ‚Äúoccupied‚Äù indicators, and
‚Ä¢	minimisation of the incident as a one off ‚Äúmistake‚Äù
should concern any woman, and especially any disabled woman, considering using these facilities.
In short:
‚Ä¢	The facts are documented and not seriously disputed.
‚Ä¢	The woman‚Äôs dignity and privacy were violated in a way that any reasonable person would find degrading.
‚Ä¢	The remedial response has been, at best, minimal and defensive, focused on process compliance rather than robust protection for disabled women.
Prospective users ‚Äì particularly disabled women ‚Äì should be aware of this history when deciding whether they feel safe using Hough End Leisure Centre or other Better/GLL operated, council commissioned facilities in Manchester.
showerReviews.author: Ada Sensu

showerReviews.reviewText: Very nice and clensy place the atmosphere is lovely. We went during the holidays for family fun day and it was really nice loads of other families there having fun with theor children to. Lots of smiles all around. They provide small floats watering can buckets and water noodles for the children to use whilst there. The time flew by though as it was only 50 mins and the only down side that I didn't like was that when we came out the aisle where we had changed and put our clothes in the locker was then closed off for school use only. So it was a struggle to get our clothes out of the locker and as I sent my boys into the changing room a teacher from the school had told me that we was able to use the changing room now as it was  for the school children. But we ended up using it anyway because there was no way we was going to go looking for another changing room wet and cold. I think this should be something you all should work on. Other than that my boys had a blast and was absolutely tired when they came out.
showerReviews.author: tay may

showerReviews.reviewText: Went swimming here as a tourist and it was very easy to get access, you can register at the entrance or online. Entry was ¬£6.50 and you can stay as long as you like. The pool is great, and there‚Äôs also a caf√© and a bookshelf inside, which makes it a nice spot to spend time, especially on a rainy day. Lockers need a ¬£1 coin. Overall, very convenient and welcoming.

showerReviews.reviewText: I don‚Äôt think I will ever go back for swimming to this center. I booked swim for all, at around 3pm, ended up swimming for 30 min. When I arrived to the pool, there were nowhere to swim in the area ‚Äòswim for all‚Äô, because there was some kids session, 2/3 of the pool was busy for kids. I asked staff where I can swim, with swim for all ticket, they said I can use 2 last lines. I tried to swim for 5 min, with 5 other people, and I just didn‚Äôt feel comfortable to do it. After I went back and complained about the situation. They let me go to fitness area, after 25 min, I was kicked out of fitness area because some other session started. So I went back and tried to go to swim for all area, as it was less busy. I was stopped by the member of staff as they said some other session will start now, and I can only swim with kids and parents. This is a joke, it is impossible to swim around 20 people in the small pool area and kids. So I paid for 30 min or so of swimming, ¬£6.5. I went there to relax and have a good time, but in the end felt stressed and upset. Seems not fair. Also there are only 3 private shower cabins, so I had to wait a long time to go there. I am not sure how it is possible to pack all of these people in this area and still get money from them. Very disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Julia Bykova

showerReviews.reviewText:
Got my membership here recently.

Facilities are good but the cleanliness lets it down massively.

The pool and health suite changing rooms aren‚Äôt cleaned regularly enough. There are also no shoe racks so people will wear their outdoor shoes into the wet changing rooms and sauna areas which make it really dirty.

Would be better to follow other gyms and have a shoe rack outside the changing areas and prohibit the wearing of shoes in that area.

Hope it will improve soon but if it doesn‚Äôt will cancel my membership and try another gym
showerReviews.author: Peter Rattray

showerReviews.reviewText:
Came here to get healthy, not to question reality. The showers? Absolutely feral. Mold colonies are thriving, the drains are slower than my Monday motivation, and the smell could legally be classified as an attack. I wouldn‚Äôt rinse a muddy boot in there, let alone my body.

The toilets? Somehow worse. The disabled toilets looks like it fought in a war. The other seems to defy physics. If you value your immune system‚Äîor your soul‚Äîstay far, far away.

And here‚Äôs the kicker: there‚Äôs a mysterious hole between two cubicles in the men‚Äôs showers . Yes, a hole. No signs. No explanation. Just vibes. I don‚Äôt know who made it or why it‚Äôs there, but I‚Äôm convinced it could be for kinky purposes. I made the mistake of looking at it for too long and now I have questions no man should ever have to ask.

The gym equipment is decent, but unless you‚Äôre into urban exploration or developing superbugs in your pores, I suggest you train elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Lou Sassole

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually love this pool but on my last visit I was really disappointed.

I have a mobility impairment and I usually attend the aquatics centre in my wheelchair, but in this case I had brought my crutches as I was with my partner and he could help me to/from the pool safely. The main pool changing area is great for this, featuring several accessible toilets and a changing places facility, as well as a seated option for the showers by the pool, which I expected to be able to access on the day.

When we arrived, we were told that there was a swimming competition on, so we'd be in the basement pool. Downstairs, we found that there were only gender segregated changing rooms, with no private accessible changing spaces in either. I ended up getting changed in the disabled toilet, but my partner had to use the male changing room which meant I was unable to call for him when I needed assistance. There was no bench/stool to sit on while changing in the accessible toilet and therefore I was unable to fully change independently. After my swim, I went to the "accessible" shower to find there was no seat at all. I was unable to use it, and I feel for anyone with less mobility attending the pool - were I to bring my wheelchair, would I be expected to take it with me into the shower?

I left feeling very disheartened, and since I wasn't informed when booking that I wouldn't be in the main pool, I find myself afraid to book another session in case I find the same issue.
showerReviews.author: Connie Poulter

When we arrived, we were told that there was a swimming competition on, so we'd be in the basement pool. I ended up getting changed in the disabled toilet, but my partner had to use the male changing room which meant I was unable to call for him when I needed assistance. There was no bench/stool to sit on while changing in the accessible toilet and therefore I was unable to fully change independently. After my swim, I went to the "accessible" shower to find there was no seat at all. I was unable to use it, and I feel for anyone with less mobility attending the pool - were I to bring my wheelchair, would I be expected to take it with me into the shower?

I left feeling very disheartened, and since I wasn't informed when booking that I wouldn't be in the main pool, I find myself afraid to book another session in case I find the same issue.
showerReviews.author: Connie Poulter

showerReviews.reviewText:
The centre is is very much part of the community. It is charity run and this should not be an excuse but sadly the levels of hygiene throughout the facility has declined over the years. This used to be the cleanest facility you could visit and all the staff took pride in making sure cleanliness was maintained. The gyms and the equipment, the pool and changing areas would benefit from a deep clean. The female gym seems like its an after thought. Its cluttered with oldest equipment and space is limited and would benefit from a redesign.
Staff in general are personable and seem to like what they do. There are personal trainers who are happy to go over what they offer to help members reach their goals.
Not sure if any of these reviews are read by the centre, but know there are members at the facility who highlight cleanliness and repair issues with the management. So if there are concerns seek them out.
Overall; Like the venue and staff. Some of the older equipment is shabby and needs a good clean but generally work.
showerReviews.author: sharon wilks

showerReviews.reviewText:
The leisure centre itself is lovely and the staff there has been helpful and kind but it has a BIG cleanliness issue. The gym equipment is dirty and sometimes even sticky, the gaps on machines are full of crumbs, hair and God knows what else to the point it has created a layer of gunk. It‚Äôs really demotivating to even get on them. Same with the Dance studio. I went to a yoga class but was put off by the horrendous smell of feet. The whole floor was dirty with dust and crumbs and even some dried up spillage. Considering it was a yoga class where majority of movement you do is on a floor/mat its really unacceptable. After the class I had to brush off my leggings because they were left with dust and dirt all over them.
And then the pool!!!! To a naked eye it looks clean however the other day I brought in some swimming goggles with me and to be honest I wish I could un-see what was going on under water- hair clump clusters in more than one place, unspecified white blobs floating around and the thing that tipped it all over the edge was a cotton q-tip on the bottom of the pool. How does that even get in there. I have no idea if they clean the pool but if they do it‚Äôs not very often at all.
And lastly the toilets are really bad- there has not been one visit where the toilets have been in a good condition. I should not be cleaning after someone else just to use the toilet. Really disgusting.
Very very unsanitary!!! Bad cleaning issue!
showerReviews.author: una pulke

locations.title: Broadway Baths
locations.address: ÓÉà12 Broadway, Manchester M40 3LN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Previously gave this a 5 but today have had to edit and downgrade to a 1 due to the standards slipping so much in the last couple of months.

Staff power washing the dirty floors into the pool while swimmers still using. Gym equipment broken and never being replaced. Gym machines being broken and taking months to be repaired. And now the steam room is also broken! Floors in changing rooms not being cleaned regularly. Staff not cleaning gym area enough. Weights and benches being left everywhere which means you have to spend 10 minutes cleaning up after other people to make space - before you have even started your workout. No management or supervisor available to discuss this apparently (until 6pm tonight - 7 hours after my visit) but happy to charge full membership even though full equipment / facilities not available.

Don't know what is happening here but not the place it was.

showerReviews.reviewText: I was visiting the area and needed a place to do my usual swim. Beautiful pool and building. The pool itself was a bit hit and miss temperature wise, cold in some parts and hot in others (maybe a pump issue?) and the showers were freezing! But the staff were friendly and just a lovely place to visit.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Aesthetics: Oh Withington Baths and Leisure Centre, you really blow the competition out of the water in this regard. The tasteful wooden doors. The sublime window. The bespoke reception area and Lego model of the building. We love the history wall which details the building‚Äôs interesting lore and fortuitous restoration. Highly appreciate the colours, especially in the sauna, which, at the risk of sounding like this South Manchester-based pool‚Äôs target demographic, give Wes Anderson. Put your head in the water whilst swimming and things can get a bit serene and it is quite delightful, provided you don‚Äôt read the section on water quality. 9/10

Pool Dimensions: More or less your common-or-garden size, not particularly massive and not too tight. I‚Äôd appreciate a bit more depth, but sometimes you can expect too much and it is good to be happy with what you have got. Imran from a few Google Reviews south of us claims that his child drowned in this pool, and far be it from me to question his expertise in this area but the only way I see this being the case is if his child is/was three inches tall. 5/10

Amenities and Facilities: Standard issue gym. Perhaps the best sauna in the business, with an ambitious size and fun little rocking chairs to wait your turn in, although the sauna showers are basically a single stream of water. The clientele and staff cultivate a very collegiate and genial vibe, if not particularly warm. Prudes may turn their noses up at the changing facilities, given that they are located around the edges of the pool and are relatively low cut, but I find this lends a bit of a frisson to the changing experience and adds to the gentleman‚Äôs club atmosphere.  8/10

Water Quality: Life is made up of compromises. It is perhaps to be expected that, when receiving high quality amenities and aesthetics in such a venerable location, there are certain sacrifices you have to accept. Here, the sacrifice is bitty. Sadly, the rumours of bitty are not greatly exaggerated. For those of you who are not pool cognoscenti, bitty refers to the flotsam and jetsam that can accumulate in pools if they are not adequately maintained ‚Äî hair, skin flakes, matter, etc. The quaint beauty of this pool‚Äôs water is marred by bitty. Bitties lay strewn across the length and breadth of the pool, they float in its midsection, they cling to your arms and legs. Bitty here, bitty there, bitty everywhere, it is truly Bitty City. Swimming here with goggles can feel like one is playing Crossy Road, only with the player character replaced by one‚Äôs lithe swimmers body and the cars and trains and whatnot by tangles of pubic hair and specks of black matter. Things can go from Wes Anderson to Paul WS Anderson in a remarkably short amount of time, especially if you are somewhat prone to accidentally ingesting water when you swim, like yours truly. Eating and drinking bitty should never be something you accept as part of a gorgeous swim. 5/10
showerReviews.author: Salford Sirens

Eating and drinking bitty should never be something you accept as part of a gorgeous swim. 5/10
showerReviews.author: Salford Sirens

showerReviews.reviewText: The absolute worst leisure centre ran by Manchester active this side of Manchester. The staff are really poor, I had my child join Gymnastics lessons and Swim lessons and they really are awful, the staff teaching them are absolutely shocking the way they talk to the children and theres no structure or progress. I did put a complaint in after my child became upset about the way a swim teacher was talking to her, and had a basic reply from callum tongue that did NOT resolve anything and with a poor excuse that staff complete a 50 week training course, this cant be true or its really poor training, I cancelled the gymnastics as it was extremely poor and the kids where stood about bored. And after 9 months of swim lessons with about 11 different teachers and no progression or structure theres absolutely no point, my daughter loves swimming but says the teachers nasty and she doesnt want to go anymore and shes only 6! With my complaint being ignored I have now cancelled my childs swim lessons, the worst of the worst I would definitely avoid any of the childrens lessons its a complete waste of money and time, and putting a complaint doesnt help as the managers just ignore it. Avoid at all costs
showerReviews.author: Tough Cookie

showerReviews.reviewText:
Used pool today for the first time. An all-round positive experience except for one aspect:

In the changing room, my locker took my pound but then wouldn't lock so I had to leave it unlocked while I was in the pool. I raised it with a member of staff afterwards who had a look at it with me and told me it was all working fine and there definitely wasn't a pound stuck inside (even though when I was trying to use it, it was behaving as if there was a pound inside). They offered me a free locker token (which means nothing) but said they couldn't do anything else. He said he'd lose his job if he gave me a pound from the till. A woman who heard what was going on then offered me a pound because she said she "didn't need it", so I guess it's plausible, without wanting to cast undue aspersions, that the woman saw me struggle and somehow managed to get the pound out and keep it for herself while I was getting the member of staff, then felt a bit guilty about it. In any event, it would be nice to feel trusted and be able to trust that the staff are willing to do the right thing rather than hide behind a fear of losing their employment.
showerReviews.author: Jonathan Sherbourne

locations.title: Arcadia Library & Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàArcadia Library & Leisure Centre, Yew Tree Ave, Levenshulme, Manchester M19 3PH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I attend a swimming group on Thursday evenings here, but I have now been chased by a debt recovery agency for a parking ticket issued in January 2025, because I simply forgot to put my registration number into a pad, a new system introduced at some point. I emailed Arcadia on 18 December after receiving the letter, and have tried to call via their contact centre multiple times. The call repeatedly goes to voicemail without ringing, and no one has responded to my email, despite an auto-reply saying they try respond in 72 hours. Replies on google to other complaints recommends the email address they don't respond to anyway!

The facilities are good here, but don't expect any level of professionalism or good customer service, and the predatory parking issue is infuriating given you don't pay for parking anyway and I legitimately make use of the centre! I'm now trying to appeal and Arcadia are being entirely unhelpful, likely costing me ¬£170!
showerReviews.author: Scotty

showerReviews.reviewText:
Decent gym and pool that get the job done. It‚Äôs a community library and leisure centre, which is clearly an asset to the area and understandably isn‚Äôt going to have the equipment and facilities that a more expensive private gym would offer.

I will say that there are a couple of areas that could be improved. Obviously over the summer holidays the pool is busier, but it would be nice to have more weekday lane swimming sessions outside of 9-5. Swim for fitness sessions currently start at 8pm, which is a bit of a pain if you‚Äôd like to go after work but without it being too late.

I‚Äôd also like to see more nudges about gym etiquette and making the gym a more inviting space, especially for women who don‚Äôt have a need to attend women‚Äôs only sessions. The strength training sections especially are often dominated by men in a way that can feel somewhat intimidating to insert oneself into.

For instance, large groups taking over equipment without necessarily using it, people watching videos without headphones, and weights and equipment being left scattered across walkways or across mats and benches. The gym can absolutely be a social space, but there just isn‚Äôt the space for a group of several blokes to hog equipment while socialising without it feeling unwelcoming - especially as the weights section is very cramped, so any ways of making this area feel more inviting and encouraging good etiquette on using space would be much appreciated
showerReviews.author: Han

showerReviews.reviewText: I went today and a man exposed himself in the showers to me. I wanted to think this was just an accident but he then decided to get changed with the door wide open opposite my locker. when I complained to the staff they asked him to close the changing room which he did not.  I then left rapidly as I didn't feel safe. The staff all stood at reception saying how bad it was but doing nothing. I wanted them to call the police but they told me I could. They also told me there is no CCTV.  At the same time they were checking in a family into the changing areas when I had just told them there was a pervert in there. I am so disappointed with them and how I was treated today.  I left upset and the guy remained in the changing room with the door open.
showerReviews.author: rachele

showerReviews.reviewText: Very nice, clean and tidy gym. Nice and welcoming staff. I have been training in this gym for a couple of weeks, I am training in this gym two times a week. The gym is relatively small, however you get a wide range of modern equipment that you need for all core exercises. In addition, the gym is not overcrowded. Clean changing room/shower facilities. showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member at Anytime Fitness Manchester Central for a few months now, and it‚Äôs been brilliant. The staff are always friendly and greet you with a smile when you walk in. The location is ideal if you‚Äôre coming in from Piccadilly Station ‚Äì just a short walk away.

While the gym itself is on the smaller side, it‚Äôs very well-equipped with everything you need: 3 squat racks, smith machines, multiple cable machines, plenty of free weights, and more. There are also fantastic bonus amenities you don‚Äôt find in many gyms ‚Äì Theraguns, vibrating foam rollers, free body composition scans with printed results, Dyson hair dryers and straighteners, and even deodorant by changing rooms.

The place is always spotless, and the members here tend to be a bit more mature and respectful, which makes for a great training environment. Even during peak hours, it never feels overcrowded, and I can always get a full workout in without waiting around for equipment.

Overall, a top-quality gym with a welcoming atmosphere ‚Äì highly recommended!
showerReviews.author: simon sy

locations.title: King Street Gym, Manchester
locations.address: ÓÉàUnits 7 & 8, 55 King St, Manchester M2 4LQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently joined but cancelled membership after a trial.
Positives:
Pool is great.
Sauna - is very hot great.
Staff i signed up with were fine. Although some others seemed unfriendly.
Really friendly patrons.

Negatives:
Opening hours on Friday evening and weekend are very limiting.
They hire out some of their lockers which is just a bizarre thing to do. Why?
The poolside closes at 45 minutes before closing time, what??
There is no spinner to dry wet gear and no bags provided. I askes staff where the spinner was and they replied only posh gyms have those! Ahem.. No!
The lockers in the male changing room absolutely manky. The lino is coming up in places and its very dirty. This entire area needs a serious makeover. The benches in the changing room are very uncomfortable to sit on and the area seems very humid with very little space. There seems to be no air con which is surprising as this will encourage mould given the damness and heat in this area
The hot showers are like something from the 1950s. You cant adjust the temp and they all seem to go off after about 30 seconds. This is really annoying as you have to keep pushing the button while trying to have a shower.
No seats on pool side, although there are two recliners.
There are no hot showers on poolside. They seem to have invested in a lot of cold showers because at least half the showers are cold showers. The cold showers dont go off after 30 seconds! ü§î
The steam room is really hot which is great but the seating is really uncomfortable.
The male changing room and showers gives the impression that management are skimming as much profit as they can off the top but not investing anything back into the business. Disapointing
showerReviews.author: WES

locations.title: PureGym Manchester Market Street
locations.address: ÓÉà90-100 Market St, Manchester M1 1PD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has so much potential, but it‚Äôs completely let down by the way it‚Äôs run.

Cleanliness:
By far the biggest issue. The place is filthy, easily one of the dirtiest gyms I‚Äôve ever used. I‚Äôve seen everything from half eaten chicken pies and beer cans left in the showers to bloody socks, food wrappers, and general litter scattered around. The mirrors are streaked and stained, equipment is left everywhere, and in the months I‚Äôve been a member I haven‚Äôt once seen a cleaner or staff member giving the place proper attention.

Equipment:
The machines and weights themselves are fine for the price (¬£17/month), and you can get a decent workout in if you‚Äôre patient. The real problem is organisation, nothing is put back in place, so half the session is wasted searching for dumbbells or cleaning things before use.

Changing Rooms & Facilities:
The changing rooms are genuinely disgusting. Toilets stink, showers are broken (most give barely a trickle, the few that work are scalding hot) and smell like urine. The new lockers already have broken locks and bent doors. Todays new addition was the huge hole in the men‚Äôs changing room wall. The hairdryers are so weak you‚Äôd be quicker letting your hair dry naturally, literally 2-3 business days to dry anything!

Overall:
It‚Äôs such a shame because the gym‚Äôs location and basic set-up could make it a brilliant space. Instead, it‚Äôs completely neglected and poorly managed. Unless cleanliness and maintenance improve dramatically, I can‚Äôt recommend it unless you're in and out to change at work/home.
showerReviews.author: Jonny Bibby

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym is affordable at ¬£17 per month, which is its main advantage, but the lack of cleanliness and general maintenance is hard to overlook. The women‚Äôs workout area on the top floor is repeatedly promoted as a highlight of the gym, yet it is consistently neglected. There are no spray bottles or paper towels available to wipe down equipment, the mirrors are filthy, and weights and machines are often left in disarray.

To make matters worse, there is no Wi-Fi connection in that area, which is particularly frustrating as it is the only part of the gym where the signal drops completely. I have never once seen anyone cleaning or tidying the space, and unfortunately, it shows.

If you can afford to pay a bit more elsewhere, I would not recommend this gym.

locations.title: PureGym Manchester Urban Exchange | Upgrade
locations.address: ÓÉàUrban Exchange, Great Ancoats St, Manchester M4 6DE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Pure Gym at the Urban Exchange is situated in a bustling commercial retail park, conveniently located in the heart of Manchester, on the way to Ancoats. This spacious facility spans two levels: the underground floor, which houses the entrance, and the ground floor. Both floors are well-equipped with a wide variety of gym machines catering to all types of workouts.

The underground floor not only serves as the main entry point but also features changing rooms and lockers, providing a secure and comfortable space for members to store their belongings. Meanwhile, the ground floor is dedicated to class areas, offering a range of fitness classes designed to suit different preferences and fitness levels.

Overall, this expansive gym delivers everything you need for a comprehensive workout experience, from state-of-the-art equipment to versatile fitness classes. Whether you are a novice or a seasoned athlete, the Pure Gym at the Urban Exchange has something to meet your fitness needs.

locations.title: PureGym Manchester Spinningfields - Upgrade Complete!
locations.address: ÓÉà3 Hardman St, Manchester M3 3HF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited spinningfields puregym on a weekend as I‚Äôd heard really good things about this location. Off the bat there are 4 entrance/exit units which to me is a big win. The gym is very well lit, and for my first time there it was very easy to find the locker room and toilet facilities, as there are signs placed near the entrance to guide you. The male locker room itself is spatious, clean and well looked after. The lockers are in great condition and easy to use, they even have 2 private changing spaces, never seen this before and a really great addition!

The equipment is in good shape as well, barely found anything other than a couple of wrinkles on the benches. The dumbells are all in good shape as well. The free weights floor is organised and clean. The machines are all spaced well so I didn‚Äôt feel like I was in someone else‚Äôs space. The cleaning solution sprays and paper towels are full and readily available accross the gym floor. My workout was for chest and shoulders, so I didn‚Äôt try everything, but I was pleasantly surprised at the variety of equipment, which I find is sometimes lacking in other locations.

The atmosphere in the gym was very welcoming, the music was great too (just the right level, as I tend to get migraines in gyms with loud music). For a saturday morning it was really great; it‚Äôs a shame I‚Äôm a bit far to make this location my home gym!
showerReviews.author: TheDumplingOrc

showerReviews.reviewText: I was very disappointed with the shower facilities in the disabled toilet/shower room at the Ashton Old Road gym (The Gym Group). There used to be a handheld shower head that could be removed from its holder to reach all parts of the body, but it has now been replaced by a fixed outlet mounted high on the wall. The water coming from it was cold as well even though I tried for  hot water in every setting possible, which made the experience unpleasant and unsuitable for users who need accessible facilities. It‚Äôs disappointing that this branch does not maintain the same standards for accessible facilities as other The Gym Group locations. I hope management reinstates a handheld shower and ensures the water temperature is reliable so others do not have to go through the same experience.
showerReviews.author: Abdul Hadi

showerReviews.reviewText:
I enquired about learning to deal with swimming in deep water and booked a trial lesson on that basis. When I showed up the pool was only 1.25m deep and my instructor started trying to teach me the basics of learning to put my face in the water, floating, kicking etc. When she realised I could swim and that was not what I needed the lesson for she improvised so that my money and time wasn't completely wasted.

It should have been made clear to me before paying for and booking the lesson that none of the Swimnow pools are suitable for the kinds of lessons I need. I gave them this feedback and have been refused even a partial refund. The instructor was lovely but the rest of the team are much less helpful.
showerReviews.author: Chloe Quinn

showerReviews.reviewText:
Marge has been my instructor for a few months now. Having not been able to swim (since very young - swimming with arm bands isn‚Äôt ‚Äúreally‚Äù swimming), I decided to take lessons so that I could also add swimming to my weekly routine (I‚Äôm 43 now!).

Marghe has successfully taught me how to swim and I feel a lot more comfortable and confident being in the water due to the way Marge has taught me and the patience she has shown. Marghe is very good at explaining the concepts of swimming by breaking it down to basics and getting them right before we focus on the more advanced skills. All our lessons have been enjoyable and relaxed and that‚Äôs due the way Marghe teaches!

I would highly recommend her to anyone wanting to learn to swim (regardless of age).

showerReviews.reviewText: Hate to leave a bad review anywhere but experience here over the past two years has been beyond awful. It stinks from the moment you go in, ventilation is awful and always smells of paint. The men‚Äôs changing rooms smell so strong with urine I couldn‚Äôt even use them. locations.title: Denmark Road Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà120 Denmark Rd, Manchester M15 6FG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I and my work colleagues come here fortnightly to play football. I must say that the experience is top-notched.

First off, it is very easy to book and secure the pitch for our football games. The facility has a changing room where we change into our jerseys for the game. It also has toilets and shower facilities to cool off after the game. Of course, they've got waste bins to put all rubbish in.

The pitch is really comfortable to play a 5-7 aside. To be fair, we've played 4 aside as well, and it's been nothing short of the best experience.

Not to forget that the area is serene, and beautiful to enjoy the sporting experience. So, I loved the experience. I and my colleagues will be coming here often. I am happy to recommend this place if you need their sporting services.
showerReviews.author: Samuel Akor

showerReviews.reviewText: What a beautiful place. Like stepping into a bygone era of first and second class swimming pools! Beautiful tiles and decoration and interesting history. I loved the old changing booths and turkish baths. Definitely worth a visit. We went to a vintage fair there and loved the surroundings more than the event. No parking and lots of restrictions on the surrounding roads, so sort out where you will park before you go. A must-see heritage site.

locations.title: Nuffield Health Manchester (Printworks) Fitness & Wellbeing Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà27 Withy Grove, Manchester M4 2BS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been consistently pleased with my membership at Nuffield Health in Manchester. It provides a high-quality environment and a positive community experience.

The atmosphere here is incredibly friendly. Both the club members and all the staff are genuinely nice and helpful, which makes such a difference to my motivation. A huge shoutout must go to the cleaning team‚Äîthe gym and changing rooms are always immaculately clean.

Facilities and Layout

The facilities here are brilliant and cater to all my needs. The swimming pool, sauna, and steam room‚Äîthey are perfect for winding down after a hard session. The changing room facilities and showers are also very good and well-maintained.

The gym layout itself is fantastic, offering diverse training areas. I especially enjoy the Functional Training area, complete with the sled track.

Classes and Timetable

The classes and timetable offer plenty of choice and are always well-organised. My personal favourites are the high-energy Met Con and Circuits sessions and the calming Body Balance class.

Personal Trainer Recommendation: Dan Nottingham

Finally, if you are looking for a personal trainer, I cannot recommend Dan Nottingham highly enough. I‚Äôve been training with Dan for three years now, and he is absolutely superb. He's knowledgeable, motivating, and his guidance has been a core part of my fitness journey. The gym staff and all the personal trainers, in general, are great, but Dan is truly exceptional.

In summary, Nuffield Health Manchester is a clean, well-equipped, and friendly gym.üíöüíöüí™
showerReviews.author: kevin sharman

showerReviews.reviewText:
First of all, the cleaning staff are absolutely spot on - I didn‚Äôt catch his name, but the core cleaner in the men‚Äôs changing room does an amazing job. He‚Äôs always cheerful, helpful, and keeps everything immaculate. The sauna, steam room, and swimming facilities are also really good and clearly well maintained ‚Äî you can see regular checks being done, which is great to see.

Now, onto the rest. The actual gym staff
aren‚Äôt helpful at all - same goes for the reception team. They just don‚Äôt seem interested and the customer service is really poor. It gives off the impression that they couldn‚Äôt care less about members, which is disappointing considering the price point of this gym.

The gym itself feels dated, with worn-out equipment that‚Äôs long overdue an upgrade. There‚Äôs much better kit and value for money at other gyms in Manchester that cost far less. The layout is also frustrating - it makes no sense at all. For example, there‚Äôs a dumbbell rack placed directly behind a barbell thrust machine, so when someone‚Äôs using it, you can‚Äôt even access the weights rack. It‚Äôs just poor design and really inconvenient.

Overall, the cleaning and spa facilities are a credit to the place, but the actual gym area and staff experience seriously let it down. It feels like it‚Äôs running on reputation rather than quality - definitely not worth the premium membership cost.
showerReviews.author: Ethan Swales

locations.title: V1BE Mosley Street
locations.address: ÓÉà75 Mosley St, Manchester M2 3HR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have recently joined this gym and I love it. The pluses for me are:-  Its location near the City Art Gallery;  ease of access - face memory rather than codes or pass cards; it is not too large and anonymous, and yet it has an excellent range of modern, well-maintained, equipment;  lockers that work and are easy to use;  and attractive, bright, and very clean changing rooms, with excellent showers.

What I especially like, are the well-informed, helpful and courteous staff.  They all seem very knowledgeable, approachable, and are excellent trainers/coaches.  There is a new manager in place who runs a tight ship and is keen to take the gym to the next level.  I am very glad I made the move.  I get excellent value.  There is a lot of competition out there, and a lot of disappointing gyms.  In my view, this one is a winner!
showerReviews.author: Rodney Hill

locations.title: The Gym Group Manchester Oxford Road
locations.address: ÓÉà211 Hathersage Rd, Manchester M13 0JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Manchester Oxford Rd gym is perfect for NHS workers as it is located by MRI. Nice layout and good selection of equipment. Clean gym (I go before 7 am) However, the squat racks aren't against a wall so they don't have a mirror so, I can't check my form. The other large mirror near where the kettlebells are is not long enough so, another downside when you doing exercises and need to check your form for ex knees, neck, back position. So that is a big downside for me. I have been to other gyms in the past and never had this issue. Also, in the showers I can't place my shower gel, shampoo etc anywhere. I don't like to place my items on the floor. They should provide a little shelve in each shower. Overall the gym is great and off peak membership suits me. Thank you
showerReviews.author: Elisabeth Gomes

Review:
I‚Äôve had a disappointing experience at this branch of The Gym Group. Many of the machines, including the bench press and other upper-body equipment, are quite old and worn out. There are not enough weight plates for the large number of members, and there are no sprays or paper towels available to clean the benches before use.
In the night shift, there was no hand soap in the toilets, and water was collected on the floor of the bathroom ‚Äî which made it quite unhygienic.
I‚Äôve used The Gym Group in another location before, and it was much better ‚Äî the equipment was newer, everything was clean, and the hygiene standards were properly maintained. Unfortunately, this branch needs serious improvement.

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a really friendly gym with a great range of equipment and clean facilities. The staff are really helpful and supportive and always happy to have a chat.
Kieran has been a great coach and helped me lose 40lbs and taught me about better eating habits.
Molly puts on really fun, intense Hyrox classes that made me feel really confident. Jeff's weightloss bootcamp brings a really good community feel. Johnny has a heap of knowledge and is always happy to help out. Sol helped me towards my first ever pull up. Ian is always friendly and approachable. And Agga has taught me a lot about hormone balance with training.
They all come together and helped me be the healthiest I've been in my life

locations.title: JD Gyms Salford
locations.address: ÓÉàRetail Park, Regent Rd, Salford M5 3TP, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall I'd give this gym 3. 5/5 at best. It has a lot of potential, but that's if they actually fix the issues I've highlited in my review.

Side note: It tends to get super crowded during peak hours, so try and attend during off peak times if you're not a fan of sharing every machine.

With that being said, please see the points below for a more in depth review, starting with:

The Good:
- Has multiple calf machines
- Great location
- Tons of lockers
- Has hair dryers in changing rooms
- Nice changing rooms
- Has showers
- Millions of cardio equipment
- Really warm inside, especially during winter
- It's a cardio bunny's safe heaven / paradise

The Bad:
- 65% of the gym is dedicated to cardio machines and spaces
- Free weight section is always crowded
- Old machines - damaged padding on some machines
- Trash Tier gym playlist - earphones are a MUST
- Worst gym lighting I've ever seen - dark and dingy
- Lack of mirrors
- Broken machines/equipment have no ETA for fix
- Needs more space and mirrors for free weights
- only has 2 Smith machines in the WHOLE gym
- it tends to get really warm inside
showerReviews.author: Munashe Matutu

showerReviews.reviewText:
The included classes and sauna are the only redeeming features of this gym. Unfortunately, the facilities are poorly maintained - equipment not wiped down, toilets often dirty, and showers frequently smell of urine. I saw a literal bag of feces in the corner recently, which was appalling.

I was also offered a ‚Äúfree‚Äù upgrade to JD+ but my payments increased a month later, and I lost access to the Manchester branch - the only perk I would have actually used.

locations.title: Federation Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 2, 60 Spear St, Manchester M1 1AW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hands down one of the best training spaces I‚Äôve ever been to. The equipment is top-tier and everything is well-maintained, high-quality, and exactly what you‚Äôd want in a serious training environment. What really sets it apart is the atmosphere - members and owners all respect the space, put the weights back, and if anything is ever out of place, it gets sorted quickly. There‚Äôs a real sense of accountability here, which is rare in most gyms.

There‚Äôs always something happening - mobility workshops, squat technique sessions, and even rooftop yoga, which just adds to the experience. The resident coaches, like Adam, are incredibly knowledgeable and always happy to help.

When I first started training here, I felt like I didn‚Äôt belong. I wasn‚Äôt as strong as the powerlifters, bodybuilders, or weightlifters around me, and it was intimidating at first. But the truth is, you‚Äôd rather be a small fish in a pond with big fish than the biggest fish in a small pond. Being surrounded by people who were stronger and more experienced pushed me to level up. Over the past year, I‚Äôve built so much muscle and seen massive improvements - not just physically, but in my confidence and mindset too.

I‚Äôve trained at various commercial gyms before, and the difference is night and day. At Federation, you‚Äôre not just paying for access to machines but you‚Äôre investing in an environment that actually supports your progress. The monthly membership is around ¬£60, and a day pass is ¬£10-¬£15, but honestly, it‚Äôs worth every penny. Health is wealth, and if someone can‚Äôt justify the price, there‚Äôs always PureGym‚Ä¶ where you can experience the true pain of dodging dumbbells left on the floor and fighting for a working machine.

Beyond the training space, they have on-site physio, which is a game-changer for recovery and injury prevention. They also have a posing room fully equipped with mirrors, so if you're into bodybuilding or prepping for a competition, there‚Äôs actually a dedicated space to refine your posing. Plenty of lockers too, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about storage.

And if you ever need a quick snack or post-workout fuel, they‚Äôve got you covered. They sell different types of protein bars ( Barbells Marshmallow is my new fav) and have meal prep available, so whatever you might need, it‚Äôs there. They also stock BCAA drinks, pre-workout and other supplements, making it super convenient if you ever forget something at home or need an extra boost before training.

Oh, and one more thing - if you‚Äôre lucky, you might get to meet Archer, the cutest gym dog. Just another reason why this place feels like home.

The only small downside? There aren‚Äôt separate changing rooms. But honestly, it‚Äôs a minor thing compared to everything else this place offers.

More than just a gym, Federation has been my therapy. It has saved me and changed my life forever. It‚Äôs the kind of place that pushes you to be better, not just physically but in every aspect of life. If you want a gym where you feel welcome, supported, and surrounded by people who actually care about their training (and the space they train in), Federation Gym is the place to be. Couldn‚Äôt recommend it moooooore.
showerReviews.author: Gali

locations.title: Welcome Break Burtonwood East Services M62
locations.address: ÓÉà8, M62, Burtonwood, Warrington WA5 3AX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Im going to give this one star for the following reason;

Driving around the site is like doing some seriously off road driving the kind you would expect deep in the amazonian rain forest, but no need to travel that far it is here just of the M62, who knew?

The fuel pumps are disgusting and there were no gloves, diesel all over the floor being washed into drains great help to the environment that üëç
These pumps are also the slowest pumps i have ever come across, fine if you are filling a small family hatchback, not however if you need to fill a 460l lorry tank some 20 minutes later and its finally full.
Need a quick toilet break? Sure they have toilets in the filling station merely shown a cloth in the vain hope that it will magically clean themselves, cleaned by hopes and dreams does not a satisfactory clean make. Be careful of the ladies hand dryer it is cracked all over and not very safe and will dry your hands much the same speed as an asthmatic mouse coughing On them. But if that wasnt enough wait till it rains and the rutted road turns in a lake much more fun dodging puddles when walking around!
This really isnt acceptable for people who pay over the odds for fuel and food in these bandit based stop shops

Do better!
showerReviews.author: Katie Oakley-Spencer

showerReviews.reviewText:
I feel compelled to leave feeback after my most recent visit here. I reported a large spillage in the ladies‚Äô toilets, something that should have been addressed immediately for safety and hygiene. The response, Absolutely horrendous. The cleaning staff were rude, dismissive, and entirely unhelpful, treating my concern as if I were being a nuisance rather than attempting to help to avoid an accident? Not to mention the toilets were basically inaccessible.
I travel this route regularly, and I have never experienced such appalling attitude from staff whose job is literally to keep the place clean and safe. It‚Äôs astonishing that a motorway service of this size could have such a shocking lack of professionalism and basic courtesy.

locations.address: ÓÉàholmewood industrial estate, Holmewood, Chesterfield S42 5SA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Really Good food, good showers , truck shop ,new exit around back !! Fuel available . Busy because its decent, easy access üëçüëç ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at ¬£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, we‚Äôll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didn‚Äôt. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but it‚Äôs let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

locations.title: Saint Annes Service Station
locations.address: ÓÉà1559 Ashton Old Rd, Manchester M11 1GR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I went for a hand car wash yesterday. I was a little shocked that the attendant proceeded to wash the inside of my car door frame, as this is not part of a typical ¬£5 service, and not pro social distancing. After initially presuming he was just keen and was hoping for a good tip, his small talk progressed. He asked if I was married, had a boyfriend... looked me up and down slowly, and gestured at me in a thoroughly creepy way... how I could possibly be single, when I look like this? Then checked if I lived alone ü§¶I think he was under the misguided impression that I would take this as a compliment?! Apparently having a lodger is a big turn off thankfully, as he changed tone and body language immediately ü§î What was the next question gonna be if I lived alone?!!! Not sure what I'm more annoyed about - the fact that his behaviour made me feel sick to the stomach, and had me contemplating what heavy or sharp objects I have in the car... made me feel bad for wearing shorts on a hot day... Or that my ingrained response was to politely thank him so that he didn't up his creepy to angry üò°Thanks for ruining my day.
showerReviews.author: SpinnyJo Movement Arts

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Swindon Truckstop
locations.address: ÓÉàSwindon truck stop Oxford road, Oxford Rd, Swindon SN3 4ER, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow! Onroute Truckstops have been very busy at Swindon! What an amazing difference! My last visit to Swindon was shall we say, ‚Äòbelow expectations‚Äô; I really struggled to believe this was the same place.

On arrival the entrance was clean, clear and has obviously been attended to with the usual rubbish and debris cleared away. The security hut has had a complete refurb which was much needed. As a driver attending any truck stop if your first line of sight is dirt, rubbish and dilapidated buildings it immediately raises alarm bells as to what sort of site you‚Äôre visiting.  Signage to parking was clear and concise, and there was ample space available.  Traffic flow was moderate and free.

First engagement was the canteen, by which entry was via a newly developed entrance.  Stunning.  New groundwork‚Äôs was colourful and very pleasing to the eye.  There were new picnic tables positioned outside - and were being used.  New plants were positioned, giving the homely welcome.  A huge effort has been made to greet customers to this area and the transformation from the old side entrance is worlds apart.  There are new big screens displaying menus, new information points, leaflets, all safety measures present, serviceable, in date and correctly placed where applicable.

I met ‚ÄòClaire‚Äô behind the counter, who was welcoming, bright and bubbly and just what you need to lift your spirits from the drama and stress of the highways. Also in attendance were approximately 4 other staff and the whole food counter experience was top class.  A very nice touch was a bowl of free healthy fruit for visitors. Well done there.  Food service was very quick - top marks.

The canteen was spotless. There were plenty of customers throughout the day (I was there for a 24hr stop) and I watched with interest the positive energy this team had going on. Everyone was greeted with a welcome and a smile.  No name badges though, I‚Äôd like to have seen that - it‚Äôs a more personal presentation to thank someone and show appreciation by referring to them by name. It‚Äôs also awkward to have to ask, maybe this should be considered. On the opposite side of the coin it equally encourages staff to deliver excellence as it‚Äôs much easier to identify individual failings. Certainly not the case here today however.

No sooner had a diner finished a staff member was instantly on hand to clean and disinfect and prepare the space for the next customer.  There was also excellent promotion and encouragement by the staff to download and use the Onroute app.

Feedback: drivers are still struggling to find the SNAP terminals to pay for parking and are constantly having to queue and ask at the counter, disrupting staff from the catering flow.  The terminals hidden away in the toilet corridor and are not signed. A staff member had put a handwritten sign on the access door to highlight the location but was told by management to take it down. This was a poor decision and negatively impacted good staff initiative.  It may not have been ideal or as professional as a custom branded sign, but it was better than nothing!  There is still no clear signage to the SNAP payment terminals and needs addressed for full score achievement.

The shop was well stocked and inviting. It‚Äôs bright and has most of the essentials needed for drivers. As soon as I approached the shop a member of staff was there to assist if needed. I made several purchases and the whole experience again was very good.

The toilet corridor from the canteen leads to access snap terminals, ladies, gents and disabled toilets, and showers.  It was clean, fresh, clear of debris; and both snap terminals were fully functional. All fire safety measures were present, in date and clearly identified.  Health & Safety measures were also in place and being used effectively.

Unfortunately I can‚Äôt give any further details as I‚Äôve run out of characters! Happy to be contacted if necessary. Staff deserve special credit for a near perfect experience. Well done. Very well done.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText:
üëç The Good
Secure parking ‚Äì that‚Äôs a big win, especially with today‚Äôs load theft
Well-marked bays ‚Äì no guesswork, no getting blocked in
Decent layout ‚Äì you can actually park without playing Tetris with a 44-tonner
On paper, it ticks the boxes.
üëé The Bad (the stuff that actually matters at 2am)
2 toilets for 100+ spaces
That‚Äôs not a truckstop ‚Äî that‚Äôs a queue simulator.
Cubicle size designed for jockeys
If you‚Äôre built like a proper driver and not a racing whippet, you‚Äôre fighting for elbow room just to sit down.
Only 2 showers
Again‚Ä¶ for 100 trucks ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Token-only showers
And here‚Äôs the killer:
How do you buy a token when nobody‚Äôs around?
Answer: you don‚Äôt.
So you‚Äôre:
tired
parked up legally
doing the right thing
and still can‚Äôt wash or take a dump in peace
That‚Äôs when a place officially fails as a driver facility.
showerReviews.author: Jay J

showerReviews.reviewText: It's been upgraded. Tepid soup was the order of the day and it just about made it out of the "cold " bracket. It's now a very small space in which the drivers eat compared to previously. Showers and toilets get the thumbs up though. I've eaten better food for less money. Next time I'll go to Sainsbury's next door and just buy something from there, it will be tastier than what I had. Do something about that soup, it's really bad, it was the vegetable soup and it was like someone just decided it would be best to use the old vegetables up by making a soup. The chef can't be happy, or doesn't have a tasting spoon. A dreary 1 star. Overall the old place was better for space. It feels cramped with 10 people in there
showerReviews.author: Mick Ward

Some common critiques people mention are true: bathrooms are small, showers can make the whole area wet, and towels are extra. Apart from that, it delivers what you‚Äôd expect from a hostel, with a good location. If the first impression from staff was warmer, it would be even better.

Also no curtains on the bed and no soft close on the door of the room i was in. The shower is a weak trickle. locations.title: Rahman Hostel - Manchester
locations.address: ÓÉàRahman Piccadilly Hostel, 8 Fairfield St, Manchester M1 3GF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here, and I feel that may now forever say something about me.

On check in I was charged again for the room, despite paying on hostel world. and when I brought this up it took much arguing and evidence to get a refund, which I still haven't seen on my account.

The place STANK. Like sour washing and mold, but every hallway had a different smell. At least they're diverse?

The toilets on my floor hasn't been cleaned in a milenia, the floor was sopping wet from the shower, there was no toilet paper, and the toilet seats weren't attached to the base. The walls were covered in what I am sure are urine stains, the bathrooms stank of (and im not kidding) dirty man parts.

I'll let there be a silver lining and say my bed was clean, and there were no bed bugs (I stayed in room 4, bed 6) and the room was relatively clean.

As soon as I woke up, I left immediately.
showerReviews.author: Alex Jade

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at YOTEL Deansgate for a few nights while visiting Manchester. The location is definitely the highlight, right in the centre of everything, close to shops, restaurants, and attractions. It‚Äôs also easy to reach using the free city bus, which stops nearby and makes getting around super convenient.

The hotel looks modern and has a lively, stylish atmosphere. My room was compact but well designed, with lots of power outlets, a smart TV, and a great shower with strong water pressure. It had everything I needed for a short stay.

That said, there were a few downsides. The bed was very hard, and the pipes were quite noisy, especially at night. The windows can‚Äôt be opened, so there‚Äôs no fresh air, which made the room feel a bit stuffy. Housekeeping isn‚Äôt daily, so you don‚Äôt automatically get clean towels each day, and the rooms are small, though that‚Äôs manageable for a short trip.

Overall, YOTEL Deansgate is a decent option for a quick stay if you want a central location and modern facilities, but it lacks a bit of comfort for longer visits.
showerReviews.author: 89bojoura

locations.address: ÓÉà55 Blackfriars Rd, Manchester, Salford M3 7DB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The room was standard, ensuite was dated with parts falling off and bugs crawling. The shower gel/ hand wash was on a dispenser and honestly couldn't tell how old they were. The towels very dry.
Conerns we had, and wish we read the reviews is that they take your card details in case of "damage" . The long number and all the details were recorded even though they had our card details on the system when we booked, for about 2 weeks we didn't bother keeping money on the card incase someone was going to steal from it.
The location is 20 minutes walk into centre but at night it was rough, young lads standing outside in groups. At one point we were debating leaving without staying the night.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am super happy with this place. I am a female travelling with a camper solo and was coming to Manchester to see a friend for a couple of weeks. Everywhere close to Manchester was quite unsafe (risk of thefts). The owner of the camping, Martin, is the best!
Keeps the place running smoothly, made me feel at home from the first day, the place has 24/7 surveillance cameras and gates close after 9ish PM (a security person let's you in).
The showers are really good, great pressure and great temperature! And I have to say that because I have tried many showers on my travels and this one is one of the best üòÜ
There are several washing machines and dryers which work with coins and work really well too.
There is a sink to wash dishes which comes in handy!
To me it was well connected enough to Manchester and far away from unsafe areas.
Perfect location! I will come back here next time I need to go to Manchester
showerReviews.author: Maria

showerReviews.reviewText: We arrived here late last night for an overnight stay and an early morning drive to London. Unfortunately, the toilet and shower were terribly dirty and left unattended. There was dirty water everywhere (I'm not sure if it was urine or not, but it looked like urine) and there was no toilet paper. It was clear that this place had not been cleaned for a long time.  The walls of the showers were moldy and the drain in the bathroom was completely blocked, that you had to shower in a lake of grey water for 15 minutes! The shower water was either very hot or suddenly very cold and icy. The few hours we spent in this campsite were more like a nightmare. I recommend that you definitely check the place first before paying. Because the payment is made immediately upon arrival and you have no choice but to stay and bear it, especially if you arrive late. Because the lord lady will disappear after receiving the money. I'm sorry that Google doesn't have the option to give a negative rating. Because this one star is too much for this place!
showerReviews.author: Shida Eichner

showerReviews.reviewText: My friends and I backpacked to this campsite and it was a lovely single night stay. The woman who works there was friendly and polite, showed us to our pitch (which was excellent - flat and really well kept), directed us to the local pub and told us where to find her if we needed anything. There was also a man who kindly brought out a bowl of water for my dog as we waited outside reception to check in. Would definitely return to this site. The rules are the same as all campsites and we had a really peaceful night and left early the next day. Facilities were nice too - free showers and I saw they had a laundry room too. Thank you!

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a great campsite to visit and use to explore the local area. Sited on the land of a family farm, it lies within the Hollingworth Lake Country Park which is, as the Rochdale Borough Council says, a great place to ‚Äúsoak in the stunning scenery; have a picnic; do water sports; discover wildlife in the nature reserve or just enjoy a relaxing walk around the picturesque lake.‚Äù All this just 6 country miles from the nearest junction on the M62, at exit 21.

The lake is a man-made reservoir for the Rochdale Canal and you can easily cycle or walk round it, less than 5 miles, partly on a level track (with a caf√© on the way), partly on a narrow road and partly through the town of Littleborough. Walking paths and bridleways set off up the surrounding Pennine Hills. The sense of relaxation is the greater for seeing the motorway crossing a viaduct in the far distance, with a line of trucks waiting for the latest tailback to clear.

The campsite itself has an interesting history, with two brothers (the third generation to farm here) steadily developing it. Their sister runs the adjacent Dickey Steps Riding School for anyone wanting a lesson or a day ride. The original grass camping ground, ideal for tents and small campervans, has a basic toilet and washing up block, while a new area of spacious hardstanding pitches at the end of the access road gives a real sense of rural peace. The latest addition to the site is a splendid new reception and facilities building, with immaculate toilets and showers accessible to all campers. We were fascinated by the hill behind us, with its many horizontal striations (see photograph), presuming these were formed as the hill grew and the lake deepened.
showerReviews.author: Barry Williamson

showerReviews.reviewText: Just spent 1 night at Hollingworth Lake Caravan Park. We were a bit dubious as there were several very negative reviews. Can only assume they were from a while back before their new toilet and shower block was installed as we thought the site was great. Very quiet, large and flat pitches, respectful campers who kept the noise levels down. Couldn't ask for much more. Only reason we didn't give full 5 stars are a couple of minor things. Better signage would help be visitors know where everything is (especially pot washing) and the pot washing was limited and not under cover. Otherwise, great site and we will certainly be returning for a longer stay next time
showerReviews.author: Marc Pickford

showerReviews.reviewText:
Most stressful and hard work site Ive even been to.

Positives:-
Lovely location, great access to the lake walk, very well kept. Pick your own spot

Negatives:-
Very difficult to book, I called 3 times, emailed, sent a text and a message, was about to give up and book elswhere when I got a call back 7 hours later.

Arriving reception is closed so yet again have to call, the owner then has to guide each person verbally on how to get to the field.

UNBELIEVABLY ONLY 6 AMPS, virtually unusable, if you have the fridge on you can use maybe 1 ring, no way you can use any heating, any 2 items will trip the breaker outside, so you need to cook on gas.
New Toilet Block, isnt in the field never got to use it as I dont want to shower at 10am or late at night, the toilet portocabin was clean though.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I got the impression the owners had never been camping and didnt understand the absolute basics that everyone expects.ie.
10 -16AMP EHU
24 hour access to the toilets and showers
Easy Online booking and payment via webpage
A couple of sign to the camping field
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
There was only 11 people on the field, it should be full, the lady also waiting to check in said she had the same problems and almost booked elsewhere, there was 2 others on the facebook page that also gave up trying too, they are loosing so much money by trying to micromanage ever aspect themselves, if they just employed someone to take the bookings and work in reception (maybe add a little shop) the place would be fully booked as it is lovely, just extremely badly managed....shame
showerReviews.author: Mark Willis

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time at this site. We had two pitches, both electric, one for a caravan and one for trailer tent.

The site is lovely and well kept, with new shower and toilet facilities that were clean and warm. The showers were only accessible up to 9:30pm (I like to have a shower before bed to warm up so this was a little early for me). There are toilets on the field for use at night.

The staff/owners were very informative and helpful at check in, they are very insistent on the noise level and the quiet time which put me a little on edge having 8 year old twins that don't know how to whisper and a nephew who had forgotten his hearing aids so spoke a little louder than normal but all was fine.

The electric pitches are only 6amp so be careful not to overload.

Other families that were on site were lovely, on the last night a few different families got together with the children and had a football match on the centre field which everyone enjoyed.

Overall a very nice site with close access to the lake and very affordable per night stay.
showerReviews.author: Claire Brogden

locations.title: Hayfield Camping and Caravanning Club Site
locations.address: ÓÉàKinder Rd, Hayfield, High Peak SK22 2LE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellently maintained camping & caravan site.  Very popular and can get busy, but the pitches are generously sized and never feels crowded. Toilet and shower block spacious and kept very clean, with decent, warm showers and very efficient hand driers.  They've even thought to include multiple hooks in the loos & showers to easily keep everything off the floor.

There's a small shop that takes card payments and, stocked with the basics, and the usual things you might forget.

The staff/owners were very friendly and helpful.  We'd booked two separate pitches at different times, but arrived together nice and early, and they managed to find two pitches adjacent to each other for us.

And all this located in the heart of Dark/High Peak with numerous walks literally starting from the entrance gates. A good range of these walks are also on display, with route details available from staff on request.

Finally, just a short stroll away is the first-class Sportsman Inn, also with very friendly and welcoming staff.  Nice range of beers, and a good menu.  The food was very nice, and they weren't stingy with the portion sizes.

Very much looking forward to a return visit next season!
showerReviews.author: Stuart Hume

We‚Äôve just returned from a wonderful
3 night camping stay at the paddock. A lovely camp site, spacious pitches, clean shower and toilet facilities and washing up station with hot water. The honesty shed was a lovely touch and is equipped with everything  you need/might have forgotten.
The owners onsite were lovely, particularly Christmas Carol and always stopped for a little chat! We will absolutely be returning to this hidden gem again. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here with 3 friends and my son whilst going to see oasis at Heaton park. Site wasn‚Äôt far from Manchester. Tent had everything we needed and although we didn‚Äôt opt for them. Power packs ready if you needed. Pizza night on the Friday was a nice touch even if the vendors did run out of dough. Showers were hot and clean! The honesty box saved us a few times for wood and pot noodles and the pub was within walking distance. Judging by the amount of walkers we saw and the scenic views I‚Äôd like to come back and do some exploring and I would definitely look at staying at the paddock if I do. Everything was looked after, communicated and easy going
showerReviews.author: Mark Connor

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely clean campsite, very well set out. The yurt was well equipped with everything you need. The breakfast hamper was great. Location is fine and accessible, the only things that let it down are the factory that bellows out smoke and the constant noise of the nearby traffic but not much the owners can do about that. Otherwise it‚Äôs excellent. We especially appreciated the hot shower (there‚Äôs no electricity but they have a generator). Very well stocked little shop. Check that torches work (we had one without batteries) and would recommend taking your own long lighter or long matches for the fires. There was an outdoor fire pit as well as an indoor log burner and an outdoor picnic table.
showerReviews.author: Sophie Cox
