showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little campsite, this was our 1st time camping and didn't want to travel too far to give it a go.
On arrival the place had a lovely atmosphere the wood fire pizza van on site on a friday is a great touch,  families all  sat around kids all playing together. Self check in so just picked an available pitch, very spacious level ground with a cracking view. Fire pits were available to rent, the on site honesty shed was brilliant, lots of essentials inside and everything for the fire pit logs etc.
The shower blocks were clean and tidy with lots of hot water, also separate portable toilets aswell.
Outside sink with hot water for washing up.  Various water points around the site aswell. No electric hook up but we knew this prior to turning up so just brought power some power supplies for phones etc. You could also rent these if you wished,
Located not far from 2 pubs aswell serving good food and not too far in a car to Ramsbottom aswell. All in all a great weekend away with the family and would definitely come back again!
showerReviews.author: Damian Mcloughlin

locations.title: Dearden Wood
locations.address: ÓÉàMichael Wife Ln, Edenfield, Ramsbottom, Bury BL0 0QY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent spot. Charming site, with neat "forest floor" pitches equipped with a small bench and a fire pit, and adjacent parking.
The pitches are screened from one another so despite being close they still feel reasonably private. A good size, although not sure how much room there would be around some of the biggest tents.
Dedicated campervan pitches too. Didn't look at the bell tents.
Facilities were clean and functional, including a well received kettle, microwave and toaster. Hot shower! Pizzas on Friday night, but sadly we missed these.
Nearby walk to a waterfall which is pleasant, and can be extended (up to a mile) to a decent nearby pub. Didn't have time to explore anything further
Friendly and helpful communication from Jessy running the site, including changing dates, although didn't manage to bump in to them IRL!
If I was staying in the area again would definitely go back
showerReviews.author: Iain Macleod

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at Dearden Wood Campsite for a night with my grandson and his step dad. We were lucky as it was Friday night pizza night which were delicious.
The site is really well run and Jessy and Ryan make everyone feel at home. We had a tent pitch which was ample for our 5 man tent which had a bark covering  which made it easy to put up a tent and not muddy. The standing for cars was gravel again a nice touch.
Amenities were really clean and having an area to boil a kettle, microwave and wash up very welcome on a wet day. There were plenty of fire pits for everyone and the facility to have a fire pit in a large covered area again was welcome on a wet night.
The site is in a really good position to explore the countryside with lovely walk ( I will be back to try these out in better weather!) thanks Ryan and Jessy for making my grandsons introduction to camping such fun.
showerReviews.author: Graham Sadler

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at Dearden Wood Campsite for a night with my grandson and his step dad. We were lucky as it was Friday night pizza night which were delicious.
The site is really well run and Jessy and Ryan make everyone feel at home. We had a tent pitch which was ample for our 5 man tent which had a bark covering  which made it easy to put up a tent and not muddy. The standing for cars was gravel again a nice touch.
Amenities were really clean and having an area to boil a kettle, microwave and wash up very welcome on a wet day. There were plenty of fire pits for everyone and the facility to have a fire pit in a large covered area again was welcome on a wet night.
The site is in a really good position to explore the countryside with lovely walk ( I will be back to try these out in better weather!) thanks Ryan and Jessy for making my grandsons introduction to camping such fun.
showerReviews.author: Graham Sadler

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a total gem, clean facilities, lovely staff and a really great atmosphere. Everything in you could want for a little campsite and very tasty pizzas! We hope to return if we are ever in the area again üòÄ
showerReviews.author: Jasmine Hunt

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a total gem, clean facilities, lovely staff and a really great atmosphere. Everything in you could want for a little campsite and very tasty pizzas! We hope to return if we are ever in the area again üòÄ
showerReviews.author: Jasmine Hunt

showerReviews.reviewText: Great location in the woods. You feel out wild, but just a short 5-10min stroll. You have pleanty of eating options. The site has a great little  communal area complete with a fire pit. On a fri night, the site offers wood stove pizza, I will admit I really enjoyed the pizza it some of the best pizzas I have had, and I love pizza. They also have a nice and very clean communal sink area with shower and toilets. They also very kindly provide a fridge, toaster, and kettle for you to use, which I took advantage of as this was my first camping trip with my 2 kids. It made breakfast a lot easier when the kids demanded toast at the crack of dawn. But for me, the owner and their kids made it so welcoming. The kids played nicely as I set up, and the owners Jess and Ryan were great, offering advice on things to do and where to go, also going above and beyond when it all went wrong when one of my kids was poorly during the night. I can not recommend this place enough. 5 stars is not enough. I will be re visiting and have already passed their details on to some friends who want to try camping. Keep up the great work, and I will see you soon.
showerReviews.author: peter walsh

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a remote Peak District site. Limited phone signal and no kids play areas. It‚Äôs a small field on the A628 but has electric hook up and around 30 to 40 pitches and hard standing pitches. You can walk on for a nightly stay and can be family friendly if you‚Äôre not expecting a kids club and are willing to get out. Heated shower blocks and washing facilities. There is only 1 takeaway that‚Äôs in Glossop they will deliver to the area so set your expectations. If you fancy a hike or two on your doorstep and limited distractions this place is amazing.

Worth noting you have to pay for the showers with coins, which you pay for per minute. Initially I thought this wasn‚Äôt great, but it makes sense as it gives everyone a chance to use the shower.

Would have given a higher rating if not for the particularly standoffish owner

showerReviews.reviewText:
Location is great for walk along the canal. Pitches are ok and owners are friendly.

Access can be a bit tricky up the road but this isn‚Äôt a reflection on the site.

The toilets are stocked with loo roll each day and were fine and were cleaned daily.

The let down is the shower facilities which are in dire need of repair. I don‚Äôt mind old fashioned facilities as long as they are clean. When we arrived the shower was caked in green algae on the tiles,grout and shower hose. The shower tray was full of mould and grime.

I went in the next day and bleached the whole cubicle before having a shower and it looked miles better. Just a quick clean each day is all it would need.

The tiles are also loose and cracked, bring some flip flops if you‚Äôre getting a shower.

We would return. I hope that the facilities have a bit of a spruce up ready for the next season as the site could really be wonderful.
showerReviews.author: Tom Royle

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site was OK but very hilly and you will need ramps for your pitch,  toilets and showers were clean and did the job, not very well lit up at night we needed our head torches to get to the wash up area which had very dim lighting not sufficient tbh.
We booked for 4 nights but left after 3 not much to do unless you have a car, we had a walk to the Red Lion for a drink and a pint which was nice.
We stayed on pitch 15 and could hear a humming noise on & off through the night not sure what it was, I think the pitches either side were season pitches so could have been a generator?
We used our gas for the Alde heating as it is only 10 amp and was recommended by the owner - we still spent over ¬£20 on the electric meter to basically run the fridge.
Nice views across the fields and good to see the Highland cows / Alpacas

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a wonderful stay at Welltrough Hall Farm in the beautiful Cheshire countryside. The site is set among open fields with plenty of space for caravans and motorhomes. There‚Äôs even a lovely field of alpacas and some Highland cows to see ‚Äî a great touch!

Each pitch has its own electric hook-up and water supply, and the facilities are spotless ‚Äî from the showers and toilets to the pot washing area and even a dog shower. There‚Äôs also an onsite laundry with washers and dryers (operated by ¬£1 coins), which is really handy.

One of the highlights is the sauna, perfectly placed with amazing views across the countryside ‚Äî such a relaxing experience.

The owner, Nick, is incredibly helpful and always around if you need anything. You can tell he really cares about keeping the site in top condition.

Overall, a peaceful and well-run site ‚Äî ideal for anyone looking for a relaxing break with a touch of luxury in the middle of nature.

showerReviews.reviewText: One of the best hotels ive ever stayed in. The foyer is visually stunning and the rooms and bathrooms were huge. Really good wifi and stable chrimecast for the tv. Ceiling fan was nice and did the job too, dont see those very often. Room even had a mini fridge, iron and hairdryer which were all welcome bonuses. Staff couldnt be nicer too, would always say hello and ask how things were.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Native Manchester for one night and I would definitely stay here again.

For the price, it felt like excellent value compared to other options in the area, especially considering the size of the studio and the quality of reviews. Communication was seamless, I received WhatsApp updates throughout my journey, from details about the room number and PIN code to notifications that the room was ready and a reminder for check-out. The process was essentially self-service, though there is a reception available if needed. I found the whole system very streamlined and convenient.

We parked at Dale Street car park, which cost around ¬£20 for 24 hours, and from there it was just a short walk to the hotel. The building itself is really impressive, it used to be a cotton factory, and they‚Äôve done a great job blending the original industrial character with modern design.

We booked a studio apartment, which came with a bathroom and fully equipped kitchen. The bathroom had towels and toiletries (shampoo and shower gel), while the kitchen had all the day-to-day essentials, plus tea, coffee, and even a small bottle of milk in the fridge. There was also an iron, ironing board, and hairdryer in the room. The bed was very comfortable, big, and overall, the space felt well thought out and homely.

One small piece of feedback from my partner is that a larger mirror, or a mirror in better lighting, would have been useful for doing hair and makeup. As well, it would have been useful if there was some tissues, like kitchen roll etc.

All in all, the studio had everything we needed, the atmosphere was great, and I would happily recommend Native Manchester to anyone visiting the city.
showerReviews.author: Hammid Arfan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Check out the full review on YT Channel

Stayed for 1 night.
Booked the Premium one bedroom Apartment.

Firstly Native contact you by whatsapp and also notified me when the room was to check in, which was fantastic.

All rooms have codes on the door and you are whatsapp'd the code so you dont need a key.

Building itself is the old Grade 2 listed Ducie street warehouse and its fantastic with the exposed brick and iron work.
Huge lounge, bar and restaurant on the ground floor, as well as an outside terrace.

Room itself was fantastic, well done and clean and tidy.

Kitchen, dining and lounge area open plan but offering everything you need and with plenty of room.

Bedroom was big and comfortable as well.

Bathroom worked well and was big enough for 1 or 2. Shower was abit dark due to its position.

Overall apartment was a little on the dark side and you did get plenty of street noise coming in as well as some noise from other apartments. Some plug sockets didnt work in the kitchen and the TV flickered alot.

For the price, location and the size of the apartment. Having the ability to cook own meals then i would definitely stay here again!
showerReviews.author: Travel.Stay.Explore

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff at voco Manchester City Centre were so friendly and welcoming from the moment we arrived. The Brazilian staff member at the front desk was especially kind and patient, helping us sort out a reservation that was missing a night without ever making us feel rushed. The room itself was great ‚Äì very clean, stylish, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable and cozy on a cold, rainy English evening.

The lobby and restaurant/bar area are new and modern, with a HUGE TV (seriously huge!) and amphitheater-style seating opposite so a big group can watch the football together with drinks. Very clever setup ‚Äì I‚Äôve never seen anything quite like it before.

Breakfast was excellent, what I would absolutely call a full English: nice fat sausages, beans, eggs, cottage potatoes, tomatoes, and a full array of accompaniments. Miam miam! Having just spent five months in France, I skipped the baked goods this time, but everything looked very tempting.

All in all, a wonderful, cozy, restful night, a spotless bathroom with a shower I was actually happy to step into, and a bountiful breakfast with both hearty and fresh options. This is definitely my place to stay for future visits to Manchester!
showerReviews.author: Thomas Kunselman (Thom K in Aix)

The ratio can not have been safe for how many people they allowed in. It was un enjoyable and unsafe, so we quickly got out of the pool.  Then, when we got to the showers. The flies covered the blue wall in the showers.

showerReviews.reviewText: It was the dirtiest, oldest and worst pool I have ever seen in my entire life.   Even the dressing room does not have a room to change clothes.    And all the personnel of other departments go to the edge of the pool with dirty shoes.   Although the dressing room was full of wardrobes, they didn't give anyone a key and gave me a plastic box to put our clothes in and take with us.    Let's go to the edge of the pool and take care of our belongings so that no one takes them.    It was really unfortunate that there is such a low quality swimming pool in England.    There is no supervision on this collection.       If you want to get a skin disease, be sure to visit this pool.
showerReviews.author: masoud babaei

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm a regular pool user due to my back pain. Albeit its website describes this place as "one of the best swimming pools in Merseyside", I don't agree. Building is old and the lack of maintenance is clear: pool's filters look dirty and some lockers are faulty. Today I had a shower in darkness. Toilets are usually clean, but old, sure. Apart from this, some users don't know how to behave in the pool. Most of them don't wear sliders or take a shower before entering the water, as required. Besides, pool has 4 lanes, each for a different swimming level. Users join a lane randomly and sometimes block everyone's workout - this pool clearly needs more lane ropes to create extra lanes. Likewise, some users never step aside when they need resting or stand talking to each other at the end of the lane, hence rest of users have to dodge them to avoid crashing. In some other cases, you bump into someone who is voluntary floating in the middle of the lane (?) or practicing water polo (?). Yes, water polo. These behaviours can affect everyone's safety.
showerReviews.author: Carlos Fern√°ndez Miguel

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a lovely place to swim with slow, medium or fast pace lanes. Plenty of changing rooms, showers are nice and not cold ( sometimes warm, sometimes hot). There are a few hairdryers, although one of them doesn't work at the moment.Monday's at 6pm are very busy with some people just standing at the ends of the lanes talking which is very disrupting to people swimming. Mornings are the best time to go, it's less busy. I would very much recommend swimming here. Reception staff are very nice and helpful.

showerReviews.reviewText: Gym is very small and because of the opening times it's usually too busy to get on any of the machines. Locker rooms are not cleaned regularly, the website for the actual membership is not user friendly at all. Was a nightmare cancelling my membership. Staff were a bit rude and just seem more interested in gossiping on the front desk than offering any assistance. As a student myself I was very underwhelmed and disappointed with the place. Honestly there are so many other gyms to join which are far cheaper even offering student deals, I would recommend saving some money and going to them instead. The other gyms offer more variety of classes too.

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's like most lifestyles if I'm honest. Dingy little gym but with all the equipment you would need (or it was before covid anyways) and if you go at a busy time it will be busy. If you go at a quiet time it will be quiet. These times are the same as any gym.

They have a lot of classes you can join in on with membership and some you have to pay on the day. Varied and plentiful.

Changing rooms are a little dated with open showers and changing areas...or at least in the men's. Toilet is seperate at least.

Great staff really helpful.

There is also a large park around it for general walking and periodically there is outside gym instalments to work out on.

It misses a star for me due to the smaller size of the gym and the changing facilities although being clean are a little old now.

showerReviews.reviewText: Been swimming here for about a year now. Very dated facilities but the pool is quite good and does the job if it's open when you can get there. The problem is the times are quite restrictive. Opens at 7:30am which is just too late to get a swim in before work. It's only open in the evening past 6:30pm 3 times a week so there's basically 3 sessions a week anyone with normal working hours can make it. No swim on Saturday. I've also sometimes gone and there's no lane ropes out despite them usually being there and even though 5+ of us are trying to swim lengths. A few of us asked about the ropes as people were getting in our way just standing in the middle of the pool and we were told it's not a "training pool", whatever that is. Swimming lengths is a completely normal way to use a swimming pool and 4 lanes only take up half the pool, leaving enough room for everyone so I see no reason why they shouldn't always be out. I've never gone to the pool where there hasn't been people swimming lengths (or trying to) so removing the ropes makes no sense. There's a few regulars who think once they've got a lane it's theirs to keep and refuse to swim in circles to allow more than 2 people in a lane. The lifeguards refuse to get involved and say it's a "public swim" so they can't tell people how to swim.  So apparently people can treat it like their private pool. Seems like the lifeguards don't want to rock the boat with the regulars. Either that, or they're mates, or they just don't care. But a public pool means it needs to be shared by all and swimming circles is how it happens in any other pool I've ever been to in the world. No one can refuse to share a lane with someone. I've paid to enter but I can't swim, ridiculous.
showerReviews.author: Liam Gaul

showerReviews.reviewText: Been coming here about 4 months,  I first started coming with a friend,  who unfortunately has a current health issue,  and can no longer attend,  but I've continued to come alone, and always felt safe and welcome,  the staff are all lovely,  getting to know all their names now.  So I'm 66 years young and I'm swimming 2-3 times weekly, completing about 10 lengths of the pool on each visit, I'll then go into the steam room, for 15/20 mins, on a Tuesday morning I do 4ever Gym Circuits which is aimed at people over 50, and then awards go to Yoga with Rebecca which I really enjoyed all this on an off-peak basis for ¬£15.00 per month.  Would not hesitate to recommend this gym.

locations.address: ÓÉàQueens Dock, 110 Mariners Wharf, Liverpool L3 4DG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
After wanting to have a go at wild swimming for ages, and getting increasingly frustrated by lane swims in the pool, my sister introduced me to the Liverpool Water-sports Centre a little over a year ago - now I rarely go a week without coming for at least one swim.
I love the ever-friendly welcome, how it changes with the weather, and even the ghostly little moon jellies! The staff are fab - helpful, knowledgeable and vigilant. I‚Äôve always felt very safe swimming here, with supervised swims and the brilliant swimming community. While the rest of the world seems at odds with each other, it‚Äôs been a little oasis - a melting pot of all different ages, walks of life and passions.
If you‚Äôve ever considered dipping your toe into wild swimming this is the place to start ‚ù§Ô∏è

locations.title: JD Gyms Liverpool City Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà14 Dale St, Liverpool L2 4TH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is what the gym changing rooms looked like at 8AM this morning upon OPENING.

Looks like your entire team missed the opportunity to clean upon closing last night and also missed their opportunity to clean when opening this morning.

Clearly ZERO accountability and happy to take paying customers money with absolutely no regard for hygiene or safety.

The sauna was also full of discarded plastic bottles, tissue, product labels. Quite funny watching everyone‚Äôs horrified reaction as they walked into the shower area this morning. Not very funny for the people in charge.

I can see why you decorated the showers with dark grey tiles and black grout (I hope anyway) a bit of bleach and an evening clean down would show paying customers you actually care about their wellbeing.
showerReviews.author: Christine Daffern

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been a member a few years due to convenience and although the place has had a refurbishment the cleaning standards are really poor.

The men's changing room smells of raw feces.... All day, everyday. I have never smelt a chemical or seen anyone clean other than the machines getting a wipe down. The toilets are hazardous!!

Overall a good selection of equipment but you have people sitting on equipment for upto 30 minutes without using it (Nothing more than arrogant and rude). At busy times it can be frustrating trying to get a workout in, too many people enjoy checking in on Facebook instead of using the equipment. No process in place and no control over number of people inside the gym at anyone time so it can be like the wild west.

Good value for money if not using the changing rooms and can go off peak.

The Sauna.... I'm sorry but I can't leave this out.
Seriously, forget health benefits of using as I'd genuinely feel safer inside Chernobyl than spending 10 minutes in here.
showerReviews.author: Anthony Pettit

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been a member of the JD Gym Dale Street since it first opened. I visited today (01/11/25) at noon and was horrified to see the state of the men's changing/toilets. Toilet paper strewn on the floor in each of the 3 cubicles, no toilet paper in the dispensers, feces clearly seen on porcelain toilets, lav brush covered in poo. With new gyms opening in the city centre The Dale St JD Gym needs to up its game or customers will go elsewhere.

showerReviews.reviewText:
2024 REFURB COMPLETE!
This gym has been here for a while, but closed temporarily to have a refurbishment. I'm happy to report that the gym has had a modern refresh, with new equipment and d√©cor.

The most surprising thing is the new layout. The cardio area is now downstairs (previously on the 2nd floor) and it seems a lot more spacious and easier to navigate.

The class studios one the first floor have had a facelift too. I particularly like the new Spinning Studio with the new Spinning bikes.

The weights area is now on the 2nd floor and it's great because there's lots of new machines, new weights, a weightlifting area and it keeps the bodybuilder types upstairs, just in case you get intimidated by that sort of thing.

Saunas and nice changing rooms come with the price too.

Overall, if you're looking for an excellent City Centre gym in Liverpool, this one comes recommended!
showerReviews.author: Ninh Ly

locations.address: ÓÉàOne Park West, 39 Strand St, Liverpool L1 8LT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has one of the best views.

Pro:
Cheap
Good materials
super friendly people
Not that busy
Nice aeration
Also, PTs being very friendly and helpful, special thanks to Phil, for his help towards an inquiry I had.

Cons:
Since I lived in many countries, I have never seen a gym without paper roll on the corner and a spray in case you need them to clean before and after you use the machine, as ppl in Liverpool specifically don't use towels.

I think this is something the gym firm needs to look at, it doesn't cost anything, and it allows the gym to be fresh and materials to be always clean.

I give 4/5, the gym needs rolls and sprays and it will be a solid 5.

I think this is something the gym firm needs to look at, it doesn't cost anything, and it allows the gym to be fresh and materials to be always clean.

I give 4/5, the gym needs rolls and sprays and it will be a solid 5.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having regularly attended here for over 5 years, it‚Äôs sad to see how the private equity ownership of the PureGym group is letting their gyms slowly deteriorate. The rate at which this particular gym is getting worse seems to be accelerating.

Let‚Äôs start with the changing rooms. I can only speak on behalf of the gents, but they‚Äôre extremely tired, with the lockers dented, rusting, and many unable to be locked properly. The toilets are grim too.

The gym floor itself is aging hard. There has been very little investment in new equipment over the last few years, and it really shows. There seem to be fewer carabiner clips than machines, meaning you sometimes can‚Äôt actually use a machine that‚Äôs free, since you need to wait for a carabiner to become available. Pathetic.

This gym is in dire need of a refurb. If you‚Äôre looking to become a regular here, I‚Äôd suggest you look elsewhere - there are plenty of gyms around that are much better looked after, I‚Äôm sure. I‚Äôm strongly considering to one myself.
showerReviews.author: George Mitchell

showerReviews.reviewText: Having been to PureGyms all over the country, this is by far the worst. The men's locker rooms are literally falling apart. Takes me about five minutes every time to find a locker that actually locks. I suppose it's fine if you don't mind your stuff being easily nicked. It is old and in desperate need of a refurb. The owner claims there was a refurb just two years ago ‚Äì this is an absolutely hilarious claim. The gym is also exceptionally crowded. Of course, all gyms are busy during peak hours but this one I find to be absolutely unusable. It definitely services too many people.

showerReviews.reviewText:
When any company has too many customers loyalty and good customer service goes out the window. Recently signed up to pure gym I was on the higher package. How there systems are set up decided to cancel and rejoin. Week prior to membership ending I had issues gaining access to the gym. Had to keep re-explaining to staff what the issue was. When the membership ended I took out another membership the student one.
Two days later my services were restricted and I was force to pay ¬£8.00 which is for the higher membership. I emailed puregym 6-8 times on a space of three weeks - no reply as well as a member of staff - also no reply. I decided to send a letter in the post and contact them on resolver.
In the meantime I raised a dispute with my bank was credited back the ¬£8.00 I was wrongly charged.
I finally received a response from puregym which they have taken no accountability for poor customers service I have received.
Overcharging me, ignoring my emails as well as staff. Restricting me access on the weekends when it states online when I‚Äôm allowed to go.
Instead they just reiterated what I had put in the email to me. Sent me the times of when I can go to the gym when I already know. Due to the poor service I ask for first month to be foc ( due to errors they made and months free due to the inconvenience they caused) they ignored me stating ‚Äú sorry you feel we haven‚Äôt answered all of your questions‚Äù)
If they cannot treat their staff properly why would they treat their customers any different?? after all it‚Äôs their customers that keep them in business.
Also they are over subscribed, ( meaning they have too many customers and not enough equipment. There should be a limit on how many customers they take on. Should only take on more customers leave. To avoid customers harassing other customers whilst using the equipment cause too impatient to wait. ( I have had to alter my days I come to the gym - which I shouldn‚Äôt have to on various occasions)Also they have changing rooms aren‚Äôt always clean. Equipment seem to be out of use or broken which seem to take forever to fix - business has no problems in taken customers money/ ripping them off but extra slow on fixing equipment ü§® stop making poor excuses regarding the pin not working due to technology- with all the money your business generates upgrade better software and programme AI to allow customers in instead of restricting them gaining access. Also head office read emails properly before responding to avoid stupidity on your part.
Overall head office are useless when it comes to dealing with complaints. seem to hire amateurs know nothing about complaints would recommend this business at all.
Staff seem to have restricted the shower facilities there like 6-8 showers but only tow are in use. Been like this almost two weeks now. Pretty bad cannot use all the facilities when you‚Äôre paying for a membership. Business should give customers reasonable amount refund on their memberships. Or close the shower off completely Renovate the showers the days it take refund the customers. After all customers are paying it‚Äôs not freebie. Amount money their making off customers.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Unsafe, unsanitary, and totally neglected ‚Äî PureGym Liverpool Central needs urgent attention

I've been training at PureGym Liverpool Central for some time now, and the condition of this gym has only gotten worse. The men's toilets are regularly in a disgusting state, with mould covering the ceilings and frequent leaks leaving puddles of urine on the floor. It's unhygienic and totally unacceptable for a national gym chain.

The showers are constantly ‚Äúunder repair‚Äù, but it seems more like tradesmen are just endlessly patching things up without fixing the actual issues. Feels like the gym‚Äôs being taken for a ride.

What‚Äôs worse is the air conditioning ‚Äì or lack of it. From day one, it's gone through spells of being awful. PureGym proudly claims to offer filtered, airy spaces, but that couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth here. It‚Äôs rubbish, plain and simple. The gym is dangerous. Staff routinely paint over mould spores rather than treat them properly. And when the air con fails, they stick fans out as a quick fix ‚Äî which anyone with half a brain knows just circulates warm, stale, mould-ridden air.

I‚Äôve personally witnessed several members with health conditions having to leave the gym mid-session because the environment is so poor. Despite all this, PureGym has offered no refunds, no pause in membership, and no access to other local branches. It‚Äôs been two weeks since this latest spell of poor air quality began, and still, nothing has been resolved.

The manager seems to genuinely care, but it‚Äôs clear their hands are tied by head office. In my view, this gym should be temporarily closed on safety grounds until proper repairs and sanitation are carried out.

With new gyms opening in St Johns and Vauxhall, PureGym risks an exodus of members ‚Äî and rightly so. Sort it out before someone gets seriously ill.
showerReviews.author: Colonel Glokta

showerReviews.reviewText: The gym has good equipment, but unfortunately everything is always scattered around ‚Äî dumbbells, weights, barbells ‚Äî nobody ever puts them back. The sauna area is not well-maintained either: empty bottles are left everywhere, the temperature is too low, and there‚Äôs only one cold shower. Many people use it to wash instead of cooling down after the sauna, which causes frustration. There‚Äôs no bench to rest between sauna sessions, not enough hooks for towels, and no shelves for shampoo or soap ‚Äî people leave everything on the floor. The setup needs serious improvement.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym was supposed to close at 4pm on Christmas Eve. At around 14:30, the machines (such as treadmills) started to be unplugged, some of the lights were turned off and the music was also turned off shortly after.

On the afternoon of Christmas eve there were notes put up saying the sauna and showers would be turned off at 3pm. Turning them off 1 hour before the gym was supposed to close is ridiculous - maybe at most half an hour before to start cleaning them but not 1 hour. It also would of been nice if members were told at least a few days in advance that they would be turned off 1 hour before the supposed closing time.

There was also a message over the tannoy at 15:30 saying the gym would close in 15 minutes - the closing time was meant to be 16:00.
It felt like they were trying to force people out.
showerReviews.author: R

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member at JD Gym Liverpool South for some time, but sadly, it‚Äôs been on a steady decline since the start of the year. What used to be a solid, well-run gym is now feeling neglected and poorly maintained.

The equipment is starting to show real signs of wear ‚Äî benches are torn, machines are squeaky or out of order, and there's clearly been little investment in upkeep lately. The showers are cold more often than not.

Another major issue is hygiene. There are no wipe-down stations anymore, which is just basic gym etiquette and essential for cleanliness, especially in shared spaces. Members are left to hope the previous person cleaned the equipment ‚Äî not ideal.

It‚Äôs a shame, because the place has potential and the space itself is great. But unless management steps up and addresses these issues, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone right now.
showerReviews.author: Simon Hammond

showerReviews.reviewText: I really enjoy Nuffield Liverpool! The place is so clean, full of equipments, nice pool and sauna, changing rooms, all the classes I've been to were so amazing and the PT all seem super nice! But oh, god, sometimes I regret my yearly subscription üòû I like to follow a weight program and sometimes I get really frustrated. It can get very busy. You only have one equipment each kind and people like to sit and scroll on their phones for such a long period - last couple of weeks I finished my whole daily routine while waiting for one person in one equipment finish using it, and after a while I just had to give up doing it. I know this is more a people's behavior issue than the gym, but it lacks on the culture part or more equipments to keep the flow. I can see a lot of people training with the PTs. One of them really likes to chat while their customers is occupying the machine. All the others PT are sound!
showerReviews.author: Sarah Marconatto

showerReviews.reviewText:
I waited a long time before finally booking swimming lessons, and I‚Äôm so glad I chose Nuffield Health Liverpool. I honestly didn‚Äôt expect to make so much progress, but after just 7 lessons with Heather, my swimming ability and confidence have improved massively.

Heather is an outstanding instructor ‚Äî patient, encouraging, and really good at explaining things in a way that makes sense. She tailored each lesson to my level and helped me feel comfortable in the water from the start.

If you‚Äôre thinking about swimming lessons, I highly recommend Heather. She‚Äôs made a real difference, and I‚Äôm so thankful for her support!

showerReviews.reviewText: Been a member for years but seriously considering leaving. Considering it's not a cheap gym option there are major updates needed to the facilities and a lot of the equipment is regularly out of order. The machines are pretty old and tired and nuffield liverpool seems to think that putting some new floor tiles down will remedy this. Likewise with the pool & sauna area which are not kept clean. The management seemed more interested in filling in the 2 jacuzzis and leaving one with cold water running - fairly pointless. My main concern is the cleanliness & working order of the sauna and steam room. Considering these are vital parts of the gym used regularly they are not kept clean at all and maintenance issues are not address. The same lockers in the changing rooms have remained broken and out of use for months. The ladies bathroom on the ground floor has broken skirting and the steam room has remained in the same condition for months with broken tiles and a cone!!! This is simply not good enough when considering the amount members pay. I was more inclined to discuss this over the phone with the management rather than post about this publicly yet the lady on reception was very rude and laughed at me when queried. Definitely not receiving the service we pay for and will probably leave for a cheaper / cleaner gym.
showerReviews.author: C Star

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently joined after being a member at PureGym, JD and Empowered, so I‚Äôve got plenty to compare it to. This gym is quite compact, but the changing facilities are genuinely premium ‚Äî far better than anything you‚Äôll find in the other local gyms. Everything feels brand new, spotless and well maintained, which gives a great first impression.

There‚Äôs a good range of machines for its size, though nowhere near the amount or variety that Empowered offers. There are only a few lifting platforms and just one dedicated bench press, with a couple of Smith machines to make up for it. If your goal is powerlifting or heavy compound training, this probably isn‚Äôt the gym for you ‚Äî they don‚Äôt have the thicker bars for deadlifting, and the overall setup is more suited to general fitness than strength work.

The staff are friendly, helpful and approachable, and the atmosphere is calm and comfortable. It feels more like a co-op gym, whereas places like PureGym and JD are more like big supermarkets ‚Äî busier, louder, and less personal. Here everything‚Äôs a bit simpler, cleaner and more relaxed, which many people will appreciate.

One small issue I noticed is that the weight plates are very polished and a bit slippery, so be careful when moving them. It could also feel a little cramped if it gets busy, simply due to the layout.

Overall, I‚Äôd describe it as a great gym for beginners or casual lifters ‚Äî kind of a ‚Äúlite version‚Äù of a hardcore gym. It‚Äôs modern, friendly, in a great location, and everything feels new and well looked after.
showerReviews.author: Jen Atwood

showerReviews.reviewText: ‚ÄúI would like to provide detailed feedback regarding the Stage 4 swimming class. Over the past sessions, I have noticed several issues that are affecting the children‚Äôs progress, confidence, and safety in the pool. Unfortunately, the current Stage 4 instructor does not pay enough attention to the individual needs of the children. When a child struggles with a movement or technique, he rarely notices or steps in to help them improve. This lack of attention makes it difficult for some children to feel supported, especially those who need extra guidance. Another concern is that the instructor spends a considerable amount of time talking instead of actively supervising and engaging with the children. During diving practice, there have been moments when a child could not hear his instructions, and instead of ensuring the child understood what to do, they were left on their own. This is particularly concerning because proper supervision is crucial for safety. A swimming instructor should always be attentive, responsive, and focused on every child in the class to help them learn and feel safe. Therefore, I respectfully request that management consider replacing the current Stage 4 instructor with someone who can provide better support, supervision, and guidance, ensuring all children progress effectively and safely during their lessons.‚ÄùI request to maneger change teacher stage 4kids .
showerReviews.author: Sara Nanva

showerReviews.reviewText:
The customer service and staff behavior are SHOCKING. It seems they have hired some of the most unfriendly and rude people available.

Today, I arrived at the gym as I usually do. The staff rarely acknowledge your presence, even though you must physically scan in to enter the facility. So, I wasn't surprised when no one looked at me as I approached the staff. A gentleman waiting nearby turned to me and said that I could scan in, as he was only there for information.

After I scanned in, a member of the staff verbally attacked me, claiming that ‚Äúshe had lost all of her work now because I scanned in.‚Äù I apologised, but she continued to berate me, so I left to avoid further escalation.

The staff need training in basic customer service skills. If they don't want to be there, they should find another job. Gym and swimming pool users pay to use the facilities, so basic respect from the staff would be appreciated.
showerReviews.author: M P

I haven't swam with Swim Liverpool before and reached out yesterday after seeing one of their Facebook updates.

I contacted Mike through the WhatsApp link and he answered my questions and directed me to the website to book on and buy my swim cap (I didn't have one in my bag).

Once I purchased my booking and cap via the website (easy!) I arrived at 5pm and Adam was on hand to check me in and advise on changing facilities, water temp etc.

There are lockers and everything was safe whilst swimming.

Definitely check it out!

I was swimming front crawl but changed it up to breast stroke so I could take in the scenery. The docks are superb and to reassure everyone  contrary to popular belief the water is very clean üëå

locations.title: Greenbank Sports Academy
locations.address: ÓÉàGreenbank Ln, Liverpool L17 1AG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed overnight at the Kinsella suite and I had an awful night, no curtains, a bright green light and street lights were on all night (which for a vulnerable person was very uncomfortable), had little to no sleep and the shower chair was not a solid seat to sit on. The wifi went off at 10pm which wasn't helpful as I was there in a working capacity. There were tea and coffee facilities, but no milk provided, nor a fridge to put it in, had to get milk quickly from the cafe before it closed. No real structure to book in when arrived and the bed was not made on arrival either. TV only had 4 or 5 channels working. For ¬£80 a night, I would be expecting no issues. If the price is to stay like that with no changes being made, I will not recommend this place. Very disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Peter Langton

locations.title: Ninja Warrior UK Adventure Park (Liverpool)
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit L3, New Mersey Retail Park Speke, Speke Rd, Speke, Liverpool L24 8QB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was a really good time - wasn't quite sure what to expect but we got just over an hour of us and the kids running around all sorts of ninja warrior type courses and activities.

It cost us about ¬£40 for a family pass which we booked in the morning for the same day, then just over ¬£10 for some socks each and about ¬£14 for some gloves as the bars were really slippery otherwise.

There was loads of parking right outside and oads of places to grab some food whilst waiting for your time slot.

The staff were pleasant and it didn't feel crowded. Quite kid orientated but we had a go as well so it was a good time for all.

They have food and drink on site - not silly prices, but not cheap. Free lockers for your stuff whilst you're running around which was a nice touch.

Definitely one we'll go back to - felt a bit like flip out, but loads more to do - the kids loved it!
showerReviews.author: Alan Kell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really dirty changing facilities.

There's mold on ceiling tiles,
There's a disgusting toilet brush in the gents that's not been cleaned or touched in over two months - it's actually had a can in for that time.

I've never seen anyone clean the place. It needs to be fumigated.

I had to complain last year over the family changing facilities - the vinyl floor had started to come away from the drain and there was live activity under it.

The staff walk poolside in their trainers then sit down after walking through to put overshoes on.

There's no common sense at all!

Needs a keen eye for hygiene in the place.

I'm contracted to ¬£50 per month for the privilege.

Photo's to follow....
showerReviews.author: James Riley

locations.title: Dolphin Sauna
locations.address: ÓÉà129 Mount Rd, New Brighton, Wallasey CH45 9JS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I haven't been to this sauna for some years so it was nice to make a return visit.

Nothing much is changed and the layout is basically the same with the reception and changing area on the ground floor, first floor: with sauna, steam room and Jacuzzi and on the top floor: various cubicles, porno video and g.h‚Äôs

The guy on duty was very friendly and helpful and keeps the place spotlessly clean. ¬†On my visit there were about 12 clients for most of the afternoon. As the place is fairly small, one didn‚Äôt feel lonely. ¬†If the full quota of lockers were used then the place would be packed and uncomfortable, although a few more people would have been welcome. ¬†The clientele are of mixed ages ranging from 30‚Äôs to 60‚Äôs and plenty was going on.

Unfortunately, the Jacuzzi is not working properly (difficult in finding spare parts), although the water is warm and circulating, so you can still have a rest there. ¬†The showers are also a bit haphazard as there appear to be some water pressure problems, so they would occasionally just dribble on you!

Since the closure of Splash on Liverpool this is now the only sauna within a 40 miles radius, so worth a visit if in the area, as long as you are not expecting a lot of fellow bathers. Although I understand that the T-girls day on a Saturday can get very busy.
showerReviews.author: ComeFlyWithMe

locations.title: Guinea Gap Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàRiverview Rd, Wallasey CH44 6PX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Europa Birkenhead

Title: Urgent Attention Needed for Cleanliness Standards

I am writing to express my serious concerns regarding the cleanliness of the steam room, changing facilities, and toilets during my recent visit. Unfortunately, this is not the first time I have encountered these issues, and I believe it is crucial to address them for the health and safety of all patrons.

The state of the steam room was unacceptable, with visible dirt and grime, and the changing room and toilets were equally filthy. Such unsanitary conditions not only detract from the overall experience but also pose potential health risks to visitors. It is essential for facilities like these to maintain high hygiene standards to prevent the spread of illness.

I urge management to take immediate action to improve the cleanliness of these areas, as it is vital for the well-being of all guests. Thank you for your attention to this important matter.
showerReviews.author: Emil Gayed

locations.title: EmpoweredFit Liverpool
locations.address: ÓÉà23 Carruthers St, Liverpool L3 6BY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym is spot on, loads of equipment, clean and easy to access. No complaints on that side.

Problem I have with the gym and the reason for the 3 stars is how busy the gym has become in just 1 month.

I joined day 1 as it was advertised that as soon as they reach capacity they would limit memberships to prevent overcrowding. 1 month later you can still sign up and the gym is absolutely rammed.

Hard not to feel this was a marketing tactic to get people to join. If it hasnt reached capacity by now with how busy it is, I would hate to see what its like when it does.

The usual issues you have when it becomes overcrowded have started to appear, teenagers socialising not working out hogging equipment. Gym influencers taking up space with their tripods filming. People posing taking selfies in the tiny changing rooms so you cant get to your locker or shower. Weights not being put back on the racks just being left on the floor as a tripping hazard.

And this is not me going at peak times and complaining ive found the same issues at different times of the day.

However if they address these issues I truly believe this is a 5 star gym.
showerReviews.author: Phil Thompson

Best gym in Liverpool by far, ridiculous amount of equipment. No matter what your focus is, whether its cardio / weightlifting or classes everything is covered.

Been 3 times now at different times of day and its never too busy. Even at 5pm rush hour.

The one small criticism I would give and the reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the mens changing room is really small.

Its abit difficult getting a shower and getting changed if there is more than 4 or 5 people in there at once. However other than that perfect gym!
showerReviews.author: Dave Jones

locations.title: Formula - Premier Truckstop
locations.address: ÓÉàTruck Stop, Bridges Rd, Ellesmere Port CH65 4LB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A little disappointed. I think this truck stop is bit of a gimmick. For the YouTube generation I can see the appeal. For the everyday trucker. It‚Äôs a bit much. The showers are fantastic I can‚Äôt deny that but all else is just a waste. The seating area as nice as it looks was totally empty as was the games area. The bar/restaurant could be made better with more smaller tables rather than the few large tables that only one person was sat at. Food was disappointing also. Overcooked. Breakfast I had pancakes that were solid and burnt, and was given a tiny tub of golden syrup. If you don‚Äôt know the difference between golden syrup and maple syrup (which was on the menu) you shouldn‚Äôt serve pancakes.

As for the parking, the parking opposite the main yard is a dust fest. Hottest day (and night) of the year and having to have windows open means your cab will get covered in dust. Really can‚Äôt be good to be breathing all that in. How hard would it be to tarmac the parking area. I‚Äôve read reviews on what it‚Äôs like when it‚Äôs raining. Getting WiFi whilst parked is nice however to plus points on that.

All in all I doubt I‚Äôll stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Nick Lovell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well, it's OK, but not vastly impressed.

The toilets were being cleaned when we got there, which is good. But the first tap I tried didn't work, then I had to try to wash my hands under a dribble of water from another tap. The hand dryers look high tech, but keep switching off after a few seconds, very annoying.

I was able to get a decaf soya latte from Starbucks, but would have to go over the bridge to get groceries from Waitrose, escalator one way, only steps the other, no lift. Very poor accessibility, not an option for me.

showerReviews.reviewText: Get into bed,pull the covers...a massive bloom of dust comes out,paid for 2 nights,they have not record of it,charged us AGAIN..so they had to refund (as an apology was provided a 1 drink,1 snack -packet of Crisps and J20. I bet and free parking - the only thing worth it).Email received on the Friday, advising that their MAY be an issue with the Heating...it wasn't working (weekend of Storm Claudia)..then the next day,try to have a shower... nothing but cold water and the advice from Reception "Have you tried running the water it should warm up!!"..but this had been tried for nearly 5  mins...then came the admission of "Well we had someone looking at it earlier so it should have been fixed!"....final and most annoying part is trying to get the refund...they REFUSED saying we need to go via Booking.Com (we all know how useless their customer service is),only refunded the Virtual card .... calamity from start to finish.Been to 3 star hotels in Zambia and Tanzania that were MILES better than this!Still waiting for the refund!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely shocking stay at this hotel. The room rate was circa ¬£350 for one night in a twin room (presumably inflated as the Labour conference is in the City).

The air conditioning AND heating system across the hotel is broken so there is none. The rooms and public areas are cold and we weren't the only ones to complain about this.

None of the lamps or side lights in room 30 work, so we could barely see what we were doing.

At 5:30 am there was no hot water for a bath and we were told this was because "everyone is using it" (at 5:30 am?!)

The service is intermittent, slow and lackadaisical ("I forgot to bring you steak knives. Oh dear, never mind.") but everyone is beautifully friendly, as Liverpudlians are.

Don't order steaks - the chef has no idea. We ordered medium and medium-rare and they both came very rare. We sent one back for an extra grilling (once we finally found a member of staff) and it arrived back with us not really any better.  We gave up waiting for dessert and cut our losses.

On checking out when asked about our stay we reported all this (again) and the response was "oh dear, sorry about that).

My advice to you - If you can stay somewhere else, you're probably best advised to do that.
showerReviews.author: POL Watson

locations.title: YHA Liverpool Albert Dock Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà25 Tabley St, Liverpool L1 8EE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hostel has a fantastic location ‚Äì almost in the city center but still in a quiet area, just a 5-minute walk from The Beatles Museum. I really liked the security system: you cannot access any floor or room without a pass, which made me feel very safe.

When I arrived, my 8-bed dorm only had 6 lockers. I asked about it, and the staff immediately moved me to another room with a locker ‚Äì super fast and helpful! The room was clean, and I liked that the bathroom and toilet were separate. The staff were extremely friendly and always ready to help. Another big plus is that you can leave your luggage after check-out until your departure, which was very convenient.

In the bathroom, there were no hooks or space to put personal belongings, which was a bit uncomfortable. The pillows were also quite thin and not very comfortable to sleep on.
showerReviews.author: Iryna Dudchenko

Another big plus is that you can leave your luggage after check-out until your departure, which was very convenient.

In the bathroom, there were no hooks or space to put personal belongings, which was a bit uncomfortable. The pillows were also quite thin and not very comfortable to sleep on.
showerReviews.author: Iryna Dudchenko

showerReviews.reviewText:

Breakfast was fine and the location is good enough.
All for a really good price.
The only thing i will improve is the pressure of the shower.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not a hotel, don't expect anything good. You will pay hotel prices so that:
You do self checking, zero staff insight, no room cleaning or towel change, and worst of all you will have constant music blasting during the night from surrounding clubs, at 5am they are still going. Toilet paper within your own room is enclosed in a plastic enclosure so goodluck that there is enough and that it will not break within. Avoid at all costs

showerReviews.reviewText: Great place to stay in a centric area of Liverpool. The rooms were very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the staff was always kind and helpful. The docks, and theaters, and Bold St are all within walking distance to this hostel.

locations.title: The Embassie
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Falkner Square, Liverpool L8 7NU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you value your sanity, your health, or your sense of smell, do not step foot in this hellhole. The Embassie Hostel is less a hostel and more a social experiment in human endurance. The moment I walked in, a wave of stench hit me ‚Äî a toxic mix of sweat, mould, and old socks marinated in despair.

The kitchen? A crime scene. Looks like there was a party in 1986 and nobody‚Äôs bothered to clean  up since. There‚Äôs supposedly a ‚Äúfree breakfast,‚Äù but with cats crawling out of every corner and strolling across the table, it‚Äôs more like a petting zoo gone feral. No thanks.

The guests ‚Äî or should I say ‚Äúresidents of chaos‚Äù ‚Äî wander around in drug-fueled trances. At 3 a.m., a man staggered into our room, sprinkled cocaine on the bed, then lay on the floor and exposed himself. I went to find staff, only to discover the ‚Äúmanager‚Äù sitting with seven empty cans of Carlsberg, staring into the void.

The bedsheets smelled like unwashed feet and broken dreams. The bathroom had a sign begging people to close the shower curtain because ‚Äúit‚Äôs deprived of water.‚Äù Whatever that means, it‚Äôs not reassuring.

This place isn‚Äôt a hostel ‚Äî it‚Äôs a halfway house for people society gave up on. It‚Äôs unsafe, filthy, and a genuine danger to women, students, and anyone with a pulse. Booking.com  or any other platform it's using, should pull this listing immediately before someone catches something incurable.It's false advertisement even with the photos of the rooms.

I fled at 3:30 a.m. and checked into the Z Hotel, where the staff were actual humans and the beds didn‚Äôt smell like regret. That‚Äôs how bad it was ‚Äî I‚Äôd rather sleep on a pavement than ever set foot in the Embassie again.
Women and children stay away before  something really bad happens.
showerReviews.author: fernando murphy

showerReviews.reviewText:
The photos shows in the review is not updated . Check the photos inside the review and you will know how old and dirty is the place .

When I first walked in , I cannot locate reception and I saw a man in the courtyard talked to me . The check in is a computer inside the kitchen .
They offer  coffee at late nite like 9:30pm and I politely decline.

All I wanted is a good nite sleep. The female room is on the top floor and I am thinking I won‚Äôt go downstairs until next morning .

The door is quite fragile and it is not locked most of the time.

The female toilet was occupied by a man for more than 20 mins.

At around 11pm, there is a man coming into the room trying to organize a bed for someone .

My bed has no electric outlet and I have to leave it in another bed area to charge it.

In the morning , I wanted to say bye and I saw a big dog staring at me.

I just left the really dirty hostel . I got a few hours of sleep and I did not border to use the shower.

I am glad I just slept a few hours and then leave .

I don‚Äôt know how the owner run the business but seriously he needs to do a make over of the place and people will be happier to stay there

showerReviews.reviewText:
PRO:Friendly and speedy check in. The lockers were huge which is a great benefit. The hygiene standards on first impression were satisfactory.
The cafe/bar downstairs had a modern, contemporary vibe and the bar staff were very accommodating.
CONS: A few people seemed to check into our dorm room at about 2am. I didn‚Äôt know this was permitted and it was a little disruptive.
General chit chat can easily be heard from the stairways while in the dorm( I stayed on the first floor).
The windows were not double glazed so noise from the street can easily be heard.
The keycard that enabled room access kept needing to be rebooted. I was lucky that I was on the 1st floor and it was only a short walk back to the reception. This happened frequently with the others in my dorm room too.
Overall, it‚Äôs a decent stay for the price you pay.
showerReviews.author: Bamo R

showerReviews.reviewText: This is one of the better Hostels that I've stayed in. The hostel is fairly new and you can tell. The staff is friendly and helpful. I like the fact that there is a kitchen even though there's no stove. There are two microwaves and two small fridges. There is an elevator even though there are only three or four floors. The TV room has a smart TV with free access to Netflix and other streaming services. There is also a game room and a small gym. I thought the bed was very comfortable and they give you a fresh clean towel each day when the room is cleaned, like in a hotel.
showerReviews.author: Omar Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a great location and the staff are polite. However, we were a little surprised at just how tiny the private en suite room was - also that we booked a twin, but got bunk beds. A little odd, but I guess that kind of qualifies as a twin.

The shower was broken - as in, physically partially detached from the wall - and there was a screw on the floor in the bathroom which my daughter stepped on, unable to see it because the floor itself was a mottled grey colour. Took the screw and photos of broken shower to reception at around 5:30pm - staff member was polite but offered no solutions or apologies; simply said we'd have to manage because maintenance had gone home for the night. I replied that I would not use the shower as it was, well, unusable.

It gets very loud, especially in the evenings, and whilst the photos show lots of facilities, in actuality there is not much available to use.

The room itself was basically tidy although the carpet was not very clean and if I'm honest, I'd book the YHA instead next time - I would have done so this time but they were fully booked.

I feel quite disappointed with the stay overall but I guess you pay cheap, you get cheap. For somewhere to crash after a night out I'd say it's brilliant; it's close to everything, you can just roll in and pass out accordingly. But for anything else? Perhaps book elsewhere...this was a last resort booking to see Jack Whitehall as our previous hotel had let us down.

Won't use again, but that's just because it didn't meet my needs or expectations. Judging by the reviews it has already, I'm in the minority so people should still give it a chance to judge for themselves.
showerReviews.author: candyflossbike

No soap in either of the two bathroom dispensers.  No instructions for heater or sink plug, and they werent obvious types so spent the night in cold and with a "blocked" sink, unable to get a wash.

On the plus side, the room was very trendy, clean, comfortable and at such a low price. Staff on main desk were very nice too.

showerReviews.reviewText: Firstly there are some really nice parts about staying here, the cafe Love Thy Neighbour downstairs is adorable. Well priced and good portions 100% recommended, also what a brilliant location. Hatton Gardens is in a quieter part of town but a brilliant walking distance from all the good stuff. Also if you tell the cafe you're staying at the hotel they give you a cheeky discount. The room itself was cute looking at first glance but when you looked closer you could see it needed a couple of minor improvements and a fresh lick of paint, especially around the bed so I couldn't help but stare at all the dents, scratches and chipped paint. My biggest annoyance however was the ensuite. It's a bit of a joke to pay for an ensuite room, where the toilet doesn't flush very well and wake up and find the water freezing and having to either go without or hunt for the communal shower room, which when we complained we were told there was one on every floor. That's cool and all but if you wanted to share a bathroom you'd pay for it right? I don't think the complaint was handled very well and was kind of brushed off. As well as we weren't really told about the cool facilities in the hotel, just kinda stumbled across them looking for the shower eg laundry room a pool table and apparently a library! Could have been super cute budget place but kinda more for pics and nothing too impressive. Didn't feel worth it.
showerReviews.author: Natalie Punter

locations.title: International Inn
locations.address: ÓÉà4 S Hunter St, Liverpool L1 9JG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hostel is well-managed. They really put effort into cleaning the space. My room was nice, bunk bed with a curtain, bed light, a charging plug, and the bed were comfortable. Moderate indoor temperature, and nice shower facilities.

The kitchen unfortunately doesn't have a window, so i can smell humidity and it was hot and not airy enough. The good thing is they have fully equipped cooking facilities and they check and clean the fridge daily.

Need to provide card detail when checking in. It's understandable but not the safest way for me. Although they claim the system will automatically delete card detail after check out, but those details were entered manually. So safety is not fully guaranteed. I hope they can consider other ways that work out for both sides.

Even so, I think the price was really affordable (maybe because of low season?), and it is definitely worth it. Will consider staying again next time.
showerReviews.author: Tzuyu Lin

showerReviews.reviewText: Firstly, it‚Äôs obviously still getting it sorted but my room was clean but basic. No signs for WiFi. No tea or coffee services. Bed was comfortable and duvet was warm. The bathroom was also clean and despite earlier reviews they seem to have sorted the hot water. Negatives: walls and floors are paper thin and you hear walking up and down the corridor, dropping of items on the floor etc. I was unlucky in that I had a neighbour who at 2.30am was in a furious mood we knew about it. Banging things so loudly I thought something collapsed. Very unsettling. If your running a tight budget this is a good clean place and I feel they working to make it a good place. Great for young people. Funky decor. Staff were friendly.
showerReviews.author: Margaret P

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve stayed here before and really liked it.  This time, the room was awful: the heating was broken so the radiator made a noise all night, there was no hot water, the electrics on the beds didn‚Äôt work, the toilet was dirty and unpleasant, and the staff were ignorant (except for the lovely Spanish lady). The curtain rails on the beds kept falling off when you got out of bed and woke everyone up in the middle of the night. And the beer was ridiculously gassy - to be fair the beer was awful last time too.  We were told to walk down the corridor to the lift to get to the fifth floor, only to be told by another member of staff that there was no lift.  We come to Liverpool a lot but we will not be back here.  Especially when we can stay in a hotel for less (and get towels).
showerReviews.author: Gary Rossiter

showerReviews.reviewText: By far the worst experience I had during my trip. For three days the shower wasn't working and the receptionist did nothing. I had to stay at another hotel because they didn't even offer me another room. On the third day, they claimed it was working and didn't refund my daily rate. The hostel is dirty, and there's no bar service. Anyone looking for a peaceful trip, DON'T STAY AT THIS HOSTEL!

showerReviews.reviewText:
My stay at the Malacuna Hotel, Liverpool (29th August ‚Äì 2nd September 2025), was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. The accommodation was completely misrepresented online, the property was undergoing disruptive refurbishment without any prior notice, and the basic room conditions were unacceptable.

Misleading Advertising

The room I was given looked nothing like the photos shown on booking platforms. Instead of a clean, modern space, I walked into a dirty, poorly maintained room. The floor had hair and debris, the sink had dirty water stains, and the overall condition was shabby. The amenities advertised online were simply not provided ‚Äî no heating, no hand wash, no coat hangers, and generally nothing resembling what was promised.

Refurbishment (Undisclosed and Hazardous)

The hotel was essentially a building site. There was wet paint, construction equipment scattered in common areas, and a strong paint smell that caused headaches. I even got paint on my clothes because areas weren‚Äôt marked or signposted properly. None of this was disclosed before or at booking, and when I asked, I was told there were no other rooms available, so no chance of moving or upgrading. The whole environment felt unsafe and uncomfortable, and it was completely unacceptable not to inform guests in advance.

Poor Room Conditions & Safety Concerns

On top of the misleading presentation, the room itself was simply not fit for purpose. Walls were paper-thin, cleanliness was non-existent on arrival, and the space lacked very basic facilities.

Even worse, during two of the nights, around 4am, someone was banging on doors, trying door handles, and shouting ‚ÄúOwen.‚Äù This was frightening and hugely disruptive, making it impossible to feel safe or comfortable in the room. Combined with the lack of staff presence and security, this created a genuinely unsafe environment for guests.

Additional Concerns
‚Ä¢	Basic facilities unavailable: On Saturday evening around 9pm, no drinks were available because their iPad system was down. No alternative was offered.
‚Ä¢	Security risks: Doors to the property were left wide open with no staff or security on site. Strangers were able to walk in freely, making the environment unsafe.
‚Ä¢	No staff presence: Reception was unattended throughout my stay, leaving guests without assistance. This only increased the feeling of being unsafe.
‚Ä¢	Privacy breach: A guest report listing names and room numbers was left in clear view at reception. Even worse, staff entered my room unannounced while I was sleeping, to drop off towels and toilet roll. This is an obvious breach of privacy and completely unprofessional.

Overall Impression

This stay was unacceptable in every way. What was advertised bore no resemblance to the reality. Guests were left to deal with unsafe, dirty, and poorly managed conditions without staff support. The combination of misleading advertising, undisclosed refurbishment, substandard room conditions, and serious safety incidents makes this hotel a place I cannot recommend to anyone.

I have requested a full refund and compensation for the health, safety, and comfort issues I endured and will be escalating this matter through booking platforms and consumer rights authorities.
showerReviews.author: Rhys Mcevoy

Great location for the city center on a budget.

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed at the Cocoon this weekend, we were really happy when we arrived as the actual room was very good, clean and a decent sized space and the reception staff were so lovely and accommodating. The downside and reason that stops us from staying here again was it was it was unfortunately extremely noisy during the night. We stayed in room 231 and not sure if we just got unlucky with this room but there was music and dancing going on above us till late and there was a door near our room literally getting slammed at all hours of the night. Any time we managed to fall asleep this door would slam again and startle us back awake, I have read on other reviews that this seems to be an issue with this hotel. It also wasn't helped that the shower went off in the middle of the night and the TV must have had an alarm set on it as it turned on and started blasting the Simpsons at 8am. We got maybe 1-2 hours sleep if that. I think little things such as door softeners could be useful here and signage to remind people in hallways not to shout and run around in the middle of the night. Would be tempted to stay again due to the staff being so lovely and the room being very decent but we'd be 100% be bringing ear plugs next time!
showerReviews.author: Megan Courtney

locations.title: Arena House
locations.address: ÓÉà82-84 Duke St, Liverpool L1 5AA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great Location, Great Price, fair standards.

Why pay so much for a hotel just for a short Liverpool stay, when you can get everything you need for a lot less!

I know some people may complain about some areas, but you are staying in a hostel, close to the heart of Liverpool and great for those (like myself) who are from another city so if you are taking a night bus back then it is easy to even walk to Liverpool One bus station to catch that late night Megabus or National express back home. So no worries about trying to catch a bus late at night.

The price can vary but it is fantastically convenient and great for when you need to get into the city or come back, so everything you want or need is nearby.

The bathroom, kitchen, and common areas are all shared so it is no different to a big shared house. With many people keeping to themselves then if you want to take advantage of the large common rooms to eat your dinner and watch TV then fantastic for you!

Plus broadband access throughout, TV in the room with storage space.
My only real negative is the smell of smoke in one corridor - some  naughty person smoking in room clearly and pretty much the good and bad of a big shared house (you meet nice travelers there too. Some may just rudely ignore you!).

And laundry room, although I never had time to use it and just did laundry back home.

And bring a towel. Otherwise you will need to rent one for ¬£3! :/
showerReviews.author: Geoffrey Morris

showerReviews.reviewText: I would definitely recommend a stay in Arena house. As far as B&Bs + hotels go, you absolutely can not go wrong for the price. At ¬£24 a night, I would have expected to get a bunk in a hostel, but the room had a single bed, TV with satellite, wardrobe and kettle. Really great value!!!! Only downside was that the shower is communal and I had to walk from there back to my room with wet hair. Again though, given the price, you can't complain at all. You also have to hire a towel, so I would advise you to bring one with you. Staff were all super friendly.
showerReviews.author: A Google user

showerReviews.reviewText:
Worse than a university accommodation.

A few positive words about the place first. If you are a budget traveller, this is definitely a place that you could consider staying at. Very cheap; you can get a room for as low as ¬£20/night. Also, the location is great. The hostel is close to the heart of the city. It is located on the border of the heart of the city and Chinatown, so when you leave the building, depending on whether you turn left or right, you'll get to your destination within 5-10 minutes of walk. And that's pretty much it. These are the ONLY positive aspects of Arena House.

1. If you are travelling heavy, cross this hostel off your list. There is no lift in the building, so I had to drag 30kgs of luggage up 3 flights of stairs to the room which I was assigned to.

2. Lack of hygiene in the private rooms & communal areas is just revolting. When I got to my room, I was shocked to discover the layers of dust behind the bed.
There was a pack of bread in the kitchen cupboard that was encased with mould suggesting there were no cleaners present in weeks.
The 2 bathrooms we shared on the top floor were rancid. The bathtub had dried (I assume) dirt covering the bottom, bins were overflowing with used toilet paper & hygiene pads and NO clean toilet paper whatsoever. And to top that, toilet water was leaking all over the floor.

3. Sockets in my room were placed behind the bed which is fine, so long you can move the bed and access it. This is NOT the case. The bed is fixated to the floor and you can't charge anything because the bedframe is in the way of the cables.

4. Poor quality of service. If you're lucky enough, you manage to get connected to a staff that is unresponsive but at least it's a staff member. In most cases, however, you can't reach anyone as reception closes at 4PM and they are not really handy with picking up phones.

My final verdict is ...

if you are a budget traveller, who does not mind spending a night or 2 in a messy, dusty university accommodation - YES, go for it;

in any other case - NO, avoid it like the plague; I regret not spending a few pounds more to have a decent room and a clean bathroom/toilet facility that I am not afraid of using.
showerReviews.author: Duy Hieu ‚ÄúHugh‚Äù Tran

showerReviews.reviewText: Good location, rooms are quite small and contain single bed, wardrobe, desk, chair, shelf, heater, TV. Shared kitchen and couple of bathrooms on each floor. Two washing machines and dryers in the basement (costs ¬£1-2 for a load of laundry). Location is great, and it's secure. Rooms are satisfactorily. Kitchens are absolutely disgusting! There is no particular cupboard or refrigerator shelf allocated to each room so I guess cleaners have no idea what belongs to who do food just stays there for months after people move out. I threw out a whole bin full of mouldy stuff (best before dates expired by several months) including liquified onions and tomatoes and solidified milk). Why not just label a cupboard and a refrigerator shelf for each room? Bathrooms not very nice either. I'll probably avoid if you intend to use the kitchen
showerReviews.author: Ben Turner

Tl;dr: paid ¬£11 quid, rooms okay, bathrooms not.

showerReviews.reviewText: Wonderful campsite... And links to the city reasonably close. Very friendly owners, and spotlessly maintained. The facilities are small but very clean, and I like the little touches.... For example, in the shower there's proper hooks to hang things... Not little puny afterthought that your belongings fall off from! Also, a fridge is available for your use... Great for milk and food in the summer for us tenters! Fresh eggs are available from the on site chickens, ¬£1 a half dozen. Bargain! When I'm next in Liverpool, season permitting, I'll be back. You really feel like you're in the middle of nowhere, not half an hour from a major city!
showerReviews.author: Griff Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice small site for C&C club members only. Stayed in a campervan - was ¬£25 per night including space for awning and 5amp EHU.
There are also some tent pitches.
3 toilets, 1 shower (20p for 4 mins) and washing up sink.
10 mins walk to train into Liverpool/Southport.
20 mins walk to Maghull centre with shops and pubs.
Would definitely stay again.
