showerReviews.reviewText:
First run out with a new to us tourer. Only 14 minutes away from home but feels like miles away. Getting used to everything and getting back into Caravanning after 20+ years. The site is clean and fully serviced with everything you could need. All be it showers and toilets where not open because of COVID so carnt review them. Pitches very roomy which is great for an inexperienced reversing experience ( not as easy as I thought still made a mess of the grass üò´sorry üò¢. Owners very polite and helpful but not intrusive, making our first trip away very enjoyable. Noise wise mostly quiet but you can hear a constant buzz from the nearby motorway which we did get used to. Very secure working farm accessed through remote control gates, great idea felt really safe.  This is an ideal location for a stop off or just a chill out time. Thank you Stella really enjoyed our stay.
28th august to 31st august 2020 bank holiday weekend.
showerReviews.author: Chrissy W.

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely little farm campsite. The toilets and showers are clean . The owner is very friendly and let's you park your caravan so you have a lovely view. It has a cafe which must be good as it was busy every day. Right next door to a train station, but you can only hear rumbling occasionally until about 7.30pm. Trains go to Manchester or Liverpool. we stayed for a week, and would definitely go back. Be prepared for chickens roaming around as one camper wasn't very happy about this. ü´§

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great campsite flat dry pitches with electric we were allowed to layout our pitch with the 3 big tents and gazebo how we liked and was allowed a fire pit, we sat out till gone 12am every night was very quiet and peaceful just need to turn any music off by 11pm and be respectful on noise levels it has a cafe on site and a pub up on the corner, 5min from towns in either direction so great to nip out for takeaways and shops. Showers and toilets were spacious. Few horses and chickens on the site. The train track next to the site was very quiet didn‚Äôt wake us up at all. About 30min out the Crosby and formby beach or 45min other way to Manchester great middle ground! Lots to do within 30min for the kids to do we did beach, footgolf, crazy golf and ninja warrior.
All in all a great bank holiday stop for 3nights! (3 families, 5 adults and 9 kids)
showerReviews.author: Kimberley Hargreaves

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely little Campsite. Close to train links in to Liverpool a Manchester. A 5 min walk takes to you to a lovely bar serving hot food.  Facilities good but as an individual preference I'd have preferred designated men and women's Facilities. Shower area and toilets shared. So whilst in shower a man could be in toilet next to shower cubicle. However, that's just my preference.
showerReviews.author: M Fogg

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolute gem of a campsite! Janette is absolutely lovely - really friendly, amazing host who makes you feel very welcome and comfortable from the minute you arrive.
A massive plus for us is how dog friendly the site and cafe is.
The site is very well maintained and clean. Toilets/showers/washing up/waste disposal all included and all facilities kept tidy - always stocked with toilet paper which is unusual for camp sites! üòÜ
We loved the free range chickens roaming about and I even enjoy the cockerel replacing my alarm clock in the morning.
Really quiet during the night - no noise from traffic or anything (we were in a tent!) Wouldn‚Äôt have known there was a train station very close by.
They were doing a charity bbq this weekend and it was amazing! Saved us having to cook one night. We are already planning to be back several times over the next few months.
This camp site has converted us from always visiting the East Coast! Massive thanks to Janette and her team.
showerReviews.author: natalie eyles

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location, 5mins from M58 In a lovely quiet location, fantastic pub across the road serving brilliant food and live music most nights. Train station next to the campsite with easy links into Liverpool.

On site there is a brilliant cafe that does great breakfasts and lunch options. Very good ! On arrival we were welcomed by the owner who is a lovely, friendly lady who shows you to your plot and can often be seen around the site talking to campers asking how they are. Really approachable.

We stopped on a tent pitch with electric hookup. Ground was flat and easy to knock pegs in with.

The facilities in our opinion weren‚Äôt to the standard we were used to for the amount per night we were paying. We have paid similar ( and often less) for a higher standard. For what is quite a large site there is only one small building which had 2 showers, 2 toilets and one pot wash. During our 3 night stay there was a number of occasions when the toilets wouldn‚Äôt flush and there was no toilet paper.

Paths were a mix of grass and rough gravel with no lights on pathways.

The location of the site is about 1.5 mile walk to the local coop. I think this is the closest. A small offering on site would be a brilliant addition. Maybe using the same hours as the cafe ?

I wouldn‚Äôt let the above put you off. We would stay again. We were fortunate to be doing a park run one day and a triathlon the next so could shower and wash at the event.

We said that with  little investment on facilities, small shop and paths / lighting this really could go from an ok campsite to a fantastic campsite.
showerReviews.author: Al Houghton

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed here two nights, the campsite was clean with lots of space and grassy areas. There are two showers with plenty of room, two loos and a was up sink, perfectly adequate for our needs. There's a lovely cafe on site and we enjoyed a delicious breakfast. Lots of walking from the site, we walked into Rainford along a dedicated trail and found plenty of shops and pubs/eateries. Pretty village. Just across the bridge from the site is a pub serving beer and food if you don't fancy a walk. Close to railway but not noisy.
showerReviews.author: Tracy Barber

showerReviews.reviewText: This camp site is in Arrowbrooke. A beautiful farm, lots of open fields and if you wish to park your vehicle and leave it I would feel quite safe in doing so. You can get the bus or train to Liverpool from here within a short walk. We travelled to West kirby. Moreton & Liverpool docks. I'm sure plenty of other locations are available. The campsite offers seperate shower block for men and women which are very clean and the showers are warm and are not restricted on time. Hooks available for clothing in the showers with big mirrors which i know us ladies appreciate. No sockets in showers though. They have toilet emptying facilities. Washing pot facilities. Electric hook up if needed. Water top up. We arrived in June 2023. Pretty flat pitches and all is grass. Phone signals are great too. Trevor is always on site and nothing is any trouble if you need anything. We came here 9 years ago and we will definitely return. Thank you Trevor. Very peaceful and beautiful site. Carl and Rachael & Izzy the dog üêï
showerReviews.author: Rachael Odom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very basic facilities, difficult in the shower due to lack of space in the cubicle.
The field was unmowed so not easy to walk across and difficult to see dog poo which was behind our tent.
The farmer was pretty miserable and came to settle up by making a gesture rubbing his fingers together, I thought that was quite rude.
One wash up for the whole site which is totally inadequate.
I definitely wouldn't recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely brilliant!

Stayed here this previous weekend for the champions league. First time campers due to not wanting to pay ¬£400 for a hotel room that weekend.

We were told check in was 12pm, but we got there a little earlier and were allowed to pitch up straight away.

The gent who greeted us and showed us where to go was amazing. Made us feel very welcome and showed us all the facilities (knowing we weren't staying properly so wouldn't use half of it) so we all had a laugh regarding this.

Toilets and showers seemed to be very new and really clean at all times.

Lovely area, you can't hear any roads and felt like we're in the middle of nowhere when we woke in the morning.

Felt very secure and really impressed with the whole venue. It's changed our opinions on camping and have discussed doing it more now.

Thanks so much for your hospitality!
üòÉ
showerReviews.author: Charlotte Amson

showerReviews.reviewText: Very nice campsite on a main road so very good buses will drop you right outside. Very clean showers and toilets üöª. The only downside was the electricity kept playing up but we were quite a large group and it was cold so all the kettles going on and heating in our vans no wonder. showerReviews.reviewText:
To be fair as it was our first time out in our motorhome we can't really judge the site properly.
However if all sites are as good as this one we certainly won't be complaining!

The site itself was extremely well maintained.
The toilet/shower facilities were excellent, as were the facilities needed for the usual camping requirements (waste/ fresh water etc).
We found all the staff to be cheerful, friendly and very helpful.

The view, well it's spectacular particularly at sunset!

Unfortunately the fish & chop van (mentioned in other reviews) no longer visits the site, but they do still have a pizza guy/van who comes to the site every Friday.

locations.title: Jacksmere Camping
locations.address: ÓÉàJacksmere Ln, Scarisbrick, Southport PR8 5JA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
It was my second time staying at Jacksmere Farm and yet again, it exceeded all of our expectations and more.

‚Ä¢ Spacious
‚Ä¢ Hot Showers
‚Ä¢ Clean Facilities
‚Ä¢ Washing up station
‚Ä¢ Plug socket station for those who are not on an electric hook-up
‚Ä¢ Paddling pool and bouncy castle for the kids
‚Ä¢ Beautiful animals on the farm that are super friendly
‚Ä¢ Dog friendly
‚Ä¢ Fire pit hire. Although there is a down time at night, you are not expected to put your fire out at a specific time (unlike other campsites). As long as you aren‚Äôt causing a nuisance, you are left to your own devices.
‚Ä¢ Great location. Supermarkets less than a 5 minutes drive away.
‚Ä¢ Beautiful Views
‚Ä¢ Quiet surroundings

The owner of the farm (Dave), was extremely welcoming and very friendly. There wasn‚Äôt enough he could do for us. He showed us around the grounds and let us feed the animals. We really appreciated this.

Overall, it‚Äôs a great spot. We will be back again.
showerReviews.author: Jennifer Reed

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a hell hole!!! Nothing like the pictures, no bar or restaurant, infact you‚Äôre lucky to get warm water to wash up with!!
On arrival we was presented with an overgrown wild feild full of horse shite.
Over the phone we was told it was ¬£60 per tent and he preferred cash rather than booking online. For 3 tents we was charged ¬£260 for two nights. Facilities are an old damp filthy rotten hut with a curtain over the entry doors, not sure which was male or female, risk it if you‚Äôre brave enough.
We had all travelled quite a way so decided to rough it out for the sake of the children.
Horses roaming freely, getting their legs tangled in the tents, braking our belongings and pooing everywhere.
Two nights of no sleep, because of wild people in the next tent and the following night horses braking our things that were left in the front of our tents, too paranoid to sleep incase me and my children were trampled by horses while we slept. In the pictures it show a cute little pond!! Instead there is an inflatable pool filled with muddy water and two broken trampolines.
Everyone quested him about the facilities and he says ‚Äú I don‚Äôt no about things online‚Äù
Do not give this human your hard earned money
showerReviews.author: Sarah Theaker

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely helpful owners and a really pleasant stay. I went for the off grid experience in a tent with no electrical hookup. I really enjoyed boiling a camping kettle and cooking on a fire. Bring some pound coins for the showers! There is a supermarket, pub, plus shops and caf√©s about a 25 minute walk from the campsite. Turn right out of the entrance and take one road all the way there. Prices are low too!

showerReviews.reviewText:
We were looking for a campsite to put our rooftent on while we were driving a rallye through the UK.

The campsite Was wonderful, lots of space, completely fine toilets and showers so we just posted the campsite in our rallye WhatsApp Group.

after visiting the local pub, we saw, that up to 10 other teams joined us on the beautiful campsite.

thanks to Ian, who is a great host and the owner of this campsite!

Next time we are in the UK, we are definetly coming back

showerReviews.reviewText: Just recently stayed here for 1 night with my BF in Original Pod 2, overall a nice stay, pod nice and cosy and clean, wash block was clean and tidy,  hot tub clean hot and a nice experience only minor issue we only had 1 small towel per person provided in cabin which is not enough to get dry after using hot tub and then unable to shower without attempting to get dry with damp towel. i feel 2 x bath towels and 2 x normal towels would make all the difference as  you need a small towel to put on cabin floor to prevent it from flooding when coming in from outside especially during the colder months.  we will be staying again but will try a different pod so we can see what the others other so we can compare as over all staff friendly, caf√© nice coffee and cake and friendly staff also onsite shops a nice treat.  If your ordering a takeaway do not use Pizza Pan over 1hour 15min waiting for delivery and then arrived to wrong location, in the summer season the onsite caf√© is open later so we would eat there if we stay during those months  but as its winter it closed at 4pm but can see why due to demand.
showerReviews.author: Scott Davies

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked here for two nights.  We booked a pitch with electric and hot tub.
The pitch was a decent size.
Had its own drinking water tap too.
The hot tub was hot and a good size so made the most of this.
The site is a good size and is very popular with families and larger groups.
The toilets and showers were clean and tidy.
The site has a few shops and bar/restaurant/cafe. You can also hire pods/glamping on this site.
There is a big field with football nets and a large park for children.
There‚Äôs a dog park here and dog wash station.
Around our hot tub area there was a as few weeds and bricks/stones which wouldn‚Äôt have taken much to tidy up and make it look a little nicer.
But over all we had a nice couple of days.
showerReviews.author: Jo

showerReviews.reviewText: Not for us unfortunately, we‚Äôve left a day early from a 3 night touring pitch. It is all a bit rough around the edges, a little bit grotty. Shower block was very smelly, toilet paper strewn all over, and I‚Äôm pretty sure the ceiling has been shot with a pellet gun at some point! It‚Äôs also a loud site, not good when trying to put a 2 year old to bed, and also under a flight path to John Lennon airport, again not brilliant for the toddler. It was very dusty, gravel bumpy roads meant the pram and dog were filthy every time we went out. We also came back to our pitch to see a dog had pee‚Äôd on our awning, We were next to a caravan that seemed to be there on a seasonal pitch, and the lad inside smoked weed morning noon and night, again not ideal when kids are around. I paid ¬£10 for WIFI for the three nights which was a total waste of money, it barely worked once. The bins were always overflowing, and litter everywhere around our pitch. We ordered takeout bacon sandwiches, 2 pieces of bacon in a very dry bun, not worth the money. Staff are friendly and didn‚Äôt have to wait long to be served,  and quirky little shops and stalls are nice to look around. Overall, we won‚Äôt be returning, run down, worn out, and in need of some investment.
showerReviews.author: Arthur b Scho

locations.title: Freshfield Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉàVictoria Rd, Formby, Liverpool L37 1YD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Freshfield Caravan Park is a tranquil retreat located in the picturesque region of Formby, near Liverpool, England. Nestled amidst stunning natural beauty, the park offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. It is renowned for its well-maintained grounds, offering a mix of static caravans and spaces for touring caravans and motorhomes. The park is an ideal destination for families, couples, and solo travelers seeking relaxation and adventure.

A standout feature of Freshfield Caravan Park is its proximity to Formby Beach and the enchanting Formby Pinewoods, home to a population of rare red squirrels. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks, cycling, and birdwatching in this beautiful setting. The park is also conveniently located near local amenities, including shops, restaurants, and pubs, ensuring guests have everything they need for a comfortable stay.

Freshfield Caravan Park provides essential facilities such as modern shower blocks, laundry services, and a children‚Äôs play area, enhancing the overall experience for guests. The friendly and helpful staff are dedicated to ensuring a pleasant stay, making Freshfield Caravan Park a favorite among those looking to explore the natural wonders of the northwest coast of England.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Bright

showerReviews.reviewText:
For some reason Google thinks this is a hotel! It's a caravan site! We stayed 3 nights on an awning pitch,  but in the end didn't bother with our awning. Arrived mid afternoon and quickly found one of the pitches that was suggested (having requested a pitch near to water as I have mobility issues). As always, the entire site was clean and well maintained. Can't comment on toilet and wash facilities as we always use our own.
However... we are currently staying on a commercial site in a"hot" tourist site with a larger, fully serviced pitches with free high speed WiFi for about the same cost per night. CAMC seems to have forgotten that it is a member's club and is trying to compete at least on pricing with the likes of Haven.
showerReviews.author: Kevin Warrington

locations.title: Haven Marton Mere Holiday Village
locations.address: ÓÉàMythop Rd, Blackpool FY4 4XN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Short 4 night break. Weather not brilliant but it is November! The caravan itself was excellent value. Large living/dining area. Well equipped kitchen. 2 bedrooms but only using 1 for sleeping (bags stored in 2nd). Small bathroom but decent size shower with good water pressure. Added bonus of en-suite toilet and wash basin in main bedroom. The double bed seems larger than others we have stayed in which does mean very little space on one side but loads of room on the other side. As well as power sockets, they also incorporate phone charging ports. Central heating in our van (saver model) which was lovely to wake up to a nice warm caravan. All in all z great cheap break away
showerReviews.author: Ron Blakey

locations.title: Brio Northgate
locations.address: ÓÉàVictoria Rd, Chester CH2 2AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: The pool is a huge fun pool, with a water slide and a large shallow area so kids can have fun. There's a good size viewing balcony. There are small slides for under 5s and little seating areas in the water. There were a lot of people play fighting in the pool, which I personally didn't like as you kept having to make sure you avoid them. The changing rooms are also large and there are 4 family changing rooms, but you can't then access the hairdryers etc from them, you have to go into the single sex changing rooms, which is tricky for father and daughter to do. Instead of lockers, they have a basket system where you put all your clothes and towels in a basket, hand it over, and get a wristband. There is a second more traditional 25m pool for swim lessons and kayak and various other training things. The cafe has been refurbished and also has a lot of seating areas. There isn't always a member of staff to serve you. You have to press a silent button and wait in hope, between 1 and 5 mins, for someone to appear and serve you. The sports hall is well kept and multi purpose, I saw pickleball and trampolining when I was there. The gym is upstairs, which I didn't see but was very popular. Parking is next to the arena.
showerReviews.author: Paul Garner

showerReviews.reviewText: The pool is a huge fun pool, with a water slide and a large shallow area so kids can have fun. There's a good size viewing balcony. showerReviews.reviewText:
It is a cheap experience for families, which is certainly a pro.
It has small slides for smaller children and a flume-type slider for older children and adults, so it's a great place for kids.
The water is fairly cool, although heated but it isn't 'cold'.
The changing rooms are quite a poor standard - all hooks have been snapped off the wall and there are no cubicles - it is open plan changing rooms. There should be at least a couple of cubicles for those who wish to use them. There are family change cubicles but the queue for these is always rather large.
During the casual swim, the lifeguards were not enforcing the swim lanes, which is an area 'cordoned off' from the family pool to allow people who wish to swim lengths to do so. It probably makes more sense to do away with the swim lanes during the casual swim if it isn't going to be enforced. This in turn means people can spread out more in the pool as it feels very cramped particularly at busy times.
Overall I recommend. It has it's issues but it is a CIC so isn't purely about profit.
Parking is free for customers for up to 3 hours.
showerReviews.author: Joe T

showerReviews.reviewText:
We visited the Northgate Arena for a casual swim as a family of 5. The changing facilities are good for families with specific family changing rooms, and there is lots of space.
It was clean and warm in the changing areas. The pool was cool, not too cold, but not warm. It is clear that no money has been put back in to the place because it has not changed in years. The slide was not working and the place looks absolutely nothing like it shows on the website or on Google images. It is very run down compared to most other pools that we have been to.
Despite that, we had a good hour long swim and then had lunch in the cafe which was nice. We didn't wait long at all, and the food was served hot - it was enjoyed by us all.
showerReviews.author: Hayley Falconer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Been going to Northgate arena for years, both for casual swimming and for children's swimming lessons. Staff have always been great and children love the swimming lessons.

However, the whole centre is looking very tired. Constant broken benches and showers in the changing rooms. Tiles coming off the wall. Paint peeling. Fountains in the swimming pool always have cones on top. Half the viewing area is closed off, was told 4 years ago it would be fixed in months, still not fixed.

In general it is a great facility with great people, but it needs a lot of investment to give it a facelift and properly repair the numerous temporary fixes!
showerReviews.author: Tim Powell

showerReviews.reviewText: THE last time i went here swimming, and i do mean the last time,  i was in the main pool resting on the side when a cock roach walked past.  Unbelievable. The pool guy just brushed it aside and joked about it.  The slide is always OOS.  The steam room is pathetic and costs more.  When i was a kid (40years ago) it was such a great place.  Its now a disaster. The staff at reception need customer service lessons.  It could be so much better.  The location is great thats about all.  Very sad.
showerReviews.author: Chris Maggs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited Northgate arena for the first time in 20 years today as I wanted to show my son the pool. We planned to visit Tumble Tots (soft play in the sports hall) then go for a swim but when we arrived we were advised that we could only go to the under 5s session in the pool so had to miss most of Tumble Tots to make the pool session. Doesn‚Äôt make sense that these sessions overlap really? It also wasn‚Äôt completely clear why we had to go to the under 5s session, there is a baby area in the pool so surely we can just use this at anytime? We might have missed something

Tumble Tots was fantastic. Great value. Lots to do & good atmosphere.

Unfortunately we can‚Äôt say the same for the pool experience. The pool was sectioned off into lanes & the deeper end looked to be out of service. We wanted to go swimming properly but the baby / shallow end of the  pool is not deep enough to swim so it‚Äôs more just playing in water. The water was very chilly, we had a 45 minute session but the baby was too cold / shaking so we left after under 30 minutes

The pool hasn‚Äôt been updated since I last visited. Definitely in desperate need of an update. The changing rooms were very outdated / pretty grim. I‚Äôm not sure how a mum alone with baby would be able to visit, luckily I had another helper with me. I wasn‚Äôt able to put baby down in the changing rooms as the playpen provided had no padding / bottom to it, just a tiled / concrete floor. If you‚Äôre alone with a baby you can‚Äôt carry baby & the box with all your stuff. There isn‚Äôt a locker system just a big plastic box you carry to the poolside. This just doesn‚Äôt work for parents of under 1s
showerReviews.author: Sarah Hill

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good customer services regarding booking the use of a squash court.
However, the court doesn‚Äôt appear to have been cleaned for a very long time looking at the state of the floor - hair clumps, dust and dirt - despite the obvious check sheet which has been signed every 3 hours. Very cold court with a cold fan on? Uneven floor from water damage (see photos).
After begrudgingly playing our game, we left the dirty court looking forward to a nice hot shower. Unfortunately, the showers in the ladies changing room just about reached a luke warm drizzle and the men‚Äôs didn‚Äôt even reach a Luke warm temperature. Very poor for a facility that offers so many events/activities/clubs on their website.
We requested a refund after a very disappointing experience (only ¬£7 but was requested on principle) but were only offered ¬£3.50 as a gesture of goodwill.
Very doubtful that we will return.
showerReviews.author: Laura

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spa day - my review does not reflect the quality of the treatment - the staff were friendly and I had a great massage. However, the 20 year old CD player in the treatment room didn't work, so no music!! The face mask to test skin type didn't work. The pool area was overrun with children all morning and was not a place to relax. No separate area for spa guests to relax. The ladies changing rooms were dirty and a young mum was trying to dress her baby on the only seating.....
I'm coeliac, the gluten free afternoon tea was not worth the money, the cheapest supermarket gluten free bread, a scone and some not very good chocolate. cake. Never again!! Don't say you can provide GF if this is the best you can do, it was appalling for the price.

showerReviews.reviewText: I joined this gym,¬£40 membership for a student to swim and gym and I cannot believe they‚Äôve put the prices up . The The women's changing rooms stunk weekly, the swimsuit dryer was broken and out of order . The chlorine levels were once too high in the jacuzzi (the chlorine meter was apparently broken ) so many members were left coughing and couldn‚Äôt go near it . There was dirt in each corner of the pool which is never removed . The gym had damaged equipment which another member has complained about because it is a safety hazard and nothing was done about this . Finally the amount of plastic waste (because they supplied hundreds of plastic cups per day to members which are thrown in the bin seconds later) is terrible ; they could‚Äôve easily supplied paper cups .

locations.title: Brio Christleton
locations.address: ÓÉàPlough Ln, Christleton, Chester CH3 7AS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym

I‚Äôve never experienced anything as disgraceful as what happened at Brio Christleton Gym. A group of us were literally kicked out for ‚Äúinappropriate footwear,‚Äù even though we were wearing normal trainers with ZERO mud‚Äîno wet mud, no dry mud, nothing. Just the usual light dust any shoe has from walking outside. Yet we were accused of making a mess, which was a complete lie.

The woman working at around 3 o‚Äôclock was unbelievably rude from the moment she approached us. She repeatedly talked down to us, accused us of dirtying the gym, and refused to listen to anything we said. Her attitude was unprofessional, aggressive, and absolutely unacceptable for someone working in customer service‚Äîespecially in a place charging such high membership fees.

To make it even worse, several other members were kicked out for the exact same false reason. None of us had muddy shoes. Not one. This makes their actions even more ridiculous and shows how poorly managed this gym really is.

We even offered to go outside and wash our shoes, but she refused and demanded we leave immediately. No conversation. No respect. Just arrogance and attitude.

And let‚Äôs talk about the facility:
‚Ä¢	The gym is already dirty, with floors that definitely don‚Äôt look like they‚Äôre cleaned regularly.
‚Ä¢	The gym is cramped, poorly maintained, and simply not worth the money members are paying.
‚Ä¢	On top of that, the place is understaffed, and the call wait times are ridiculous‚Äîgood luck trying to get help or speak to anyone without waiting forever.

For what they charge every month, this level of treatment is beyond insulting. It‚Äôs embarrassing. If they put even half as much effort into cleaning the gym as they do into falsely accusing members, maybe the place wouldn‚Äôt be in such poor condition.

I strongly recommend avoiding Brio Christleton Gym. Between the rude staff, the unprofessional behaviour of the 3 o‚Äôclock employee, the lack of cleanliness, the understaffing, and the unjustified harassment of paying members, this gym is absolutely not worth your time or money.
showerReviews.author: Tom Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText: TL:DR dont send autistic children/dependents here the leadership wont accomidate them, though the teachers will and are amazing. I have been sending my son to swimming lessons here. I have nothing but positive things to say about the two teachers he has been with, however because of his autistic tendencies (going through official assessment) he refuses to participate with teachers he is not comfortable with, it took a few weeks to get him comfortable with the teachers he likes. those teachers are on leave(subs have been supplied but never met my son) and we requested a pause of his membership which is only 3 sessions over a month or two. My family is very disabled and as such were on benefits so these lessons are quite expensive for us, something were happy to provide for my son but still not something we can easily waste money on. The lessons and teachers are great but the unwillingness of the leadership to accommodate (which is there right) autistic individuals speaks highly of how they think and feel to those in need. Asking an autistic person to simply get over there issues is tantamount to asking a wheel chair user to simply use the stairs. My recommendation is if you have an autistic child or dependent to avoid this company and find somewhere that are willing and understand what it to teach and look after different issues.
showerReviews.author: Kurzon Morris

showerReviews.reviewText: I am extremely disappointed with the swimming lessons that my daughter received at this place. Despite being moved to level 3, she was not progressing and had been stuck there for about a year. It was clear that they were just placing students based on class size and not their ability. I wasted a lot of time and money, as it was only after taking my daughter to another independent place that she was assessed as being at level 5. It is evident that this place is not professional and I would not recommend it to anyone looking for quality swimming lessons.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Genuinely have no idea why people would attend Total Fitness Chester?

GYM: no better than Gym Group / Pure Gym, maybe a little quieter but older equipment than those 2, plus new JD gym opening nearby. Also considerably more expensive.

Staff / Pricing: Very old fashioned and sleezy feel to it's pricing structure, one of / the most expensive gym in the area, aggressive sales tactics, add on prices needed to access many of the services (Childrens swimming extra, Small classes cost more etc.)

Classes: If your main focus is classes, you'll get better quality from FACTR, BABE Fitness etc. - Very difficult to book total fitness classes (Many booked 1 week in advance) puregym etc. also always has space in their classes so no need to worry about planning 5+ days in advance.

Pool: The only reason you should consider it over JD Gym, Pure Gym, Fit Group, FACTR etc. is because it has a pool, and honestly once northgate opens up again this won't be a selling point. The pool is OK, overall poorly maintained, changing rooms are grotty with bugs, the whole thing feels super dated.

They also sold the parking to a third party company (not sure why, you can see via land registry they own it) so expect a hefty fine if you stay too long.
showerReviews.author: Antonio

locations.title: Chester-le-Street Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàBurns Green, Chester-le-Street DH3 3QH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Used the soft play with my toddler (2yrs) and baby (4 months) and will not be returning due to the lack of baby changing facilities on the same floor as the soft play. The only facilities for me (a woman) to take my children are up two flights of stairs. My baby was in the pushchair and when I asked the receptionist how I was supposed to get upstairs with the pushchair while carrying my toddler she asked why didn‚Äôt the seat of my pushchair unclip. I even had offers from some lovely users of the pool to look after my toddler while I took the baby upstairs but I am not comfortable with leaving my child with a stranger. I was told I couldn‚Äôt use the pool changing as I can‚Äôt take the pushchair in there which makes it incredibly difficult to carry both toddler, baby and the nappy bag. I shouldn‚Äôt be made to feel that I cannot take two small children in nappies out to places by myself that are made for children and I find it hard to believe this has never been raised as an issue before.
showerReviews.author: Gemma Hindmarch

showerReviews.reviewText:
This gym has been a really frustrating experience. There‚Äôs a serious lack of equipment ‚Äî I‚Äôve been kicked off the only ski erg mid-workout for a class, even though it wasn‚Äôt being used and sat empty 10 minutes later. Staff handle situations poorly, and members often behave passive-aggressively, making the environment stressful rather than motivating.

On top of that, the showers are unsafe and poorly maintained ‚Äî most of the doors don‚Äôt even lock, which makes changing extremely uncomfortable. I‚Äôve also experienced harassment from another member who has been staring at me while I change, which has left me feeling unsafe.

Overall, this gym does not feel welcoming, safe, or well-managed. I cannot recommend it.

The staff are friendly and helpful, and the atmosphere is welcoming for all levels. Changing rooms and showers are kept tidy, and the sauna is a great bonus after a session. Parking is easy too which makes it really convenient.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is an absolutely brilliant gym, with so much top notch equipment and excellent facilities.
The only issue I‚Äôm having is that there is a male member of staff almost constantly in the ladies changing room. He‚Äôs very polite and respectful, but on the three occasions I‚Äôve been in there, he‚Äôs always there hoovering or something which could surely be done once the changing rooms have closed. It‚Äôs a bit awkward when you‚Äôre changing for the sauna or showers because there are only two private cubicles.
Today I was in the sauna for about 20 minutes and on three separate occasions during that time a man came in, either to clean or for a security check. They always announce themselves and I understand that male members of staff may need to enter, but could you not at least try to have a woman doing it? Or maybe make it a little less frequent?
It‚Äôs interesting that Jeff below has had a similar experience. The sign on the sauna also needs changing because the guy will turn it off and open the door at 7:30pm.
showerReviews.author: R J Curry

locations.title: Guildford Lido
locations.address: ÓÉà5 Lido Rd, Stoke Park, Guildford GU1 1HB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Loved evening lane swimming here in summer and now love that it's open all year round. The water is heated, although still cold, but perfect for wetsuit swimming if you're into open water swimming - many people brave it without wetsuits fine tho! Its nice and quiet over winter so you get a lane to yourself, unlike packed indoor pools. The pool is now considerably clearer than summer too and the hot showers and clean changing rooms help with it getting colder into winter.
Thank you Lido team who are keeping it open and clean, looking forward to the new additional facilities being added soon!
showerReviews.author: Vic West

showerReviews.reviewText:
Loved evening lane swimming here in summer and now love that it's open all year round. showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm conflicted. On the own hand I want to sing the Lido's praises. But on the other I don't want it to become popular. But that ship may have sailed! I'd like it to be economically viable. But stop shy of busy! But if the recent queues are anything to go by then I'm going to be disappointed!

I come for the morning swim session before the crowds. There are nine lanes. Three each for fast, medium and slow. And the good people of Guildford are wonderfully accommodating of speed differences within those lanes.

The staff do a remarkable job of keeping the pool clean. Occasionally there are unattractive clumps of matted hair at the bottom. There's the inevitable sand or grit that collects. And it's not immune to a stray plaster. But I think they've got themselves an underwater hoover because it's looking good at the moment. And for someone who spends 45 minutes with his head down looking at the bottom, that's a much more pleasant view.

I'm surprised there are only two male showers. I may have missed the others. But in the morning I've only had to wait a couple of times for them to become free. The lack of bike storage is scandalous for a leisure organisation. This gets used up very quicky in the morning session. There are four bike stands on the left hand side of the entrance and four spaces for bikes on the right hand side if they're not instructed by mopeds. Apparently there are plans to improve bike parking.

This place is a real gem. It's brightened my first summer in Guildford.
showerReviews.author: Richard Perkins

locations.address: ÓÉàPuddingmoor, Beccles NR34 9PL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely 30m pool, heated to around 28¬∞ during the summer season. We booked in advance on the website for an early morning lane swim as this is a popular pool and sessions can reach capacity. The pool is fairly wide (about 16m), with 4 lanes (slow/ medium-slow/ medium-fast/ fast) which work really well as there is plenty of room to swim breaststroke and even overtake within each lane. There is also a smaller pool for younger kids. The main pool has a small water slide, plus a low diving board, which are open during the casual swim sessions. Staff are friendly + 2 attentive lifeguards at either side of the pool. There is limited free parking at the pool, but there is an additional free car park along the road. There are traditional changing cubicles, which are clean, warm outdoor showers, and a relatively new toilet block. Lockers are available (¬£1 refundable), and there's a small tuck shop on site. Definitely a pool worth visiting ü§ó
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow, what a brilliant place to visit. I was really impressed and will definitely visit again.
The pool is a really good size and it's busy but not over busy. It's a heated outdoor pool so it's a good temperature.
There is also a spring board which is great fun.
We had some chips which were good value and a decent price.
Next time we'll aim for a double ticket  so we can try the inflatable too.
Around the pool there are sunbeds and some umbrellas but we took our own chairs as well as it was busy around the pool.
There are changing rooms (outdoors ) which were clean and dry and the toilet facilities were clean and well looked after.
We used the meadows parking which was worth it .
showerReviews.author: Adam Bevan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful place. A very bad experience from start to finish. I took my children who were excited to spend a few hours there and we end up leaving in 15 minutes.

Very run down place and hygiene is not great. The pool is filled with trees leaves and ants.

They didn‚Äôt allow my 7 and halt year to go on the blue slide saying the rule is 8+ while most water parks around the world look the height as this safer and staff can verify. I saw other children who were much younger and when asked the staff they said we appreciate you didn‚Äôt lie like others. I didn‚Äôt come across any of these rules prior on the website which meant I wasted time and money going there.

It was around 14:30 and all the sudden they shut the doors to the slides with no notice displayed or anything explained.

Steer away. Not worth a penny. I would give it 0 star.
showerReviews.author: Abdelfatah Ibrahim

showerReviews.reviewText: This is a huge outdoor, unheated pool. Sections of the pool, which is an irregular shape, are divided into  slides/splash area, an area for families, and a section for lane swimming. The outdoor pool is part of a leisure centre with indoor pool, but access to the outdoor pool is separate to the leisure centre and can be reached via the car park. Plenty of free parking. We went for an early morning lane swim - there were only 4 of us in the pool, so plenty of space and the local/regular swimmers made us feel really welcome (even giving us 'Friends of Aldershot Lido' swimming caps, which were a lovely souvenir of our visit). The laned section of the pool is about 25-30m & fairly deep. Pool is well maintained and lovely to see the traditional fountain in operation. Changing facilities are basic but clean & clean toilets and hot showers. Lockers available poolside, but bring padlock. Overall we really enjoyed our visit üòä
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: I was scared of doing weights and gyms in general (ironic given my love of all things sporty). Tom has set me on track for losing weight steadily, toning up and being able to enjoy running/cycling/swimming etc more because I'm stronger and fitter. Been going 3 times a week for 5 weeks and already my runs feel totally different. I'm so grateful. Tom is so good at helping me push myself hard but being kind with it. showerReviews.reviewText:
Without a doubt one of the best truck stops that there is. Clean, plenty of parking and friendly staff. The truck park itself is on level ground, so you're not lop sided when you're sleeping. The showers are proper showers - not the ones where you have to keep pressing a button for any water. There's a hot water urn and a microwave available all the time for instant hot water for your cuppa / flask or warming your food. The cafe is great - good food at low prices too. Honestly - best truck stop I've been to in a long time.
Staff - 5üåü, facilities 5üåü, food 5üåü. This is how a truck stop should be.

locations.title: Moto Blyth
locations.address: ÓÉàHill Top Roundabout, A1(M), A614 S81 8HG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Well let me start with this, there is ample room for walking your dog,  fairly large amount of undulating terrain arranged in such a way that simulates a reasonable route around half the perimeter of the services itself. Granted it's not particularly scenic but it's next to a motorway so what do you expect? The rolling hills of Scotland? Furthermore I found the inside of the service station to be exactly as I've come to expect from a services. Unfortunately nothing sets it apart from the others but that's not to say there's anything wrong with it. I had a burger king meal, someone tried to claim it as their own when the number was called out but I can't put that on the service station, the good lady had a wrap from M&S which was likely fine. I've marked the services down a star because I used the wash room and found the smell to be rather pungent, of unrine. Now this isn't uncommon I know and probably expected, I'm willing to review this later on in life when I return. But until then it's a soild 4. Which does put in it my top 10 of services in the UK (northern half) Stay say.
showerReviews.author: Ed Manley

showerReviews.reviewText: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Well let me start with this, there is ample room for walking your dog,  fairly large amount of undulating terrain arranged in such a way that simulates a reasonable route around half the perimeter of the services itself. Granted it's not particularly scenic but it's next to a motorway so what do you expect? The rolling hills of Scotland? Furthermore I found the inside of the service station to be exactly as I've come to expect from a services. Unfortunately nothing sets it apart from the others but that's not to say there's anything wrong with it. I had a burger king meal, someone tried to claim it as their own when the number was called out but I can't put that on the service station, the good lady had a wrap from M&S which was likely fine. I've marked the services down a star because I used the wash room and found the smell to be rather pungent, of unrine. Now this isn't uncommon I know and probably expected, I'm willing to review this later on in life when I return. But until then it's a soild 4. Which does put in it my top 10 of services in the UK (northern half) Stay say.
showerReviews.author: Ed Manley

showerReviews.reviewText: I‚Äôve been asked to elaborate on my rating and in fairness, I should have done so originally. Arriving on a wet busy Twixmas afternoon, the service station was really busy, floors wet, tables needed a clean down and the general feeling was pretty meh. That said, I can imagine on a warm summers day with more people sitting outside it may have an entirely different feeling to the place. But our visit, on this day, was just a bit meh. Long queue to get into the car park to find there were in fact lots of spaces but the layout meant people parking caused tailbacks. Three staff wearing hi vis, apparently there to assist with parking, standing doing nothing. Two on their phones, one standing with a sign stating Spaces Here but not holding it aloft meant no one could see it.  The bathrooms were wet and there were papers littered on the floor in the cubicle, with a wet seat and not in the best condition as a result. We‚Äôve all been there, and even hourly checks would have struggled to keep the cloakrooms up to scratch on a wet busy day, and ultimately, it‚Äôs down to the users to make an effort. Visited the food shop and grabbed a burger meal (dry burger and bland fries)and staff were pretty indifferent.  The service station itself provided a service but it‚Äôs a splash and dash, not one I would want to take a break at, particularly compared with others on the same south to north road trip.
showerReviews.author: Lorna W

showerReviews.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by this service area as it would seem that the staff here have pride in their little services.  They were polite and noted tables and carpark  being cleaned and picked from litter and  the place seemed well cared for.   like most UK service areas there are the usual fast food and takeaway stuff. But it was the staff that impressed me.  Toilets where clean and the shower was very hot and much appreciated the shower cubicle could do with being bigger and as it's small and the shower curtain replaced  but overall was a good experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
as a Trucker.  It‚Äôs average small welcome Break. Ok for a stop but not for much else.
HGV parking charge is a ripoff for what you get (30¬£ without vouchers 33¬£ with). Due to the showers being worse than a prison/ barracks, due no bench or much space to change or wash basin .
There‚Äôs NO WiFi in the truck park, let alone only having one bar of signal(yes phone providers limit) but charging hotel prices it should be expected.
Truck parking is on a hill, not the worst but not ideal.
Very limited hot food options eg burger King or the shop deli or a coffee shop. There is a Waitrose.
No quiet area if busy bar retreating back to the truck .
Some of what I‚Äôve mentioned can be mentioned of the mainstream services and gets put down by some proper truck stops that have WiFi and decent showers and decent cafe with healthy and much better price options. But few off around.

Personally I think around 15¬£ a night would be better with a 6¬£ meal voucher and that‚Äôs pushing it.
33¬£ I can book into a hotel with way better facilities and value for money.
I would like to remind services with out trucks you would have nothing to sell or provide. And even if are employers will repay us it‚Äôs still a lot to ask.
I doubt any main stream service will take on my points I have said, and I‚Äôve tried to be fair and honest but if you charge top whack you‚Äôre going to be judged by that. But I hope by fare reviewing sites it will possibly aid in the future of improving are industry and how truck drivers/humens are treated and ripped off for doing there job and complaining with strict rules.
showerReviews.author: Stevo One

showerReviews.author: L1653CIraphaels

showerReviews.reviewText: The property itself is very beautiful and well maintained. The grounds are lovely as well. We booked a private room which was decent enough. The carpet could use a vacuum and the bathroom does have a bit of mould in the corners. I will say that there is hot water, the rooms are warm and the beds were 100% clean. The kitchen is a basic one and there is no stove or oven, just microwaves. It is open 24x7 though which is a plus. Overall a comfortable stay. You need to keep reminding yourself that it is a hostel at the end of the day (it's easy to forget that when you look at the place) and lower expectations accordingly. For a hostel, it was a good one. No regrets.
showerReviews.author: Shikha Rao

showerReviews.reviewText: The main issues are the old hobs that take ages to heat up and that there are no markings on the hob or oven so cooking is guesswork. Secondary issue is that could piss harder than the water pressure in the showers. Aside from this the building itself is nice and they host events in the reception area throughout the year. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Semi-decent place to stay if you have enough money to not have to care about how you waste it. Unfortunately, it is absolutely not worth the money, especially considering they up the price every year. Wouldn't have been worth it three years ago when the prices were lower anyway.

locations.title: Chronicle House - Student Accommodation in Chester
locations.address: ÓÉàCommonhall St, Chester CH1 2AB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Begrudgingly leaving a star (because Google doesn't allow 0 star reviews) but also the reception staff deserve recognition for their attitude and approachability. They were patient and understanding, sympathetic of the issues of tenants this negative review is absolutely no slight against these hard working people, rather the shambolic, exploitative company they work for. It is a shame that such nice people work for a shockingly bad rental company who is demonstrably not concerned about anything aside from your money going into their bank.
The first issue I experienced during my stay was a roof leak, water leaking through my light fitting, cutting off my lights for often months at a time. Months later at the end of my tenancy this still was unresolved. To compound this flagrant disregard for my living conditions the whole building was without hot water for a month during winter. Upon reviewing other reviews on Google, this has been an issue for years!!! And it STILL remains unresolved!? The sheer arrogance to expect you to live with out the basic necessity of hot running water whilst taking your money and not offering any recompense is absolutely diabolical.
I cannot find words strong enough for my displeasure with Xenia as a company. I truly feel sympathy for its employees who are forced to bear responsibility for the immense shortcomings of those in charge of maintaining the living standards of students in Chronicle House. Crooks!
showerReviews.author: Benjamin Jones

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quite literally the worst place I‚Äôve ever stayed in my life. And I was in care as a child :/

I never really make negative reviews as often I think they are over exaggerated. But genuinely, I would never stay here again.

I felt like the staff never cared about any of the students staying here, despite being so kind and friendly before moving in.

The wifi is terrible, the TV in my room was so outdated that I couldn‚Äôt use Netflix. The drawers were broken and pathetically ‚Äòfixed‚Äô back on so they didn‚Äôt even close properly. My heating didn‚Äôt work during winter and they took months to fix it despite my consistent emails and phone calls asking for help.

They only fixed it when I eventually withheld my rent. They charge you ¬£30+ to come let you back in your flat, even though it can take them over 12 hours to let you back in. The hot water didn‚Äôt work for weeks on end. They didn‚Äôt care enough to fix this or really sincerely apologise.

The rent is insanely high for such terrible service and poor quality rooms. When I moved in, my shower didn‚Äôt work because they had taken the parts of my shower (on/off knob) and given it to someone else. They just put the metal casing back on thinking I wouldn‚Äôt notice lol. They also took the fuses out of some of my fuse boxes, including the extractor fan above the hobs.

They kept ringing to tell me I was in arrears with my rent because I hadn‚Äôt paid enough/ on the correct date. However, I had paid ¬£600 per month on the same date as told to by a member of their staff and in email, only to be told that this amount of money was incorrect and that I was supposed to be paying it at the end of the month instead of the start. They forced me to pay twice in the same month meaning I ended up paying ¬£1350 altogether as I had also been told I was underpaying my rent.

Finally, they refused to give me access to my mailbox for months and kept promising me a key. At this point I was paying council tax but was told to wait for the letter stating how to pay it (the letter had my tax number on which I needed to set up an account), however I never received the letter because it was in the letterbox that I was unable to access. The receptionist told me that she would hold on to any of my letters and give me them but obviously that never happened. I was fined almost ¬£100 for not paying my tax on time.

Honestly this place has made me incredibly stressed and I will never recommend, nor live in a Xenia students building again.
showerReviews.author: Lucy Robinson

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been staying at Chronicle House for 2 years. First year was fine with few problems. However, this year has been a complete nightmare. I want money back!
First, there was a burst pipe that flooded the building in the middle of the night and resulted in parts of the ceiling literally collapsing. That took months to be repaired, with the gym being shut down and the corridors under constant repair. Thankfully my room wasn't affected. Then the entire building had no hot water for twelve day in January. One of other student called the head office to complain and they were surprised to learn about this. It seems that the on-site team had not reported this issue to the head office. Fortis Student Living has a history of issues with hot water (search for the Sheffield accommodation hot water).
Not only that, but the problem has only been "temporarily" fixed. It is now March. During this period there was a complete lack of communication about the problem.
Then there was an electrical fire in the gym late at night, meaning the entire building had to be evacuated. None of the staff came down to check if the students were alright and left everything to the student rep. Again, the gym was closed for an extended period of time and the common room heaters have only been fixed a week or so ago. The fire was in January. We then learn that there are no fire extinguishers in the entire building, despite the fact that it is in the contract.
There have been no offers to refund any of our money (water and electricity is included in our rent), which inconvenient seeing as I have already paid for the whole year (international student). It is also exceedingly difficult to contact someone who can actually do anything, as Fortis Student is part of a property group with members from other property developments (e.g. Fortis Development, Fortis Estate Management, Elite Property Group and Beaumont Morgan), making it difficult to figure out who is actually in charge.
Do not go here.
showerReviews.author: Nicola Bandler

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed here for the 2017-18 academic year and have not had the best experience. It all started with a burst pipe in the ceiling of the first floor, which flooded the first and ground floor, the gym and the common room. Which meant living inside a building site for two weeks, for which they could only apologise for the inconvenience. A second leak occurred not too much later on the Second floor and following on from that another leak in the gym. It is only January and now and the hot water is not working for the entire building. It has been like this for the past week. I can confirm cold showers are not nice at 7am. I am however happy with the room, and as long as nothing else goes wrong for the next 6 months of my time here it is a nice location to stay in. Other things to mention are; the website advertises table tennis which doesn't exist and regular social events which happened once when we moved in and haven't heard of since. Overall i'm not impressed with the management of events that occurred as there just didn't seem to be much urgency. Also no compensation for the lack of services we were still paying for. If you plan on living here i hope you don't have the same experience as me.
An update a month after i wrote this, the building suffered an electrical fire in the gym radiator and we all had evacuate for an evening while fire crews dealt with this issue. No management for the building showed up that night to see if we were all ok, the student representative was left to deal with it all. I hate living with the worry something will go wrong again soon.
showerReviews.author: Aaron Patrick

showerReviews.reviewText:
Initially management wasn't that good, now have a whole new team who are a lot better, Dawn and Chris actually get things done, when I first moved in (Sept 2020) the flat was disgusting, I had to deep clean it before using anything, in January 2021, the roof leaked, this was said to be fixed however leaked again in May, May is under the new management and we were offered another room whilst being fixed and it is supposed to be fixed now, other than that room is okay, ¬£150 a week is fairly steep considering we haven't got half of the things promised when signing the contract.
If you don't want the constant smell of weed and noise of drunk people outside running around, I'd recommend somewhere further away from town centre, other than that, the common room is decent, fairly expensive to wash clothes however, being at least ¬£3.10 for a quick wash, and dryer being from ¬£1.60.

Overall, not the best however with new team it is getting better
showerReviews.author: Rebekah Hickman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Initially management wasn't that good, now have a whole new team who are a lot better, Dawn and Chris actually get things done, when I first moved in (Sept 2020) the flat was disgusting, I had to deep clean it before using anything, in January 2021, the roof leaked, this was said to be fixed however leaked again in May, May is under the new management and we were offered another room whilst being fixed and it is supposed to be fixed now, other than that room is okay, ¬£150 a week is fairly steep considering we haven't got half of the things promised when signing the contract.
If you don't want the constant smell of weed and noise of drunk people outside running around, I'd recommend somewhere further away from town centre, other than that, the common room is decent, fairly expensive to wash clothes however, being at least ¬£3.10 for a quick wash, and dryer being from ¬£1.60.

Overall, not the best however with new team it is getting better
showerReviews.author: Rebekah Hickman

locations.address: ÓÉàTower Wharf, Chester CH1 4GX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: It‚Äôs a great location in terms of being close to the city centre. Great way to meet other students. Good study area and communal spaces with a pool table, games, vending machine etc. lovely canal view. There is only approx 6 washing machines and dryers to share between hundreds of people. Living here was a horrible experience. Some staff were lovely and helpful. Other staff were horribly rude and unhelpful. The prices were extortionate and continually rising year on year. I had problems with contracts not being sorted properly and being scammed out of thousands due to no one communicating with each other. Them constantly changing management allowed them to get away with it because they know it‚Äôs not easy for students to find somewhere to go mid term.  Constant gaslighting by the staff. I would recommend anyone staying here to ensure they get absolutely anything they communicate with you in writing or they will lie about it. Don‚Äôt allow maintenance issues to go unresolved because you‚Äôre paying a lot of money for that service. My living conditions were poor and instead of being understood I was blamed and gaslighted. Problems would take months to be resolved with poor communication. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend it but it‚Äôs a great place location wise so just be wary.
showerReviews.author: P S

showerReviews.reviewText:
You pay for location here, and it is undeniably brilliant. It‚Äôs also exceptionally clean. I usually stay at the Premier Inn on City Rd and to be honest- I do wish I had this time round.
Weirdest experience, I‚Äôve never been to a hotel not providing hand soap in the bathroom. I requested it, twice, and got a mug with some of the peppery smelling shower gel stuff in it left for me by reception. Browsing previous reviews, it seems like this hotel just doesn‚Äôt bother with soap.
Ladies on the front desk were lovely but please just be honest that this place doesn‚Äôt bother with providing guests hand soap- that way I could have popped to home bargains nearby.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location and lovely staff! Stayed three nights and really enjoyed the view of the old church and the central location. The staff were friendly, attentive, and handled everything professionally ‚Äî they even offered me a free breakfast after fixing a room issue. The breakfast itself was excellent: fresh, generous, and great value.
A few small things could be improved ‚Äî the towels on arrival were damp, the shower-gel dispenser didn‚Äôt work, and the air conditioning was noisy. The ‚ÄúTop-Up‚Äù door sign was missing too, so I had to go to reception to ask for one.
Overall, a pleasant stay with amazing staff and great breakfast ‚Äî just needs better housekeeping checks and quieter A/C.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Peaceful little site with large pitches a couple of miles out of Chester. A 15 minute flat bike ride along the nearby river Dee pathway or a ¬£9 taxi into the city centre.
Facilities very old school but clean.
No welcome hello or goodbye as this is a working farm I guess.
Tokens needed for the shower (¬£1) and 20p needed for hot water to do the dishes. This was very annoying, it would be so much easier for the owners to charge an extra ¬£1 so people don‚Äôt have to try and find them half dressed on a busy working farm !!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Although you need to be a member of the Caravan and Motorhome Club, it‚Äôs worth joining if only to stay here.  The site (home to many horses) is secure with a huge automated gate at the drives end.    The pitches are fairly flat and a good size. ¬£23 per night includes electricity.   Showers and toilets are available although there is a small fee for the former.

But the proximity to Chester must be the draw.  What a great place to visit and its easily done by bike alongside the river.

We will return

showerReviews.reviewText:
Rowena and Peter are lovely, accommodating people. The campsite is located near to Chester, ideal for walkers or cyclists wishing to visit the city. The scenery and location is stunning, too - my brother and I visited a couple of months back by bike + recumbent trike, and it was the perfect weekend getaway for us as cyclists and nature enthusiasts.

The place is so peaceful, and the shower and toilet facilities are clean and well looked after. If you love animals, there are some beautiful horses around. You may even get visited by a couple of really cute and friendly dogs!

I'm currently planning an Offa's Dyke Path adventure, which I'll finish off by walking home from Prestatyn, and I'm fully planning to make a stop here on the way home. I can't think of a more perfect place to have as my last camping stop.
showerReviews.author: Kell Pilkington

locations.address: ÓÉàBeech Farm, Warrington Rd, Mickle Trafford, Chester CH2 4EB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: will do my best to put across how wonderful Beechfarm is in my review. Terry and Jean are the owners of this immaculate CL. They should be very proud of the high standards they are providing for their guests. There is 10amp EHU at excellent Kwh prices. 20pence for a 3 minute HOT shower 40p for 6 minutes etc. Etc 2 toilets BONUS is a utility area for washing pots. Grounds are extremely well kept. Facilities are Beautifully clean. Terry and Jean go out of their way to ensure you have a memorable stay. Flint is close by and definitely worth the 30 minute drive to reach an excellent estury to walk around . Castle ruins on the grass hill. X30 bus to Chester 2mins from the site gate approx 11 minute journey. Breathtaking Cathedral in Chester. WIDE ENTRANCE which provides easy access into the site. Love the fact the dog owners have to take their beloved dog to the near by dog walk and use the doggy bins thus avoiding other campers from stepping into a mess. Thank you Terry and Jean for 4 perfect night stays.
showerReviews.author: Chrissy Rix

showerReviews.reviewText: Super place to stay just NE of Chester. Easy access gate and large lawn with the 5 pitches to the rear (furthest from the road) Jean and Terry welcomed us in, gave a tour of facilities, and showed us to our pitch. Overlooking fields with hedging on both sides of the large pitching area. Through a hedge archway a small en-suite shower room, additional loo and washing up sink - all a bonus! Hourly service from bus stop to/from Chester about 100yards with less than 15 minutes journey time. Obvious care and attention to all the grounds and a pleasure to stay - thanks.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here in our motorhome for 3 nights as a base to see the sights of Chester (Christmas market)  and Liverpool. Chester zoo is not far (3- 4 miles) you can walk this but taxis are available locally.
Really lovely, well kept site, owners very friendly and good knowledge of local area,  separate shower and toilet which was quaint and clean, with duck pond, and resident donkey on site.
Bus stop short walk (approx 300 yards from site) into Chester (not on Sundays) but good taxi services available. We walked into Chester (some partly along a busy road and you had  to navigate the footpath in parts, till we reached the bridge over the canal  and picked up the flat, pleasant canal path, and ‚Äòbonus‚Äô  there is a pub right at the end before going into town (well needed after walking 3.3 miles)
There is a pub not far from the site within walking distance along a foot path which does food, the road is quite busy though. If you‚Äôre walking in the dark remember a torch.
We visited Liverpool by catching the train from bache,  but be sure to get the metro saveaway ticket which you can‚Äôt get from bache station as we found out,  you can get one from Chester station and this gives you access to trains, buses and the Mersey ferry around Liverpool for  ¬£6.50 pp  (we bought the wrong tickets,  but at st James station in Liverpool but they swapped them for us.
Looking forward to returning in the summer months.
showerReviews.author: Debbie Appleton

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a family run small camp site. The family are very friendly and helpful.  There is a natural pond in one of the grass fields that has ducks on it.  There is a donkey and a very friendly dog called Jack.  The ducks are funny.  The site has a toilet and shower, and water and waste.  There are some hard standing pitches and grass ones, all with 16A electricity.  Busses run every hour from a stop 5 mins walk away, either into the centre of Chester or West Kirby.  The site is very nicely kept and we would definitely use it again.

The only negativea are the entrance is a little tight and a more frequent bus service would help.

locations.address: ÓÉàChurch Rd, Chester CH4 9LQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been coming to Chester lakes for about a year now, Me and kids love the place the staff are really helpful and friendly.
I Fish in many places often ruined by idiots loud blasting music and shouting & screaming partying all hours but you really don‚Äôt get that here thank god.
This is my place of Sanctuary where Good families are welcome.
The Fishing is something else Great pegs lakes are well maintained and they even have there own tackle shop so for all those things we often forget in a rush.
Gary who runs the tackle shop who is also the bailiff always got time to help and his lovely friendly (spaniel dog ) puts a smile on everyone‚Äôs face.
The toilets/showers are well maintained and clean with hot water.
The only thing missing is a little shop - but you can order food delivery‚Äôs and meet them at reception.
I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but I‚Äôm sick of idiots using reviews to hurt business when the problem is clearly them.
Just to let people know that I‚Äôm a customer a dad of 4 kids also a foster carer and I‚Äôm not connected to Chester lakes in anyway shape or form - this place was recommended by a friend and I‚Äôm so glad I came.
Well done Chester lakes keep up the great work üëèüëèüëèüëèüëèüëèüëèüëèüëè

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have been coming to Chester lakes from the very start when you used to drive to your peg/camping spot.
We have seen so many changes and not all for the better unfortunately.
The fishing is great. Charlie and Mark are so kind and really do go above and beyond for visitors.
Unfortunately camping has been limited to 4 pitches. No campervans which is sad as we used to love coming in our campervan to the woodlands.
We looked into buying a caravan and leasing a pitch but was shocked at how much the owner wants. Starting at ¬£2750 for the part where you're very close to other vans to ¬£4000 near lake. Fees do not inc electricity and you cannot rent your van to help cover the fees.
Our friends have a caravan in Barmouth with swimming pool, entertainment and beach next to site with electricity/water inc and they pay 3500 a year and can rent out. I think the rates here should inc electricity and fishing for these fees.
We've had so many beautiful memories here and we're sad they'll be no campervan trips here anymore.
Common wood is going to benefit massively regarding the changes Chester lakes has made reading the reviews. Real shame
showerReviews.author: Kelly Woodworth

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Netherwood in our small motorhome in October 2025. When we arrived we were greeted by the owner who was very friendly and talked us through our stay. We were given a brilliant leaflet which included a great map of the local area. We were on a grass pitch close to the gate leading to the canal. In the centre of the pitches there is a shelter with very long hoses to fill your water, and an Elsen point. Waste water had to be taken from the pitch in a container which was fine. There are male and female toilets, each had 1 shower and 2 toilets. These weren't heated but they were very clean and tidy.
The walk from the site into Chester was along the canal and took about 50 minutes.
We would definitely go back to this site as it was small, very well looked after and very quiet. A great couple of days.
showerReviews.author: Tina hughes

showerReviews.reviewText:
The site is so spacious and green, as well as being in a great location - right on the canal, so lots to do. Some interesting, safe walks to nearby villages and Chester. It was great to stay in a site where plots were not squashed together giving a sense of space and privacy. Very peaceful and relaxing.

I loved the flower meadow with its jaunty scarecrow guarding over it. The recreation area is an ideal play area for kids.

The site boasts lots of good features including flowers in the bathroom, quality soap and lots of hot water.

We would certainly go back again.

locations.title: Birch Farm
locations.address: ÓÉàMouldsworth, Cheshire, Chester CH3 8AW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A "back to basics" experience that turned out to be a bit too basic for me, but could suit others.

We primarily picked this location due to being close to Mouldsworth train station; unfortunately though the "reception" (really just a farmhouse) was a breezy 10 mins from the station, it turned out the actual campsite was another 10 minutes past that (the Google Maps pin is for the reception, the campsite is at the end of Stable Lane). For us as backpackers with no car this was a little more than we'd been expecting to walk with the heavy packs.

The actual campsite is divided into two areas, and sits on a hillside sandwiched between a sheep field and a horse field. By the entrance is a basic but clean toilet block, with one shower. On one side of the toilets, further down the slope, there is a small lake reserved for fishers; you aren't allowed to walk around the lake unless you are there to fish, which was disappointing. On the other side, going up, there is the campsite. There are a few caravan gravel pitches which were all taken while we were there on a Sunday night, and further up the slope there are two large fields to take your pick of. There are no labelled pitches, you can simply pitch anywhere.

The surroundings are beautiful and peaceful, there are a few picnic tables dotted around for you to use, a barbeque and even a basic tree swing.

My main issue was the distance from the toilet, I have what you might call a finicky bladder but there was no real way for us to pitch close to the loos. The campsite owner was very friendly and helpful but got around in a very loud little off-road vehicle which sometimes broke the peace at random times, as you never knew when he was going to show up. When we pitched he said he was planning to mow that field the next day but would mow around our tent, that made me a little nervous, though I understand he has to mow sometime.

In the end I could see this being an ideal campsite for someone else but sadly was just a little too basic for me. If I had a car and there was another toilet block at the top of the campsite I think I would happily return.
showerReviews.author: Julian R

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really good price, well kept site with a friendly owner; Peter couldn't be more lovely or helpful!
We were very lucky to have a beautiful view of the lake.
It's really peaceful and we enjoyed our stay.
There were lots of families in but because the plots are so well spaced, we didn't hear a peep from them.
Lovely rural location - you can buy local eggs within walking distance and the local pub is friendly and a few minutes walk away.

The only reason for not giving it 5* is the toilet/shower block - for two reasons; it's communal which is not for me and the water pressure for the (cold water only) taps made it difficult to wash, even our hands.
If CUSTOMERS could put their paper towels and rubbish in the bin/wipe up after themselves these toilets would have been much more pleasant!

We will be using again when we need to visit relatives nearby.
showerReviews.author: SG
