showerReviews.reviewText: Just back from 4 night stay on this site. On a positive it's a very peaceful site even on a bank holiday with some lovely views. In our party were 2 tents & 2 caravans but wouldn't recommend this site for people in tents. No hot water tap working in what was a very basic hut with just 1 toilet, 1 shower & 1 sink in the ladies, that weren't cleaned the whole time we were there. Also no washing up facilities 1st campsite I've ever been on with no washing up facilities & I've camped on many sites in the last 12 years. When I mentioned this to the owner he seemed very surprised this was an issue & when I mentioned about no hot water to wash hands & face with etc,  his reply was to use my friends caravan!! Therefore don't camp there unless you go with people who have a caravan!! It's a real shame because if just a little bit of money was spent on this site it could be amazing but sadly we won't be visiting it again
showerReviews.author: Barbara Nowell

showerReviews.reviewText: Just back from 4 night stay on this site. On a positive it's a very peaceful site even on a bank holiday with some lovely views. In our party were 2 tents & 2 caravans but wouldn't recommend this site for people in tents. No hot water tap working in what was a very basic hut with just 1 toilet, 1 shower & 1 sink in the ladies, that weren't cleaned the whole time we were there. Also no washing up facilities 1st campsite I've ever been on with no washing up facilities & I've camped on many sites in the last 12 years. When I mentioned this to the owner he seemed very surprised this was an issue & when I mentioned about no hot water to wash hands & face with etc,  his reply was to use my friends caravan!! Therefore don't camp there unless you go with people who have a caravan!! It's a real shame because if just a little bit of money was spent on this site it could be amazing but sadly we won't be visiting it again
showerReviews.author: Barbara Nowell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Sadly this campsite didn‚Äôt suit us and I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it for anyone looking for a family friendly or quiet weekend camping in a tent. There is one toilet and one shower with no loo roll, soap etc and it‚Äôs quite far from where you actually camp - bit of a pain if you need to go in the middle of the night!
The other big issue is that‚Äôs most of the other people were in caravans - mostly big groups of adults who stayed up until after 1am loudly playing techno music on outside speakers, swearing and arguing. It was a bank holiday when we stayed so might not be an issue at other times but there were no notices asking people to be mindful of noise after a certain time as we have seen at other sites which was a real shame as we could hear everything in the tent - the ground was literally thumping! Probably great if you‚Äôre up for a party but if you‚Äôre just looking to relax or have a quiet night away as a family then this might not be the place for you.
showerReviews.author: Sherwood Row

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have enjoyed staying in this spacious orchard with our campervan. Camping off the grid was no problem at all. We were able to refill fresh water and empty our chemical toilet. Don't expect a shower, but a nice bathroom with toilet and sink with hot water. The overnight rate is correspondingly very favorable!
Phil and Jane gave us a very warm welcome. Even better: when I lost my bicycle key in the center of Chester and called them for advice, they personally came by with a grinding wheel: problem solved :-) Tribute!
showerReviews.author: Leonard Smit

showerReviews.reviewText: Very pleasant site, easy access, friendly owners. Set in a large orchard, hardstandings easily big enough for our 7.8m MoHo. Fresh water, grey and black disposal all available. One toilet but no showers. Numerous supermarkets all within a mile or so, along with a few pubs. Chester is accessible via bus or bike. Chickens, Moorhens, rabbits all doing there thing oblivious to us sat watching them. Thoroughly recomended. The only downside is the road noise from the busy A-road that is nearby (unfortunately you can say that about most places in the UK)

Loos and shower was spotless (though we didnt use shower, if you do take 20ps...). Easy 20 minute stroll to the nearby Retail Park which has everything you need if you want. Location wise, easy to get into most places as well. Honestly enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

showerReviews.reviewText: Been happily visiting Digby Farm for many years and it just keeps on improving. Easy to find off the A55 in a lovely rural village setting but only a gentle ten minute stroll to the Broughton Retail park for all types of retail therapy and eateries with Tesco and Aldi available for groceries. Large easily accessible hard standing pitches are set  around a green central area and the  site is kept very well groomed. Shower and toilet block is immaculately clean . Barry the owner is very helpful without being obtrusive and the site is ideally situated for exploring North Wales or Chester (local Park and Ride) or just plain relaxing on the site.

showerReviews.reviewText: DO NOT USE THIS LEISURE CENTRE! Absolutely disgusted went swimming here for the first time since covid and since the council owned it. Couple of days later recived a PNC fine for ¬£100. I was not aware that you had to pay for the car park you never did before! There are no signs no pay meters, I didn't realise you have to become a member and give your reg in, even the guy on reception who I asked about how I got through the barrier even though I had booked after faffing about for ages didn't say or ask if I had payed for the car park knowing I was new! SCAM SCAM SCAM let's make money out of the car park  because you sure as hell won't make any money with the leisure centre. NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN. OH BY THE WAY IT IS ON THE WEB SITE RIGHT AT THE VERY BOTTOM IN TINY WRITING AND THATS HOW THEY GET AWAY WITH IT!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really disappointed, staff were helpful and friendly, we went as a family of four with our young children.

While everything was straight forward, changing rooms are a little run down and dirty, the main pool was really cold, baby pool wasn‚Äôt much better but felt slightly warmer but this is possibly only due to capacity difference.

We had to cut our visit short as our youngest was shivering too much, the pool area‚Äôs have broken and dirty tiles, our main gripe was water temperature.

Unfortunately we won‚Äôt be returning, needs a complete revamp and some effort, very tired place.
showerReviews.author: Diligaf

showerReviews.reviewText:
DISGUSTING EXPERIENCE - AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
My wife and son went swimming. I went to pick them up at the end. We receive a PCN Fine for ¬£100 and are informed that I was in the car park for 1 minute 20 seconds too long!  Is it a customer car park or is it not a customer car park??? I was a customer going in and out of the car park.  How grossly disgusting is it to fine a customer ¬£100 for being in a customer car park! So 50 minutes of swimming has now become ¬£111 (people cannot afford this kind of stupidity at this moment in time). Suffice to say we'll never return and you will lose any future income and I will tell all family and friends and anyone I talk to avoid this nasty place.  It's old and tired and dirty anyway so just go to Swim Central instead of this revolting place!  They trick you by not making the parking rules clearer - it's not visible enough on their website, the email booking that you actually read has no information about this, it's not clear in the car park there is a camera and if you are going in with kids you'll likely be too distracted to see the kiosk.  I think that the management of this place needs to get their heads examined as the customer should be treated nicely and they are just going to end up closed - I think that this place needs to get shut down.  You can see it's decline in the reviews on various sites - it's useless! They are no help with the parking fine and from reading other people experiences customers are treated horribly - it's just not the way to behave when running a business.  It's totally shameful and utterly disgusting in everyway!  You need to make some changes starting with getting rid of that parking camera.  The company that runs the parking camera has no way of contacting them (not email and you can't talk to them 1-2-1 on the phone) so they hide digitally and you cannot even try and get a resolution.  I reckon they ignore the appeals and let the fines get bigger and bigger for their own benefit - these two are in the scam together. Do not go to this leisure centre - stay clear of it - they don't care about their customers at all - you're just a cash cow! I hope this place gets closed down! It's the most disgusting experience ever!!!
showerReviews.author: G E

showerReviews.reviewText: Looks tatty... used to be a nice water feature in the middle and a palm tree.. when something stops working why not just replace it?? New changing rooms look miles better but they were about 6 years overdue. Please invest in some more chairs for parents swimming lesson viewing... I'd recommend get rid of the children's mini chairs and replace them with adult ones. Finally there needs to be more 'general swims' at the weekend.. if I want to bring 1 child instead of the whole family, I have to pay the full family of 4 rate... which is silly as my child gets in free due to having swim lessons. It just isn't logical. Staff are all very lovely and friendly and extremely helpful, but the place still needs more investment and running better.

showerReviews.reviewText: Having just moved to the area. I called into penwortham leisure centre  to see about joining the centre to swim. There was a lovely young man on reception i asked if it would be possible to have a look around as its a bit scary knowing how it all works when you have never been before. He then called for another member of staff another lovely young man who showed me lockers and changing rooms and showers etc. He asked if i needed to know anything else . I said thank you i feel much better now. It was a total pleasure and the staff were amazing cant thank them enough. It felt a lovely friendly place and i have now joined and looking forward to my first swim.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dim, drab and none too clean. The ladies shower area is very grubby. The mat in there is full of hair, and can't be hygienic! The pool surrounds are really dirty, and what's with the sand area full of rubbish by the pool?? The changing area was lovely and warm, but the water was really cold. My little one was shivering and blue, we got out after a short time.
The changing rooms we used  were clean, just full of water. The ladies toilet had no toilet tissue, and the floor was full of water and bits of paper.
The outside of the building is dreadful! Some serious maintenance, both inside and out, is urgently required.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The pool is cold, I was told it is 28.6C today. Took me a good half hour to dip the whole body in!

Not sure if it's because the pools are all joined together but usually places with a separate child's pool are much warmer. Will have to try somewhere else as that's too cold for me when I don't get to swim because I'm supervising a small child. It's exactly the same layout as Penwortham.

Could do with staff cleaning the toilet regularly, puddle of water mixed with toilet paper people dropped on the floor (which I don't understand anyways, I wish people would clean up after themselves!) The changing rooms and toilets have a very faint urine smell.

Some of the locker keys were damaged meaning you can't put them on your wrist. I don't know why they haven't been removed or fixed. Frustrating having to take things out of the locker and put them in another after this realisation.

But it is a council pool so I know if I want nice facilities I need to pay for something private.

Just my review of my first visit today. Reluctant to go back!
showerReviews.author: Miss Jennifer

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fast becoming the Brittas Empire 2.0.

Over the last few months this gym has gone seriously downhill, and the basic facilities are now so poor that the place barely feels operational.

The hydropool has been consistently lukewarm, not even close to an acceptable temperature. The same issue applies to the showers: all but three are barely lukewarm, and the remaining three are so hot you can‚Äôt even get your head under them. There‚Äôs no middle ground, just equipment clearly not being maintained.

The poolside corridor to the men‚Äôs changing room is freezing ‚Äî it may as well be outdoors. Inside the men‚Äôs changing room there is no heating at all, which means you‚Äôre rushing for a lukewarm shower just to warm up. It‚Äôs an absurd situation for a gym at this price point.

The entire site feels dated, neglected, and poorly managed. For the fees being charged, the minimum expectation is that the pools, showers, and changing rooms are heated and maintained properly. If a gym can‚Äôt even afford to heat its own facilities or provide a usable environment, it‚Äôs time to question why it‚Äôs still operating.
showerReviews.author: Chris C.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What an absolute joke of a service. We paid over ¬£90 for a group swim session and were completely ripped off.
‚Ä¢	Turned up at 3:10pm, but the receptionist was too busy arguing with another customer to deal with us. Didn‚Äôt get checked in until 3:20pm.
‚Ä¢	After changing, we finally got into the pool at 3:25pm.
‚Ä¢	Barely 10 minutes later, the receptionist actually interrupted us mid-swim to demand more money ‚Äì wasting even more of the time we‚Äôd already paid for.
‚Ä¢	Then, at 3:59pm, the lifeguard blew the whistle and shouted at us to get out because the next group was waiting.

So for ¬£90+, we got just 25 minutes of swimming before being kicked out. The staff were rude, unprofessional, and clearly have no respect for paying customers. Total scam. Save your money and go somewhere else.
showerReviews.author: EXPRESS SAMEDAY COURIERS

showerReviews.reviewText: I was interested in taking the adult 1:1 swimming lessons so made enquiries and was told I would need to be put on a waiting list. This was back in March and we are now in July, no one from the centre has even bothered to keep me updated but I've had to call twice for updates. Keep getting told the 1:1 classes are popular. No indication of when I will be able to start just same old lousy excuses. Why are you advertising a service you cannot provide. Your customer service is appalling and I will take my money elsewhere as your clearly not bothered about losing my business.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I started taking my son here when he was 6 months old. He loves it. Nice, clean, new facilities and the staff are great.

I myself was an ok-ish swimmer so decided to join the Adults Beginner class. Its been great. The instructors spend time with each person in the class individually so I could learn at my own pace. After ~ 2 months of once weekly lessons I‚Äôve graduated :) Becca and Zara in particular have been great in helping me improve, giving me insightful feedback and meaningful instructions. I now do lane swimming a couple of times a week to get the practice in. I‚Äôve never found the sessions too busy, either morning or evening.

So as summary ‚Ä¶ easy to get to, ample parking, fresh clean facilities, good instructors and never feels too busy. Oh and the pool is nice and warm too which i like :)

locations.address: ÓÉàcapitol centre, Walton-le-Dale, Preston PR5 4AW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having been a member for over 10 years, I can honestly say that not much has changed. For a 'premium' health club that charges premium prices (with the usual yearly price hikes), we're starting to wonder whether it's worth keeping our family membership (4 users).

Over the years, there‚Äôs been little investment that I‚Äôve noticed - I've been with Nuffield since well before they took over Virgin Active. Many of the machines are still the same, or haven‚Äôt been updated in a while. There are also ongoing issues in the changing rooms, like missing hair dryers every so often or soap dispensers in the showers that don‚Äôt work.

On the plus side, the staff I‚Äôve interacted with have always been friendly and welcoming. However, more than once, when I‚Äôve been up on the gym floor, I‚Äôve been asked if I'm a member and had to show my card - though it‚Äôs been a while since that last happened. Cleanliness of the locker rooms + shower area is also a hit and miss.

I don't have any personal experience with the classes, but I have some positive feedback about the children's pool and N Stars Nursery Area, although the latter requires additional payment after certain number of hours.

Overall, it‚Äôs starting to feel like the club‚Äôs standards haven‚Äôt quite kept up with the prices.
showerReviews.author: J

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having been a member for over 10 years, I can honestly say that not much has changed. For a 'premium' health club that charges premium prices (with the usual yearly price hikes), we're starting to wonder whether it's worth keeping our family membership (4 users).

Over the years, there‚Äôs been little investment that I‚Äôve noticed - I've been with Nuffield since well before they took over Virgin Active. showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff at this gym are wonderful, but that is about as much as it has going for it. Since joining this gym in May 2025, the standards have noticeably dropped. When I first joined, there was a consistent peak time at around 5-6pm. Now, that peak time seems to stretch from 4-8pm with not enough equipment throughout to facilitate the influx of new members. Obviously I understand that the upper management are trying to pack in as many members in as possible but the outdated machines and lack of free weights makes for a subpar experience at best.

I am lucky enough to be on a friends and family membership which meant that I pay ¬£51 however, I recently got an email stating that my next payment will be ¬£63. The email justifies this by saying we have had investment into the club. This ‚Äòinvestment‚Äô however, has only included 3 new racks and a couple of kettle bells here and there. Everything else in the gym feels like it is either second hand or still there from the early 2000‚Äôs. We were told there would be stair masters by the beginning of December, but nothing.

The pool area overall feels unclean, almost slimy and the steam room absolutely stinks of mould all of the time. The changing rooms are outdated, like something from a 1990‚Äôs leisure club. The showers are vile, slimy and full of hair. The lifeguards are polite and respectful but that is about it.

Having spoken to many members across the gym, I know that not many are planning on staying. Nuffield Management need to find a way to make this club worth paying the hiked prices otherwise they will forcing the old members out and only staying afloat through no joining fee offers. I will be taking my membership across to another gym as soon as this membership runs out.

I have already sent an email to management about this but they are not bothered about members leaving. I just got an email back basically saying ‚Äòwe have actioned this‚Äô and nothing more. They are clearly more bothered about quick fixes and piling the gym full of people rather than creating a quality experience that means they can justify the ridiculous price.

Do better Nuffield.
showerReviews.author: Esme Wildgoose

locations.title: JD Gyms Preston
locations.address: ÓÉàTustin Court, Port Wy., Ashton-on-Ribble, Preston PR2 2YQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic overall gym. I've had multiple memberships with different gyms around the area and JD Gyms is my favourite. I've had memberships at both the old JD Gyms site and new site here. The new site is definitely better than the old. Fantastic varied kit for everyone that can be adjusted at multiple different points to be personalised for the best work.

This gym is also ACTUALLY 24/7 unlike some gyms which will advertise as such but not be open 24h on Sundays. Staff are very friendly. The gym is busy but never overly busy from what I've seen, I'm never struggling waiting for equipment.

In regards to some critiques. It would be beneficial if the staffed hours began at 5am instead of 6am to bring it in line with some competitors in the area, meaning the main changing rooms can be open earlier too. Also, since the last site, I've noticed there's less equipment for abdominal exercises now and they no longer have a seated dips machine (bring back please!). The QR code system is also highly flawed and some members have to use codes. Finally, in terms of those with disabilities which may wish to attend, they will likely struggle to park in their designated spaces here. I'm consistently noticing most of not all accessible parking spaces taken by cars with not a single blue badge in sight, meaning the drivers are more than likely not entitled to park there and may be doing so for convenience.

Overall, I absolutely love this gym and very happy I got a membership here!
showerReviews.author: Jack Hall

showerReviews.reviewText: What a load of rubbish this place is, it must be run by someone with no idea what they are doing. I normally use everyone active which has it's own problems but swimming isn't one of them. Firstly the lanes aren't labelled so although anyone with a brain knows it's slow, medium, fast apparently some people who come here don't have a brain so you have someone barely treading water in the middle lane taking 4 lengths worth of time at a medium pace to do one length. The life guards are extremely inattentive and god forbid something happens they would likely end up in jail for negligence. The pool is dirty and there are lessons on where the space should be used to have wider lanes. The changing rooms are ok but I'll be sticking with my normal pool.

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê *-1 Star*
Extremely disappointed with Everlast Gyms. For the price you pay, the experience is shockingly poor.

Customer service is non-existent ‚Äî staff are unhelpful and any complaints sent to head office are completely ignored. The gym is constantly overcrowded, mostly with young kids who seem to get in for free, making it impossible to train properly.

Cleanliness is another major issue. The equipment is filthy, changing rooms are unhygienic, and basic standards of hygiene are clearly not being maintained.

Overall, this gym feels chaotic, neglected, and not worth the money. I would not recommend Everlast to anyone looking for a professional or respectful fitness environment.

showerReviews.reviewText:
There is plenty of new and high-quality equipment, with a variety of training areas for various needs. Clean and modern changing facilities with a well-kept sauna.

Reasons for not giving 5 stars:

1. For ¬£30 a month, there needs to be more classes. My partner has restarted her membership almost exclusively for the classes and was disappointed to find there's now a fraction available to book compared to when she was a member previously.

2. When equipment goes out of order, it can often take too long for it to be repaired.

Otherwise, it's a very good gym. Better than other commercial gyms in Preston such as JD Gym, Puregym and Gym Works, but that is reflected in the price.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was a really good Everlast Gym. The workout floor was huge, with a wide range of equipment, and duplicates of many machines that will be in demand (power racks, bench press, etc.). I'm not into boxing, but they have a large section dedicated to that with lots of bags and many pairs of gloves to use.

The lockers work with a code entry that you set, so you don't need to bring a coin or a padlock like in many other gyms. The changing room was clean (though I came first thing in the morning, so I can't speak to how it looks in the evening).

There is a good size sauna with nice heat in each changing room (at least I assume that the ladies' changing room has one - I obviously didn't check). The sauna looked clean at the time, but I'd recommend that staff educate their members on sauna hygiene. One guy was sitting in his boxers (which can spread dirt and diseases) and clipping his toenails. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Use a towel (or at least swimming shorts) and don't groom yourself in the sauna, please...

I'm not a member here, but look forward to using the club again next time I'm passing through Preston.
showerReviews.author: Matthew Skermer

I wanted to express my sincere appreciation for the wonderful experience we‚Äôve had with the swimming club. From the very beginning, the booking process was incredibly straightforward and user-friendly, making it easy for us to get started without any stress.
The facilities themselves are excellent: clean, comfortable and welcoming. Every visit has been a genuinely enjoyable experience and it‚Äôs clear that great care is taken to maintain such a high standard.

Most importantly, I‚Äôve seen such positive progress in my children. Their confidence has grown immensely and they‚Äôve achieved milestones we‚Äôre truly proud of. It‚Äôs been wonderful to watch their skills develop week by week.
Thank you for providing such a fantastic environment for learning and growth. We couldn‚Äôt be happier with our experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I wanted to express my sincere appreciation for the wonderful experience we‚Äôve had with the swimming club. From the very beginning, the booking process was incredibly straightforward and user-friendly, making it easy for us to get started without any stress.
The facilities themselves are excellent: clean, comfortable and welcoming. Every visit has been a genuinely enjoyable experience and it‚Äôs clear that great care is taken to maintain such a high standard.
I‚Äôm also extremely grateful for the quality of teaching that I have received over the last 5 years. Both my children have felt fully supported at every step. The instructors are patient, encouraging and clearly dedicated to helping each child thrive.
Most importantly, I‚Äôve seen such positive progress in my children. Their confidence has grown immensely and they‚Äôve achieved milestones we‚Äôre truly proud of. It‚Äôs been wonderful to watch their skills develop week by week.
Thank you for providing such a fantastic environment for learning and growth. We couldn‚Äôt be happier with our experience.
showerReviews.author: Rehan Patel

showerReviews.reviewText: It has been a great experience here, starting from the booking process as a beginner, till stage 4 swimmer, everything has been a delight! Things have been super quick and smooth, and have felt supported at every step. The facilities are spotless, comfortable, and has made every visit enjoyable. The teaching is so personal and focused on each child, and the progress my child has made is incredible‚Äîfar faster than at any leisure centre we‚Äôve tried. The confidence grew so much; my daughter went from being scared of the water - to swimming without floats - making it to the deep end. Truly amazing!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely brilliant swim school, highly recommended!

My son, Ebrahim, has been swimming with SwimPro Fulwood, and I honestly couldn‚Äôt be happier with the whole experience.

The booking process was so simple and efficient, which made getting started completely stress-free. Communication has always been clear and friendly.

The facilities are spotless, warm and really comfortable for both parents and children. You can tell everything is kept to a very high standard, and the atmosphere is welcoming every single session.

Most importantly, the teaching quality is outstanding. The instructors are patient, encouraging and genuinely invested in the children‚Äôs progress. Ebrahim has always felt supported, and they‚Äôve managed the perfect balance between fun and proper technique.

We‚Äôve seen such a huge improvement in his confidence and skills, from being nervous in the water to swimming more independently and actually looking forward to each lesson. His progress has been incredible.

I‚Äôd highly recommend SwimPro Fulwood to any parent looking for a professional, caring and well-run swim school. They really do go above and beyond for the kids. üß°üèä‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

showerReviews.reviewText:
I heard about Swim pro from a friend, as I was looking to hire a private pool for me, my mum, daughter and granddaugher. When I contacted them on WhatsApp and I had a very prompt response. I asked how to pay for the pool
and the instructions were easy. I needed to set up a bank transfer which is an easy way to pay. This was paid up front before the pool was confirmed. I was impressed that they try to provide an allocated time to use the pool that was convenient for us. Unfortunately you can't park outside the house where the pool is as there are 2 other houses in the Triangle. It woukd be a tight squeeze if people where in and out but that was explained before my visit. My daughtet parked at the other side of the road on the other side of Garstang Rd without any issues. On arrival one of the instructors was moping the floor, cleaning and checking the pool before we went in. They had just had a grouo of children for their swimming lessons. It was totally private to get changed, and there are screens if you want to get undressed behind them. There is somewhere to hang your bags and coats etc.
There is a toilet as you go through to the pool which i thought was a bit strange at first but I understand why this was designed like this for the children. There is  separate shower room at the pool side. I personally struggle with getting changed but there were disabled seats that I could sit on to get dressed. You have everything you need. I chose this particular pool because there are steps and a bar to hold onto when you're entering the pool, and that was great for me too due to struggling with my mobility and balance. There are floats and armbands in the box at the side of the pool if you forget them for your child. My daughter and I tried the armbands and thought they didn't work but when I contacted them you need to put 3 armbands on each arm as this is how it works when the small children have their swimming lessons. This is now good to know but hopefully my daughter will not forget my granddaughters life jacket she wears.

If you are going swimming with another person it is ¬£30 and this is the going rate with most private pools for an hour, which is great. I am happy to pay this. If you have more than 2 people it becomes more expensive and it is ¬£55.00 for an hour but if you have 5 people or more you can split the cost between you and again I say the cost is quite reasonable. The pool is nice and warm and a great size for doing lengths. A perfect place for teaching your young ones to swim but at Swim Pro they offer professional instructors and swimming lessons tailored to your child or you as an adults needs. The website is very informative or you can contact them on WhatsApp where you can look back on the service they provide.

I have only been once to the pool but I would highly recommend it and I definately will be booking again soon. Hopefully as soon as this week!!

Joanne F üòÉ
showerReviews.author: Joanne Finch

Went today with sister and baby, had a lot of fun there, nice and clean pool, had little floatys already there, nice colour very calm atmosphere - loved that they had a shower to use at the end and toilet - lounge was handy to change baby in.
Owner explained everything to us thoroughly and just left us to it with complete privacy.
Already booked another 2hr slot, definitely worth coming here.

showerReviews.reviewText: Really disappointing experience - although the pool itself was fine, there were a number of issues. The bathroom had an empty handwash bottle, this should have been restocked. The seating area had clearly not been cleaned with dirt and hair on the floor. We were told we had a 2 hour slot in the pool and with 30 minutes to clear up. It was not clearly communicated, as we were not even sent a basic confirmation email, that part of that time was for the owners to clean up the pool. Rather than having these details written unclearly in fine print, it should have been clearly communicated. Towards the end of our time, of which we still had a few minutes, the assumed owner came barging in shouting in a very rude manner saying "you need to get out now", and without our permission started to touch and move our personal belongings, we were all shocked and deeply disappointed by the level of rudeness and unprofessionalism. Despite being told that there was someone in the bathroom, she tried barging in twice into the bathroom without knocking whilst i was changing, which made me feel very uncomfortable. When we tried to speak to her to ask about the leaving time, we were rudely and repeatedly spoken over. A very disappointing end which ruined the entire experience, which was for a special birthday. Unfortunately, we will definitely  not be coming here again. Basic manners go a long way especially with customers, hugely disappointing.
showerReviews.author: Sam N

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visiting today,
What can we say absolutely wonderful host, explained everything clearly, showed us around and explained health and safety regs etc, made us feel very, very welcome.

If your looking for a exceptionally clean, private location that includes a pleasant host, clean cubicles for changing, clean shower facilities, clean toilet, then look no further, had the most amazing time, definitely will be booking again!

Fantastic place for a quiet, peaceful swim or you could bring the family!

We don‚Äôt usually end up leaving reviews, as we sometimes get lazy/forget, however on this very particular occasion we have taken the time out to share with you our brilliant experience.

We were slightly hesitant writing this review as we wanted to keep this hidden gem to ourselves, as we have been to private pools in the past but none have even come close or met our expectations to this standard.

This review may be long but needed to be shared. Already looking forward to our next swim!!

10/10

locations.title: Bristol Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàOakfield Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 2BJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to visit here for soooo long! Finally got the perfect excuse and brought my best friend for her birthday. We were greeted at reception and given a quick tour of the facilities. We were given a robe and a towel each and we changed into these before going up to the massage waiting room. We were collected by our massage therapists and taken into our own private rooms for the massage. The treatment was lovely and the hour passed by way too quickly! We then were taken to a relaxation are and made a cup of tea which was lovely after the massage.

I would like to offer a pro tip at this point, there was an autumnal nip in the air and we hadn't remembered to take flipflops but the floor was super chilly on the toes! If you feel the cold like I do, remember your sandals or flipflops!

After we had booked time to use the pool and facilities. We had the best time popping between the sauna, pool, hot tub, and steam room. It was never too busy in any of the areas and they were all clean. We were incredibly fortunate with the weather and it literally felt like we had gone on holiday for the day!

We hadn't booked in for lunch but the smells coming from the kitchen were making us both hungry so we asked if they took walk ins at the spa reception and the lady said yes. We popped through a little door and were in the restaurant and were seated at a lovely table in 10 mins. Our waitress was lovely and we ordered some of the small plates and some lovely refreshing drinks. The food came out relatively quickly considering how busy it was (it was peak lunch time 1.30pm) and was well presented and oh so delicious! I don't often eat out so to me the food was amazing! The tapas style food we picked was so flavourful and the perfect amount for sharing. We were recommended a delicious pudding and enjoyed every mouthful!

My friend and I have been on a few different spa days together around Bristol and this by far took the number 1 spot! Thank you to all who made our treat day so wonderful! We will be back!
showerReviews.author: Ellie Coombs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for ¬£3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.
showerReviews.author: Paul Bobo

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked the swim and breakfast package as we were spending a week in Bristol and seemed a nice thing to do . I must say we were blown away by the whole experience more queens club than David Lloyd‚Äôs and with bells on . This lido was refurbished and reopened to the public in 2007 . Architecturally beautiful and lovingly restored with incredible attention to detail from the pool side cubicle changing curtains to the tasteful period furniture in the upper floors . The members and staff , friendly and charming shared their special place with us and we very much appreciated . Pool , steam , sauna and jacuzzi left us refreshed and ready for breakfast. Changing rooms and shower  areas were super clean and tidy . Then to breakfast well !!! This was another level and unexpected , ib√©rico chop with Catalan beans duck egg , morcilla and membrillo was a Hispanic combination I would have only expected to find in heaven , congratulations to the genius who pulled that baby to the pass at menu development . As in many cases sadly wonderful food not matched by service , would you like some toast with that or anything else we can get you would have been nice and a simple upsell , regardless come to expect these things and move on albeit annoying. Having said that the food quality setting and environment made for one of the most memorable breakfast. Thank you .
showerReviews.author: Gastronom√≠a Europa

showerReviews.author: Michaelblack@googlemail.co.uk Black

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having returned to the UK after living in South Africa for nearly 30 years we were eager to come and swim in the Lido as we are not keen on indoor pools. We had the most amazing morning-the pool was not busy but it was a cooler day than some. We arrived about 10am on a Sat morning. Plenty of space to swim-lovely and warm once we got in but could have been a little warmer for us.. Great to have the showers on site and change facilities if required too. We had a lovely coffee from the on site catering van -highly recommend..
We returned today to try the restaurant and were not disappointed. We had really lovely meals. I can recommend the house salad ,it was not just a pile of lettuce leaves with the usual chunks of tomato and cucumber but a delectable plate of finely mixed ingredients and gorgeous dressing -well worth the price and even  though the restaurant was busy over the lunch time and had a 'kitchen crisis' it still felt very relaxing. The staff are amazing and seemed to be really enjoying their job... There is lots more to try and we have already made a booking for a family birthday celebration.
We will be back very soon Saltdean Lido as there is more to explore...
showerReviews.author: Landi Lady

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great pool to swim in - what a fantastic setting and brilliant to see the pool and buildings being fully restored.
Pool is around 40m length and gently heated during winter to 19¬∞ which is quite chilly in just a swimsuit. Booked tickets in advance and the price is reasonable (especially compared to Sea Lanes). Free parking on site.
Not sure if the current changing area is temporary? These seemed fairly rudimentary and relatively few changing cubicles. Lockers available, although you'll need somewhere to store the locker key! Showers lovely and warm.
Deco cafe looked lovely, but was already full when we visited - obviously a popular spot!
Would return again when restoration fully completed. Definitely one not to miss!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText: We went at 6pm on a weekday in the school holidays on a warm day. There were many like us hoping to have a proper swim, but there was only one very small section of the pool separated off for this (equivalent to a lane). The area for diving was bigger. This was a shame as the pool was starting to empty out but there were still a number of children in the areas that were deep enough to swim. It is a lovely setting and the pool was very refreshing, it is unheated. There are grassy areas where you can sit if you are planning to be there for a few hours. It is definitely aimed at families. It would be nice if Bradford Council set aside the last hour of opening for adult lane swims. The changing rooms are in serious need of a revamp - 3 showers, 2 sinks, 6 cubicles, dirty and wet everywhere. For ¬£11.95 a swim, they should be much better than they are. Bizarrely we were asked twice to be quiet as there was a soundbath going on in the next room - this at the end of the evening when lots of people were showering (or queuing to shower!) and changing.
showerReviews.author: C A

locations.title: Woburn Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàCrawley Rd, Woburn, Milton Keynes MK17 9QG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A Perfect Day at Woburn Lido

From the moment I arrived at Woburn Lido, I knew I was in for a treat. Nestled in the charming village of Woburn, this historic outdoor pool is a hidden gem that offers a delightful escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

The first thing that struck me was the stunning Art Deco architecture. The beautifully restored changing rooms, with their vibrant tiles and classic arches, transported me back to the 1930s. It was like stepping into a different era, and I couldn‚Äôt help but admire the attention to detail that has gone into preserving this piece of history.

As I dipped my toes into the crystal-clear water, I was pleasantly surprised by the perfect temperature. The pool is heated to a comfortable 26¬∞C, making it ideal for a leisurely swim or a more vigorous workout. The separate paddling pool for children is a thoughtful touch, ensuring that families can enjoy their time here without any worries.

The atmosphere at Woburn Lido is incredibly relaxing. Surrounded by lush greenery, the pool area feels like a tranquil oasis. I spent hours lounging by the pool, soaking up the sun, and taking refreshing dips whenever I felt like it. The friendly staff were always on hand, making sure everything was just right.

One of the highlights of my visit was the sense of community. Locals and visitors alike come together here, creating a warm and welcoming environment. I had some lovely conversations with fellow swimmers, sharing stories and tips about the best spots in the area.

After a day of swimming and relaxation, I treated myself to a delicious snack from the on-site kiosk. The selection of refreshments was impressive, and I enjoyed a tasty ice cream while basking in the late afternoon sun.

As the day came to an end, I couldn‚Äôt help but feel grateful for this wonderful experience. Woburn Lido is more than just a swimming pool; it‚Äôs a place where memories are made. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful retreat or a fun day out with family and friends, Woburn Lido is the perfect destination.
showerReviews.author: tony wheatley

Really nice Lido, nice coffee shop area. Changing rooms are small and didn't have a baby change in the womens one, didn't notice a separate area.
Plenty of available noodles and float to use.
Shame it gets booked up so quickly!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had been meaning to go to the pool for a while - Woke up, decided I fancied it, went online booked and paid for a session, nice and easy, shows you availability on different days for the different sessions they do. I didn't try the car park knowing it's small, instead opting for the larger car park just 2 min walk down the road at the village hall (next to a kids park) best to go here unless you're elderly/disabled/got very little kids.
The pool is clean and well maintained, as are the changing rooms, there's seating round the pool but space is limited so don't expect sun loungers - although there is a grass area at the end of the pool where you could stretch out on a towel. There's also a cafe on site for hot and cold drinks, snacks and ice creams.
Lovely pool, lovely staff, will be back regularly ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wonderful pool with a lovely community feel. Booking is easy, and in cold water season can usually book the day before without issue. In the summer I find it‚Äôs better to book a week in advance. Right now it‚Äôs limited to 10 swimmers at a time, which tbh is about the max number I‚Äôd want for lane swimming anyway. There‚Äôs a slow lane and a fast lane, and there are not usually any issues with people being in the wrong place.

The changing rooms are clean though small. The cafe is good for a quick hot drink to warm up afterwards & is reasonably priced. Lifeguards are welcoming and encouraging. The car park is tiny, but there are hundreds of spaces across the road, which is clearly signposted. Everyone I‚Äôve encountered has been very friendly and at the right time you can spot elephants over at Woburn Safari Park!

locations.title: Peterborough Lido Outdoor Swimming Pool
locations.address: ÓÉàSt Peters House, Lido, Bishop's Rd, Peterborough PE1 1YY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a fantastic place! It's so nice to have a traditional building that sparks memories of days gone by.

The main pool is huge, with plenty of space to swim, play catch or use inflatables.

There are lockers there with a refundable ¬£1 charge.

There are toilets, benches and a cafe there, that serves chips and burgers, sandwiches, drinks and cakes. The prices are reasonable as well. They sell ice lollies as well.

We sat on the grassy area with a picnic blanket. There is a small play area for kids with a climbing frame,  slide and swing.

Plenty of space to find a spot to sit.
The water in the pool was a good temperature.
showerReviews.author: Karen; Finding Fifty

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice building and lovelly pool.  A real asset for the people of Peterborough who need to do everything possible to make sure that this facility is kept operational.
Very traditional feel with some nice music in the background, well organised swimming lanes, and plenty of changing and toilet facilities available.
Changing and toilet facilities are male and female at either end of the complex.
There is a cafe and several outdoor areas to eat, with food and drinks available, although I'm not sure what time the cafe opens!

showerReviews.reviewText: This pool is an absolute stunner! There is plenty of paid parking nearby and a short walk through the gardens - you can't miss the lido with its clock tower. Entry through traditional turnstiles into a mosaic lobby and the wonderful 1930s buildings surrounding the pool. Changing cubicles are modern, toilets are clean, but there are only a few showers. Lockers available (¬£1 refundable). There are 3 pools on site - 50m main pool, a learner pool, and a paddling pool. The main pool was heated to around 24¬∞ when we visited and was clean and well maintained with attentive lifeguards, with jolly music to listen to while you swim. There is a cafe on site, and worth having a post-swim hot drink on the first floor terraces which have stunning views of the pool and surrounding gardens. Loved it - will definitely be back ü´∂
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice day out with the kids.
We tried to go in a day before but as the weather was really hot but they were fully booked and were not letting people in anymore. We booked an afternoon session for the next day and it was lovely. It was easy to book online and to get in the next day.
Lots of lifeguards around. Staff are nice and friendly.

Giving it a 4 star as the water was actually cold even though it was a hot day, we expected the pools to be heated but the kids kept complaining the water was cold, one of them didn‚Äôt even stay in the water. Luckily there is a play area that kept him entertained while the other two were swimming.
Also there were lots of cigarette butts left around in the grass area.

Overall it was a good day out. But I don‚Äôt think I would visit on days that the weather is not hot as we would probably be freezing cold.
showerReviews.author: Larissa Franca

showerReviews.reviewText: As the only public swimming venue in Peterborough then you have to make do, however that is really easy to do, but a morning, afternoon or all day ticket on line and off you go, changing rooms are modest in both senses of the word good lockers many seats around the pools to drape your towel, a grassed area for possible picnics, a toddlers pool, a little persons pool and a heated main pool. The main pool has lanes for those who want to knotch up lengths. Me and my lady swam carefree in the main pool but partook of lane swimming at the end. The cost for our 4 hour morning swim was ¬£7 each. Well worth it

showerReviews.reviewText: I like it, nice long 50m pool. Love it towards closing time when everyone is getting out and there is more space. In the evening, 3 lanes are shut for lane swimming. The water varies in temperature, and so does the cleanliness in the changing room. The hotter it is the busier it is and more children. But we only go between 6 and 8pm. Would try a different swimming pool, but all the ones I know about are part of a gym or shut.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I absolutely love this Gym, so much equipment it has everything you need. Love the classes and I have even gained a PT from coming here‚Ä¶ Nicola Bradley is just awesome and knows her stuff for sure.

Reason I have given it only 4 stars is down to hygiene and cleanliness.

I have never known a gym not have blue roll and an antibacterial spray.

When you go to go on equipment and it‚Äôs got sweat on after someone I‚Äôm like ‚Ä¶. Er I‚Äôll pass! Or when I have been on something and it‚Äôs sweaty I want to clean it before the next person.

The germs that are around in the gym are not good. I have known someone to get ring worm from the mats which I have to say have now been changed thankfully. I know your an eco gym but standard hygiene is a must.

I won‚Äôt bring my own towel as I am not prepared to wipe the germs off the equipment or put on a mat to gain germs.

There‚Äôs alot of members who think the same.

If this was sorted I would be giving it 5/5
showerReviews.author: Samantha Byrom

locations.title: The Gym Group Bolton
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 9, Bolton Gate Retail Park, Turton St, Bolton BL1 2SL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Generally, for a 24hr gym it is good. Unfortunately some of the members bring the tone down by constantly leaving weights lying around everywhere turning an early morning session into some kind of crazy weighted easter egg hunt. The gym playlist seriously need updating because some of the music sounds more apt for weed heads sat around a smokey living room in their boxers.

Some sanitiser spray for the equipment and paper towls wouldn't go amiss either after losing count of the amount of people taking a morning dump without washing their hands. Take note you 'dump n runners', NOT NICE!

Other than that, the equipment is decent, maintained to a decent standard and a good number of squat racks.

Of all the Gym Group gyms I've used in and around Manchester, this is one of the better ones.
showerReviews.author: Marc Saul

The site was quiet, with only WHSmith and Costa open.

The toilets were in an unacceptable state.
The smell was overpowering, and it was clear they had not been cleaned.

Costa had no hot food available, possibly due to machine cleaning, despite food being on display.
Only sandwiches were offered.

Overnight cleaning standards urgently need improvement.

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed here the night before my wedding and the night of my wedding in one of the penthouse suits. The location is beautiful but the apartment itself was a little run down the cleanliness itself wasn‚Äôt too great. There was a musty smell in the hallway which I felt I had to apologise for to my bridesmaids and family who were helping me get ready on the day. the stairs are uneven which was a massive problem trying to get down all 5 flights of them in a wedding dress as there is no lift in the building. The fridge in the apartment smelled of gone off milk considering we was booked for 2 nights there was only 2 very small bottles of water and enough coffee sachets for a coffee each in the morning for one day. The tv had no signal in the lounge area the bath took 45 minutes to fill so as lovely as it was it was a pointless task. The shower was worse a very small shower couldn‚Äôt move in it. The sink in the bathroom was blocked. The heating came on automatically which is ok for winter months but not in summer we would have turned it off but the thermostat was broken the toaster was dirty and full of crumbs to someone who is gluten free with an autoimmune disorder I couldn‚Äôt even make a slice of toast without the risk of being ill so couldn‚Äôt even eat the morning of my wedding very very disappointing stay and definitely wasn‚Äôt worth the money paid. I will not recommend or return

locations.title: Riverside By Teil
locations.address: ÓÉà27 Broadgate, Preston PR1 8DX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I was at the Riverside By Teil for just over a month. My room was at the top floor, overlooking the river and trees, with an en suite bathroom. There are wonderful places to eat, beautiful parks to stroll through, and the town center and train station are all within walking distance. It was my home away from home. The shared living space has large windows and plenty of seating. The shared kitchen was spacious and tidy. The host, Waseem, provides tea, coffee, milk, sugar, and breakfast cereal. They provided me with fresh bed linens and towels, whenever I needed them. I had my own personal hygiene products, but they did provide hand soap, shampoo, and body wash if needed. I was always greeted with a warm smile and a captivating conversation. I wish I had taken more pictures of the place. I truly hope to go back there again soon. What a wonderful place to stay!
showerReviews.author: Margie Leann Ruotsala

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for 9 weeks on secondment for work in different rooms (room reviews below) but just a note overall service and responsiveness of staff has been 5/5 and so has cleanliness.

Mayfair (stayed here twice) - personal favourite room. Good space, has really good double wardrobe and has a sofa as well as good size dining table. 5/5
Secret Garden - this is a super cute space, only thing would note are the windows are a bit smaller as on top floor but still 5/5.
The Den - smaller but still a good size. Really liked this room as well but as a note the stairs to get up are quite steep. 5/5
J‚Äôadore - good space and size. 4/5
Chalet (Stayed twice) - separate living room and bedroom with 2 separate bathrooms. There is an emergency exit/safety door in the bedroom and the walls are a bit thin so you can people walk about (not sure if from next door). Didn‚Äôt bother me but if you‚Äôre sensitive to noise it might 4/5
The Lodge - complimentary upgrade. It‚Äôs a double room apartment so was too big for me but one big room, one small room (both with en suites) and its own living room space as well. No dining table from memory 4/5
Bouquet - it has the same if not bigger space as Mayfair but windows didn‚Äôt open fully (not sure if due to being on ground floor) so temperature was uncomfortable. Can imagine in winter being better and cozier. 3/5.
Chic - was my least favourite room. It‚Äôs smaller like the den but I found the floors were lifting up in places and the only window is in the shower room, not in the main room. If you‚Äôre just staying for an overnight would be fine though. 3/5.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic site! Everything you need, spotlessly clean toilets and showers, good size pitches and lovely quirky garden areas..
20-30 minute walk into Ribchester over the fields.
We had awful weather on the last day but the woodland walk came to the rescue, make it as long or short as you wish, our dog loved it! So much so we went again just before it got dark.. keep your eyes peeled, there's a beautiful deer that we spotted each time we went !
showerReviews.author: Steve Dunn

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a lovely weekend here in January 2022. The site is set out well with flat pitches with enough space for a caravan and a cat at the side of it.  Well kept gardens and grass between each pitch are pleasant.  The site is bigger than it appears on entry as there are roughly 3  areas of around  10 pitches positioned so that you can't see other campers.  I believe that every pitch has electric hookup. Surrounded by fields and a wood and located a 15 to 20 minute walk downhill into Ribchester.
In Ribchester there is a Spar store, the  river, a beautiful church and a fabulous museum explaining about Roman times. There is the remains of a granary and roman baths within the town and clear notice boards giving information  about them. ¬£4 museum entry open 12 till 4 ( longer hours I summer). There is also a very friendly pub, the White Bull, that does food and had a roaring fire.
So plenty to do in the area, pleasant woodland walks directly from the site.  Clean toilets,  super washing up area, even an area to wash your dog or bike. Good value, great location.  I'll definitely be returning.
showerReviews.author: Lin H

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just had a little halloween family holiday on moss lane camp site, we have all thoroughly enjoyed it, Andy is always about if you need anything and very helpful, we go on often but the daughters came on with their own vans and loved every minute, the children played and slept well after all the fresh air, always a bonus haaa, as its tucked away nicely, hot showers at all times, food at guys just down the lane  is always delicious, always have children's activities on in holidays,  great camp site.
Thank you for having us all .
Peter & Lisa

showerReviews.reviewText:
So , the van has been here just under a week. This is our 2nd trip. The pitches are all sound and have water and EHU. There is a toilet/shower block and a lovley cafe next door, open Thurs, Fri, Sat. It's tranquil and quiet,  but you are in easy travel to the shops for provisions. Its dog friendly and decent spaces between the 6 pitches . We stayed at a club site recently for a similar amount per night , it was shocking and I've told them so. This beats it hands down and we will be back, I stayed with my partner Sue, 2 dogs and visiting 3 other adults all who stayed at various points. Well worth it, the weather was great and the site even more.
Susan Parker , Gary Etchells MBE & family
showerReviews.author: Gary Etchells

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is our 6th time staying here. We always stay in our tent as the facilities are great for camping, with an enormous flat field, with or without electric hook up.
There is a small childrens park adjacent to the camping field with seating around.
There are two toilet blocks one with showers. These are cleaned regularly.
The reception staff and reservatiom staff as well as the maintenance man go above and beyond.  Unfortunately, this time we had massive problems with our " air tent " . 4 of the 5 inner tubes we're popped. To replace them would be more expensive than buying a new tent.  After speaking to reservations and reception, we managed to bag ourselves a lovely Pod for the remainder of the week. It was well equipped.  The highlight of our stay was the amazing fibre optic lights that we were able to put on at night. The children said it was like sleeping under the stars!!
Thank you to all the wonderful staff. You really do go above and beyond.  See you next time, Alex and the squad x
showerReviews.author: Alex The Great

showerReviews.reviewText:
An amazing little campsite with basic amenities, like laundry, Elson, toilets and showers. They also have a washing up area. A great location with only a 25 minute drive to Blackpool. Friendly owners who are helpful and chilled out. We stayed here for two nights for ¬£20 a night. There is no check out time, just be courteous and leave before the night starts. We met the owners presumably children or grandchildren, 2 boys who my son was absolutely taken with. If you ever have the pleasure of meeting them, they are so kind and courteous and a real credit to the parents. I will be staying here again hopefully soon!

Things to be noted - we had okayish signal on EE (but I feel this is great as it's good to get away from the world)
showerReviews.author: Whitney Ranger

showerReviews.reviewText:
We found Fell View Park by sheer luck on a journey north from the West Midlands and we loved it!
Brilliant location not far off the M6 on a working farm, great pitch with EHU, water and waste points.
Great facilities with lovely hot showers, clean toilets and plenty of information on the local area.
Fishing lake on site for those inclined, with sheep and geese round the lake. Dog friendly with an exercise area.
Friendly owner, very relaxed and well worth a visit to this hidden gem.
Will certainly be back.
showerReviews.author: Tracey watts

Beautifull site in a beautiful location, immaculately kept by Tim & Linda.  They are very friendly hosts. The shower facilities are always spotless, warm and plenty of hot water.
The location itself is perfect for quiet breaks, we've been visiting for years because of this. There are two good pubs in the local village as well as two cafes and farm shop that  also sells coffee, cakes and ice cream.
Away from the site, it's brilliant for walking or cycling on quiet country lanes and lots of public rights of way.

locations.title: Stoneycroft
locations.address: ÓÉàLa, 28 Chain House Ln, Preston PR4 4LE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: All around a disaster! On arrival (despite demanding we pay in cash, which we came to regret) Barbara & Mike was lovely we paid ¬£300 for just our caravan to be onsite and the electric in which we had to unplug a device just to put our kettle or any cooking appliances on or else it will blow as it‚Äôs only on 10V and when it does go off your lucky if they put it back on for you. The site is a swamp!! Make sure you wear thigh high wellies. Pay an extra ¬£3 a night for your awning to be up whether it sinks or comes unstuck from the swamp of ground they don‚Äôt care. You won‚Äôt get no help from the owners once you have paid. Oh and to shower? 50p per shower for 7 mins then cuts off. No laundry facilities. No toilet roll in the loo! Baring in mind you have to share 1 toilet & 1 shower with everyone on site! VERY UNHYGIENIC. You can‚Äôt make no noise, no luxury drinking, no vaping, no smoking. All around an awful experience!
showerReviews.author: Kenzie Henderson

Would definitely recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText: I was so happy when I found this little gem of a site and the owners are such lovely people.. The shower room is lovely and clean ....everything should have been perfect BUT for the two nights I stayed here I was woken at 6am with noise and banging from the wood yard next door it was terrible . I feel for the owners as they have complained to the council but they don't get anywhere, if noise is a problem to you then unfortunately this isn't the place to stay for you!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed over the christmas period 2008, on arrival warmly welcomed by Barbara the owner. The site is adequatley maintained but the facilities do however leave alot to be desired the single shower room requires 50pence to operate even though you are charged ¬£12.00 per night to stay. There is no laundry or washing-up facilies
or even a public payphone, wi-fi no sorry, not even toilet paper in the loo! I did ask the question what exactly do you get for your money, as i thought a more realistic figure would have been approx ¬£50 per week (which incidently is all i paid her but she cut off my electric) overall if you want peace and quiet and don't mind paying o over the odds for not alot in return then go for it......
showerReviews.author: Vini Hurst

showerReviews.reviewText: We have just returned home from the most wonderful stay at Wyreside Farm. Nothing was too much trouble for the hosts, who were so warm and welcoming. The caravan was pristine, well stocked with everything you could need, from kitchen utensils, to towels, to a fully stocked games cupboard and tv and lovely and cosy even on rainy days. The location is idyllic and peaceful. I could not recommend this site more highly.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice site. Well maintained grass area with electrical hook-up. Toilet block was well maintained and clean. There is only one shower each for male and female (2 total). This wasn't a problem most days as others used at different times, but did mean I had to wait for the shower on one day.
The site has a quiet policy for evenings. Includes one field designated for ball play, but otherwise no child play area (not a problem for us).
Short walk from a pub / restaurant (Grapes) which was nice and a 10 minute drive from town with good shops and takeaways.
Good for travelling to Blackpool (approx. 30 minutes drive). We used it to travel into Blackpool most days.
We were not told at booking about the arrival time (2pm or later). I think the owner forgot to mention on confirmation; we arrived early, she was accommodating just asking to finish her lunch first but instead we went to buy our own lunch and then went back at 2pm.
I recommend this site.
showerReviews.author: Stewart Watkiss

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wife and I stopped here in a Glamping Pod last week, she booked for my birthday. We normally camp so a pod was a new experience for us both

Site was very nice and pods excellent! The staff were great on arrival and throughout our stay and even remembered details from the booking phone call. The toilet/shower block was immaculate

We stopped on a Wednesday but didn't realise the pub and restaurant in the village open Thurs-Sun, not an issue, we had a great lunch at the Old Tithe Barn in Garstang and our tea in Lancaster Centre, which is surprisingly close!

Will definitely stop again in the tent, lots of electric hookups if you don't like roughing it.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a little treasure üòç beautiful site in-between Preston & Blackpool with a David Bellamy award for conservation. Well maintained, clean & good facilities. CCTV in operation, only one entrance, locked 24/7 with a key on arival for access. Mrs Johnson the owner is lovely & takes no deposit, payment on arrival. Cash only & don't forget some 50 pence change for the showers.
Nearest local amenities are approx 1.8 miles. Blackpool, Lytham & st Anne's approx 7-8 miles. A definite stay over for the Blackpool airshow. Look out for the bunny's üêáüê∞

showerReviews.reviewText:
A beautiful well kept hideaway where the local wildlife blend with their visitors .. so peaceful surrounded by joyful playful rabbits that hop around with grace .. they are unafraid and plentiful giving such a pleasant atmosphere to be around ..

I arrive late to the Blackpool area with my two young boys .. we hadn‚Äôt booked anywhere ..
I gave little orchard a call and the call for help was met with an outstanding level of proactivity to get me too site and make sure myself and my boys had a beautiful safe place to stay for the weekend .
The owner a lovely helpful caring lady went out of her way to guide us in .. meet us at the gate .. show us the toilets and showers .. escort us to our pitch ( it was dark ) .. made sure we had electric ..

The site was perfect for us and we stayed all weekend travelling in and around Blackpool during the day .. to be welcomed by the many joyful hopping rabbits on our return .

My boys absolutely loved our weekend it turned out perfect .
showerReviews.author: turL

showerReviews.reviewText: Just got home from a fantastic 5 night stay at Little Orchard Caravan Park.  Mrs. Johnson is a fantastic host and made us feel so welcome.   The dog walking field is well kept and the gates make it feel secure.  Pitches are hard standing ones and electric and water is close to the pitches, we never had any issues with them.  We took our son who loved the freedom to bike around the site, we felt relaxed knowing the main gate is locked and he couldn't go anywhere other than on the site.  We didn't use the showers but the toilet was clean and tidy and Mrs. Johnson is always about making sure everything is OK.  We will be returning as the site is relaxing and a world away from daily life.  Highly recommended
showerReviews.author: Gemma Sikes

showerReviews.reviewText: What a lovey spacious site. Large spaced out gravel and grass pitches  around  a central  grassed area. There are three  large areas  with at least  twelve pitches  on  each  area. All pitches have electric hook up. lots of water points and bins.  There is also a large dog walking  field. There is a toilet  and shower  block  which  is basic but clean. shower  and hairdryers costs 50p. Was met on arrival at the gate by the lovely owener Linda who told us about the site which is a family  run site, she provide  us with  a key  to the locked barrier  and said to drive  around  a choose our pitch. Site is lovely  and peaceful  with  very very  slight  distant road noise. ¬£27 per night.
showerReviews.author: Jan Robinson

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed bank holiday weekend 28/05/21. Lovely quiet place and Linda was welcoming and stern too. Guess that‚Äôs the best way to be in this industry. Linda drove around a couple of times which I felt was good that she kept an eye on things. Dog walking field was good and gated off. A little inconvenient unlocking and opening the entry/exit gate each time but added benefit of safety there. Only the disabled toilet and shower room available for 30 caravans so a little inconvenient. However once the one ladies and one gents is opened this will be better. Chemical waste point was a plastic bin lid over a sewer drain so could cause splash back if you weren‚Äôt careful. Could do with better some cleaning agent left there. A nice stay and would definitely go back.
showerReviews.author: Kev Smith

showerReviews.reviewText: Our first venture away in our caravan during the bank holiday weekend. We had a fantastic time. Lovely quiet site and only a 20 minute drive to the beach. Linda was a great hostess. As it was out first time, she checked to make sure all was OK and set us off on our way home. Only 2 toilets open but this was no issue and never had to queue. 50p to use the shower but get ample time (5 minutes or so) and the showers are very powerful (not great for sunburn), absolutely loved it and will be booking again for the summer. Thanks Linda - beautiful site with some lovely caravanners.
showerReviews.author: Marash 911

showerReviews.reviewText: ABSOLUTELY DONT RECOMMEND ! We booked this caravan park for a week for the kids, upon arrival we where told they booked us in for the following month , was sorted and put us into another caravan which was absolutely not cleaned there was coffee all over the worktops , cutlery was dirty , floors where dirty under the beds where disgusting , spider webs and spiders everywhere , decking was filthy and no gate even tho we booked the one we did because we needed a gate for our dog, no bin bags no washing liquid no toilet roll , no bedding on my sons beds had to go ask for it, beds terrible can feel the spring , duvet and pillows that old they are as flat as a pancake!  for ¬£720 I‚Äôd have expected it to be to a high standard , absolutely shocking ! I‚Äôve stayed in a lot of caravan parks and this is by far the worse for cleanliness and to charge that price and penny pinch with not even a bin bag is a joke ! Won‚Äôt ever be returning and won‚Äôt be recommending either !
